story:
Support The Relight America Intern Apprenticeship Program

This Program is managed through student interns
creating New Media Marketing Initiatives to relight
local communities to spread Success to everyone Involved.
We have big plan and need your help!



The Intern Apprenticeship Program
It's a Win-Win-Win Program.

This program Is making new age marketing affordable to local businesses.
We are working as a group to promote the success of everyone involved.
Will you get involved?

Everyone working together is the formula for success in today's new economy.
We hope you'll choose to help support our community initiative.

(Offer Request for support)
Please Help Support Us By Making a Small Contribution
or Get Involved as a Sponsor.

  

Meet our team 


Also see The USGMG team Link

We provide new media and mobile marketing solutions for “Really small businesses”

Affordable marketing strategies and practical loyalty solutions to grow your business.

The thing about our business that really motivates me is our apprenticeship program working with the local business community to ReLight America by working with young entrepreneurs.

story:
The Goal

Made With Love needs $15,000 to open its doors by June 2019! Click on the perks to get an expanded description of what your donation gets you!

Short Summary

Hi, I'm Callie Johnson, the founder and owner of Made With Love Bakery. Baking has been a part of my life for as long as I can remember. It has always been a way for me to show love to others, hence the name "Made With Love." When I bake something I put care and intentionality into every step of the process.

Earliest Picture of Myself Baking

Creating a space where others feel loved and welcome has been a dream of mine since the sixth grade. Four years of baking out of my certified home kitchen, selling treats at farmers’ markets, saving money, putting my entire life's savings into this dream, and never giving up have brought me to an incredible opportunity where I finally get the chance to open my very own bakery in Spokane, WA, a city that I love.

2017 Farmers' Market Season

The bakery is intentionally located in West Central, a lower income neighborhood. I want anyone to be able to come in and enjoy a cup of coffee or sweet treat regardless of their income or economic status. Here’s where I need your help! Made With Love needs $15,000 to open its doors by June 2019. Please donate so that, together, we can bring baked treats, delicious coffee, and a welcoming space to this little corner of Spokane.

Front of Made With Love Bakery

 

What We Need & What You Get

Made With Love Bakery is requesting $15,000 to help with the process of opening a storefront. This will go towards:

  • a front counter ($1,000) 
  • tables and seating ($1,450)
  • lighting ($500)
  • paint ($750)
  • espresso machine ($5,500)
  • grinder and other coffee equipment ($2,175)
  • other miscellaneous costs including signage, dishes, etc.

Pictures of the Current Space

Fun thank you perks include stickers, tote bags, pie for a year, and even free coffee for life if you purchase the espresso machine!

 

The Impact

If you donate to my fundraiser, you will be helping me create a place where I invite people in and care for them. This bakery will be a place for the community to meet up and connect and a place where love and kindness is spread.

Made With Love Bakery Storefront

 

Risks & Challenges

Giving to a startup can be a risk. You can feel confident in supporting me because:

  • Made With Love has been seen continual growth in sales at farmers' markets over the past three years.
  • Lots of new customers were gained because of Made With Love's presence at the markets. 
  • I have a degree in business administration from Gonzaga where my professors are still willing to offer advice and support. 
  • I am a hard worker and am not afraid to ask for help.

2018 Farmers' Market Season

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand that giving monetarily is not something everyone can do. Something you CAN do though is share this campaign on your own social media! Please let others know why supporting Made With Love Bakery is a good decision!

story:
Check out our website: 

www.affordableholistic.weebly.com 

Short Summary

  • We are C+CHE's Holistic Action Circle. C+CHE (Community + County Health Empowerment) is a grassroots volunteer group of patients, healthcare providers and community organizers who believe in dignity, justice and quality healthcare for all. One of our goals is to improve public healthcare. A form of organizing is our Health Action Circles, which are autonomous circles led by patients/organizers centered around health related issues. 
  • One project we are working on is creating a guide to affordable holistic healthcare in Los Angeles County.
  • This guide is intended to be distributed among our community members, patients, healthcare practitioners and healthcare providers for patients who do not have internet access.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We hope to raise at least $500 to cover printing expenses of our guide which we are planning on distributing both electronically and paper form. The more money we raise equals more guides printed. Any excess money  we raise will go towards paying the expenses of our fundraiser event and a website. 
  • We will give you a copy of our guide as a perk of donating to this campaign. 
  • Any money we raise will go towards the printing expenses regardless if we meet our goal or not and will help the authors of the guide from pulling money directly out of our pockets. 

The Impact

  • This guide is a valuable resource to all who are seeking affordable healthcare in Los Angeles.
  • We look forward to this guide in engaging more patients, practitioners, community members and volunteers in our long-term goal of reforming the healthcare system in Los Angeles County.
  • We believe access to quality healthcare and alternative care plays a crucial role in creating a society that is more harmonious and compassionate.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you yourself cannot contribute to our campaign, you can spread the word of our campaign via email, facebook, twitter or an social media. 
  • We are always seeking more affordable holistic practitioners, so if you are a practitioner yourself or know someone who is, please contact us to be included in any future versions of the guide. 
  • Another way to participate is by joining C+CHE's movement to create a better healthcare system by attending our monthly meeting. More details at our facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/goCCHE.
  • Lastly, we always accept prayers and good vibes in continuing our making our vision a reality.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
INTRODUCING

WAYTAP BY FIZZICS

 

We're proud to introduce Waytap, the newest in the Fizzics line with a redesign that's smaller, more compact to specifically fit bottles/cans.

​

CLICK HERE TO LEARN MORE ABOUT WAYTAP

 

 

 

Fizzics is changing the way people drink beer at home and on the go. 

Meet Fizzics, the world’s first and only universal beer dispenser that delivers an awesome fresh from the tap experience from any can, bottle or growler.

Fizzics Founder and CEO Phil Petracca talks about how The Fizzics System improves the flavor and taste of beer on FOX News.

http://video.foxnews.com/v/4621946046001/the-fizzics-of-making-beer-taste-better/?#sp=show-clips

 

Check out FIZZICS ON BeTerrific.com:

 

 

 

 

 


 

 

 

Fizzics is a revolutionary beer system curating a draft quality experience straight from any store-bought, off the shelf beer. 

No longer are expertly poured, quality draft beer experiences exclusive to the high end craft beer bars.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

CLICK HERE to learn more.

 

 

 

 

It is compatible with all standard size glass bottles including most “Bombers” (22-oz bottle package format) and cans from 16-oz “Tall Boys” to 32-oz “Man Cans" or the Fizzics 64oz growlers.

 

 

  

 

Fizzics applies science & technology to stimulate your 5 senses, beyond what store bought is capable of.

 

 

You know from personal experience, a good draft beer just tastes better! 

We are about to show you the science of how and why Fizzics does what it does and why it is better than your normal draft.

With Fizzics, you'll be a beer sommelier in no time.

 

 

Brewers spend a lot of time and effort to ensure that their beer froths, foams, bubbles, effervesces, sparkles or fizzes in an appealing manner.

 

Bubbles and fizz are essential because:

  

Fizzics controls pressure flow, fluid and gas dynamics to create a rich, creamy foam (head) that enhances the appearance, texture, smoothness and mouthfeel.

     

    Fizzics underlies the different phases of fizz: 

    Nucleation (bubble starts to form), Beading (bubbles rise to form a head), Disproportionation (bubbles mature).

     

     

     

    Beading is the constant replenishment of foam through gas breakout or simply the process of when bubbles rise to form head.

     

     

    Ostwald ripening is a phenomenon of adjacent bubbles at different pressures passing from small bubble (higher pressure) to large bubble (lower pressure).

     

     

    As beer drains from the foam, the walls of the bubbles start to touch and then merge (coalesce) to produce larger, more unstable bubbles.

     

     

     

    This is truly a scientific revolution for the modern beer drinker.

     

     

    Never settle for drinking the same beer from a giant size keg or limit your beer options again.  Choose from thousands of macro or craft brews from your local beer retailer, bar or brewer.

     

     

    Fizzics is the first beer dispensing system that provides complete control over every single step of enjoying your favorite brew.

    Choose your favorite beer variety to fine-tuning the exact level of foam to top off your masterpiece to recreate the draught quality and fine craftsmanship that you previously enjoyed from your favorite bartender’s pour.

     

    No over-pour, spillage or wasted beer again.  

    Anti-microbial drip matt and system canister separates from dispensing manifold for easy rinsing and washing. 

     

    You can enjoy fresh draft quality beer in seconds with just the pull of a tap.

      

    Brings the simple pleasure of serving and enjoying draught quality beer as easy as opening/closing a lid and pulling/pushing a tap handle.

     

     

    All resins are FDA approved food-grade materials and assembled using stainless steel hardware. Designed to comply with FDA, FCC, CE and RoHS standards. 

    All components are manufactured, assembled and packaged in a positive pressure Class 100 Clean Room environment and regularly subjected to rigorous testing to meet the stringent requirements of the FDA.

      

    One of a kind beer appliance and “premiumization” system for any style beer. 

    One system serving vast macro beer and craft ecosystem to help beer lovers discover the magic behind every variety of beer. 

    Concentration of aromatics, body and texture with all your favorite brews, including IPAs, Hefeweizens, Pilsners, Brown Ales and more.

     

     

     

     

     

     

    We’ve drawn on a combined 60 years of commercializing new technologies; leveraging our mechanical engineering, product-design and consumer electronic experience to design a one of kind appliance that we believe will innovate, inspire, and invigorate the craft beer industry.

     

     

    Philip Petracca - CEO

    Entrepreneur and Technology Industry Executive demonstrating more than two decades of strategy, marketing, product and business development success. Comprehensive leadership abilities, spearheading daily business operations with emphasis on brand development and attainment of competitive market placement. Exceptional solutions-driven success in development, manufacturing, and technical settings. 

      Phil is the consummate beer geek with a true passion for big flavored beers and craft community that’s ushering in a renaissance in beer.

    David McDonald – CTO

    Founder JAM-Proactive Design.  Certified mechanical engineer with over 25 years experience at top design firm and electronic manufacturers.  Expertise in Product design, CAD, SolidWorks and Design for Manufacturing and Rapid state manufacturing with leading Asian ODMs and manufacturers.  

    David is a huge craft beer enthusiast and has been brewing beer at home for almost ten years.

     

     

     

     

    Why can’t I just drink beer straight from the bottle or can?

    We believe beer is liquid art which deserves to be respected and consumed the way Brew-masters intended. Just as one would never drink wine or spirits straight from the bottle, it’s highly recommended to pour beer into proper glassware to release its full potential and maximize aroma and flavor.

    Can’t I just simply pour my beer into a glass to generate foam?

    Yes and No.  A hand pour provides mechanical agitation that will create foam of randomly packed bubbles of non-uniform shapes that will occupy more space thus are inherently less dense and frothy.  However, only Fizzics eliminates unsightly, bloated bubbles which contribute to foam collapse.  Our device packs small, dense bubbles to preserve the hoppy flavor in beer while providing a wonderful mouthfeel of creamy wet foam.

    Why is foam important?

    Foam is an integral part of beer quality and overall drinking experience.  It’s visually appealing, enhances aroma, flavor and mouthfeel of beer and is expected by all serious beer drinkers.

    How does Fizzics compare to other draft beer dispensers or kegerators?

    Most all beer system is powered by a set of equipment (keg, faucet handle, tower, regulator, beer & air lines, CO2 and nitrogen tanks) that must work together for a successful pour.  Fizzics is a compact, personal system that utilizes the inherent properties of conditioned and commercially packaged beer coupled with our technology to control the pressure of CO2 wanting to come out of solution and influence foam generation and beer head retention. 

    Can I use any bottle or cans?

    Yes.  Fizzics serves a vast universe of macro and craft beers and is compatible with all standard size glass bottles including most “Bombers” (22-oz bottle package format) and cans from 16-oz “Tall Boys” to 32-oz “Man Cans.”

    Can Fizzics be used with other carbonated beverages besides beer?

    Our system is optimized for beer

    How do you clean Fizzics?

    Cleaning Fizzics is very easy.  Run a glass of water or fill an empty, clean can or bottle with water to flush any excess beer residue.  The lid can be removed to easily clean the inside of the canister.  The anti-microbial drip matt and hose separates for easily rinsing and washing. Please check our TubeTube channel for a technical video with cleaning information.

    What type of beverages are compatible with Fizzics?

    Fizzics is compatible with all standard-sized beer cans and beer bottles and requires no expensive consumable or proprietary keg or accessories. Whether it's an IPA, Hefeweizen, Pilsner, Brown Ale, or any other popular brew - Fizzics will pour it perfectly.

    Can I use any bottle or cans?

    Yes.  Fizzics serves a vast universe of macro and craft beers and is compatible with all standard size glass bottles including most “Bombers” (22-oz bottle package format) and cans from 16-oz “Tall Boys” to 32-oz “Man Cans.”

    Why can’t I just drink beer straight from the bottle or can?

    We believe beer is liquid art which deserves to be respected and consumed the way Brew-masters intended. Just as one would never drink wine or spirits straight from the bottle, it’s highly recommended to pour beer into proper glassware to release its full potential and maximize aroma and flavor.

    Can’t I just simply pour my beer into a glass to generate foam?

    Yes and No.  A hand pour provides mechanical agitation that will create foam of randomly packed bubbles of non-uniform shapes that will occupy more space thus are inherently less dense and frothy.  However, only Fizzics eliminates unsightly, bloated bubbles which contribute to foam collapse.  Our device packs small, dense bubbles to preserve the hoppy flavor in beer while providing a wonderful mouthfeel of creamy wet foam.

    Why is foam important?

    Foam is an integral part of beer quality and overall drinking experience.  It’s visually appealing, enhances aroma, flavor and mouthfeel of beer and is expected by all serious beer drinkers.

    How does Fizzics compare to other draft beer dispensers or kegerators?

    Most all beer system is powered by a set of equipment (keg, faucet handle, tower, regulator, beer & air lines, CO2 and nitrogen tanks) that must work together for a successful pour.  Fizzics is a compact, personal system that utilizes the inherent properties of conditioned and commercially packaged beer coupled with our technology to control the pressure of CO2 wanting to come out of solution and influence foam generation and beer head retention. 

    Can Fizzics be used with other carbonated beverages besides beer?

    Our system is optimized for beer.

    How do you clean Fizzics?

    Cleaning Fizzics is very easy.  Run a glass of water or fill an empty, clean can or bottle with water to flush any excess beer residue.  The lid can be removed to easily clean the inside of the canister.  The anti-microbial drip matt and hose separates for easily rinsing and washing. Please check our TubeTube channel for a technical video with cleaning information.


    Should my glass be cold?

    While the can or bottle of beer you insert should always be cold - the glass is up to you. We always recommend a freshly water-rinsed beer mug or glass - but for flavor sake, please don't freeze or frost your glass.

    What kind of batteries does the Fizzics use?

    Fizzics is powered by 4 standard AA batteries.

    Does Fizzics come in different colors?

    At this time, there is only one color available for the Fizzics beer system, but we will explore other options in the future.

    What's special about a beer poured from Fizzics?

    Fizzics provides an enhanced aroma, flavor and taste as well as a smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Scientifically engineered using patent-pending fluid & gas technology to create an ultra-dense, long-lasting foam head. The technology that went into Fizzics is both highly complex and strikingly simple. Easy to operate and portable, Fizzics provides for enhanced balance and sensational mouthfeel. 

    Are the materials in Fizzics FDA approved?

    Yes. All components are manufactured, assembled and packaged in a positive pressure Class 100 Clean Room environment and regularly subjected to rigorous testing to meet the stringent requirements of the FDA. All resins are FDA approved food-grade materials and assembled using stainless steel hardware. Designed to comply with FDA, FCC, CE and RoHS standards and regulations. 

    When will Fizzics ship?

    In Stock and currently shipping.

    How is US/Canada shipping handled?

    Please add $25 for Canadian shipping and $5 for growler.

    How is international shipping handled?

    Due to differentiation between countries and territories, international shipping will be paid separately by everyone who pledges internationally. This will include import regulations, payment of import duties and taxes. Near the end of the campaign, or in the week(s) following, the Fizzics team will contact you for your calculated shipping payment. The package dimensions are as follows and will ship from either Hong Kong or the USA:

    Width: 8"/20.3cm 

    Depth: 10"/25.4cm 

    Height: 17"/43.2cm 

    Weight: 5.5lbs / 2.3kg

    Can I cancel my perk and/or get a refund?

    Indiegogo policy dictates that campaign owners have no ability to adjust perk selections. That means we cannot upgrade your perk, we cannot change your perk and we cannot cancel your perk. Please note that contributions made on Indiegogo are also non-refundable.

     

     

     

     

     
    TechCrunch Disrupt NYC

    Check out the Fizzics team presenting at TechCrunch Disrupt NYC.Get Fizzics ➨ http://igg.me/at/Fizzics-Better-Beer

    Posted by Fizzics on Thursday, May 7, 2015

Most all beer system is powered by a set of equipment (keg, faucet handle, tower, regulator, beer & air lines, CO2 and nitrogen tanks) that must work together for a successful pour.  Fizzics is a compact, personal system that utilizes the inherent properties of conditioned and commercially packaged beer coupled with our technology to control the pressure of CO2 wanting to come out of solution and influence foam generation and beer head retention. 
Can I use any bottle or cans?
Yes.  Fizzics serves a vast universe of macro and craft beers and is compatible with all standard size glass bottles including most “Bombers” (22-oz bottle package format) and cans from 16-oz “Tall Boys” to 32-oz “Man Cans.”
Can Fizzics be used with other carbonated beverages besides beer?
Our system is optimized for beer
How do you clean Fizzics?
Cleaning Fizzics is very easy.  Run a glass of water or fill an empty, clean can or bottle with water to flush any excess beer residue.  The lid can be removed to easily clean the inside of the canister.  The anti-microbial drip matt and hose separates for easily rinsing and washing. Please check our TubeTube channel for a technical video with cleaning information.
What type of beverages are compatible with Fizzics?
Fizzics is compatible with all standard-sized beer cans and beer bottles and requires no expensive consumable or proprietary keg or accessories. Whether it's an IPA, Hefeweizen, Pilsner, Brown Ale, or any other popular brew - Fizzics will pour it perfectly.
Can I use any bottle or cans?
Yes.  Fizzics serves a vast universe of macro and craft beers and is compatible with all standard size glass bottles including most “Bombers” (22-oz bottle package format) and cans from 16-oz “Tall Boys” to 32-oz “Man Cans.”
Why can’t I just drink beer straight from the bottle or can?
We believe beer is liquid art which deserves to be respected and consumed the way Brew-masters intended. Just as one would never drink wine or spirits straight from the bottle, it’s highly recommended to pour beer into proper glassware to release its full potential and maximize aroma and flavor.
Can’t I just simply pour my beer into a glass to generate foam?
Yes and No.  A hand pour provides mechanical agitation that will create foam of randomly packed bubbles of non-uniform shapes that will occupy more space thus are inherently less dense and frothy.  However, only Fizzics eliminates unsightly, bloated bubbles which contribute to foam collapse.  Our device packs small, dense bubbles to preserve the hoppy flavor in beer while providing a wonderful mouthfeel of creamy wet foam.
Why is foam important?
Foam is an integral part of beer quality and overall drinking experience.  It’s visually appealing, enhances aroma, flavor and mouthfeel of beer and is expected by all serious beer drinkers.
How does Fizzics compare to other draft beer dispensers or kegerators?
Most all beer system is powered by a set of equipment (keg, faucet handle, tower, regulator, beer & air lines, CO2 and nitrogen tanks) that must work together for a successful pour.  Fizzics is a compact, personal system that utilizes the inherent properties of conditioned and commercially packaged beer coupled with our technology to control the pressure of CO2 wanting to come out of solution and influence foam generation and beer head retention. 
Can Fizzics be used with other carbonated beverages besides beer?
Our system is optimized for beer.
How do you clean Fizzics?
Cleaning Fizzics is very easy.  Run a glass of water or fill an empty, clean can or bottle with water to flush any excess beer residue.  The lid can be removed to easily clean the inside of the canister.  The anti-microbial drip matt and hose separates for easily rinsing and washing. Please check our TubeTube channel for a technical video with cleaning information.
Should my glass be cold?
While the can or bottle of beer you insert should always be cold - the glass is up to you. We always recommend a freshly water-rinsed beer mug or glass - but for flavor sake, please don't freeze or frost your glass.
What kind of batteries does the Fizzics use?
Fizzics is powered by 4 standard AA batteries.
Does Fizzics come in different colors?
At this time, there is only one color available for the Fizzics beer system, but we will explore other options in the future.What's special about a beer poured from Fizzics?
Fizzics provides an enhanced aroma, flavor and taste as well as a smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Scientifically engineered using patent-pending fluid & gas technology to create an ultra-dense, long-lasting foam head. The technology that went into Fizzics is both highly complex and strikingly simple. Easy to operate and portable, Fizzics provides for enhanced balance and sensational mouthfeel. Are the materials in Fizzics FDA approved?
Yes. All components are manufactured, assembled and packaged in a positive pressure Class 100 Clean Room environment and regularly subjected to rigorous testing to meet the stringent requirements of the FDA. All resins are FDA approved food-grade materials and assembled using stainless steel hardware. Designed to comply with FDA, FCC, CE and RoHS standards and regulations. When will Fizzics ship?
In Stock and currently shipping.How is US/Canada shipping handled?
Please add $25 for Canadian shipping and $5 for growler.How is international shipping handled?
Due to differentiation between countries and territories, international shipping will be paid separately by everyone who pledges internationally. This will include import regulations, payment of import duties and taxes. Near the end of the campaign, or in the week(s) following, the Fizzics team will contact you for your calculated shipping payment. The package dimensions are as follows and will ship from either Hong Kong or the USA:
Width: 8"/20.3cm 
Depth: 10"/25.4cm 
Height: 17"/43.2cm 
Weight: 5.5lbs / 2.3kg
Can I cancel my perk and/or get a refund?
Indiegogo policy dictates that campaign owners have no ability to adjust perk selections. That means we cannot upgrade your perk, we cannot change your perk and we cannot cancel your perk. Please note that contributions made on Indiegogo are also non-refundable.  
 
 
 
TechCrunch Disrupt NYCCheck out the Fizzics team presenting at TechCrunch Disrupt NYC.Get Fizzics ➨ http://igg.me/at/Fizzics-Better-BeerPosted by Fizzics on Thursday, May 7, 2015

story:
Pflege bekommt ein Gesicht/Care gets a face

My name is Jörg Siegwarth. I am a trained nurse and photographer. My many years as KP in an acute psychiatric hospital and the lively exchange with colleagues has brought me to this project.

My project is to bring care of anonymity. Nurses should get a face care everyday presence without being accusatory.

Help me to support this project, which will be published as a picture book. Care is or will be part of each. Care must be public. Care must be given a human face.

In addition to portraits of nurses, the book will contain reportage photos showing a hospital everyday as it is. In addition, interviews of those portrayed are read, where they describe why nursing is the right career for them.

The first 25 portraits have been done. The next session will be August 27th. I am going to update the process regularly. The first interviews have been done also. 

You can contact me at info@joergsiegwarthphotography.com day and night to ask questions. I'll answer them all. 

I Need money. Of course.

To have it printed an illustrated book, costs money. I need Euro 9000, - for printing in an edition of 250 pieces. This is the minimum in order to successfully be able to publish..

Of the total circulation 50 limited pieces, each with a print are additionally provided and personally provided me with a dedication. This is just one of the perks that I offer you.

The highlight, however, certainly be a photo shoot that I'm going to offer you.

If I exceed the funding target, there may be a higher number of copies in order to reach even more people can. 

Make care public!

Care gets a face is a project for people by people. Maintenance concerns all of us. Care has become essential and vital. People who know professionally, what to do if the layman does not know how. All this is indeed discussed politically controversial in the media on a social, human-based but it is a big presence.

Political decisions we can influence only in an extremely limited extent Active: Social acceptance and in distress profession like nursing, but we can achieve within the population. We the people are the ones who. Determining and directing, regardless of the policy To show humanity to advertise for this profession and to show a face, which deserves care that is my concern. Help me to carry this small contribution to the public.

Of course there are the nurses who demonstrate gladly upset, ask.

This is not my concern. The possibility exists, of course, which is abused my project exactly it. Nevertheless, so far I have been able to precisely counter these claims. It is an independent project which is solely controlled by me. I understand it as an assessment of care. It is not a protest. My belief is that just as food for thought can be given. Only in this way it is possible to support care (below).

I am grateful for every contribution.

Each contribution is extremely important. Not only money, but also the language. Talk to your fellow man, you tell others. Share. The idea in social media Any support will bring us one step further.

You can find us under www.facebook.com/pflegebekommteingesicht

Thank you.


Und auf Deutsch: 
Mein Name ist Jörg Siegwarth. Ich bin gelernter Krankenpfleger und Fotograf. Meine langjährige Tätigkeit als KP in einer Akutpsychiatrischen Klinik und der rege Austausch mit Kollegen hat mich zu diesem Projekt gebracht.
Mein Projekt soll Pflege aus der Anonymität holen. Pflegekräfte sollen ein Gesicht bekommen, der Pflegealltag präsent. Ich erzähle Ihnen eine Geschichte im Pflegealltag.
Helfen Sie mir dieses Projekt, das als Bildband erscheinen soll, zu unterstützen. Pflege ist oder wird Teil eines Jeden werden. Pflege muss öffentlich werden. Pflege muss ein Gesicht bekommen.
Neben Porträts von Pflegekräften, wird das Buch Reportagefotos enthalten, die einen Krankenhausalltag so zeigen, wie er ist.  Zusätzlich sind Interviews der Porträtierten zu lesen, wo sie schildern, warum Pflege der richtige Beruf für sie ist.
Die ersten 25 Porträts sind bereits gemacht. Die nächste Session ist am 27.8.2015. Ich werde in den nächste Wochen, den Fortschritt regelmäßig updaten, damit Sie den Verlauf fast live mitbekommen.
Auch dürfen Sie mich jederzeit über info@joergsiegwarthphotography.com kontaktieren, wenn Sie Fragen haben. Ich werde alle Fragen beantworten.

Ich benötige Geld.

Einen Bildband drucken zu lassen, kostet Geld. Ich benötige Euro 9000,- für den Druck bei einer Auflage von 250 Stk. Das ist das Minimum, um erfolgreich publizieren zu können.
Von der Gesamtauflage werden 50 limitierte Stücke mit jeweils einem Print zusätzlich versehen und persönlich von mir mit einer Widmung versehen. Dies ist nur einer der Perks, die ich Ihnen anbiete. 
Das Highlight wird aber sicherlich ein Fotoshooting sein, dass ich Ihnen anbieten werde.
Sollte ich das Fundingziel übertreffen, kann es eine höhere Auflage geben, um noch mehr Menschen erreichen zu können.
Machen Sie Pflege öffentlich!
Pflege bekommt ein Gesicht ist ein Projekt von Menschen für Menschen. Pflege geht uns alle an. Pflege ist essentiell und lebensnotwendig geworden. Menschen, die professionell wissen, was zu tun ist, wenn der Laie nicht weiter weiß. Dies alles ist zwar in den Medien politisch kontrovers diskutiert, auf einer gesellschaftlichen, menschlichen Basis ist es jedoch wenig präsent. 
Politische Entscheidungen können wir aktiv nur in einem extrem eingeschränkten Maße beeinflussen: Gesellschaftliche Akzeptanz und ein in Not geratener Berufszweig wie die Pflege können wir aber innerhalb der Bevölkerung erreichen. Wir, die Menschen sind es, die das Bestimmen und Lenken, unabhängig von der Politik. Menschlichkeit zu zeigen, Werbung für diesen Beruf zu machen und ein Gesicht zu zeigen, welches Pflege verdient, das ist mein Anliegen. Helfen Sie mir, diesen kleinen Beitrag in die Öffentlichkeit zu tragen. 
Natürlich gibt es die Pflegekräfte, die demonstrieren, sich gern aufregen, fordern. 
Dies ist nicht mein Anliegen. Die Möglichkeit besteht natürlich, das mein Projekt genau dafür missbraucht wird. Dennoch, bislang habe ich genau diesen Forderungen kontern können. Es ist ein unabhängiges Projekt, das ausschließlich von mir gesteuert wird. Ich begreife es, als eine Würdigung von Pflege. Es ist kein Protest. Meine Überzeugung ist, dass nur so ein Denkanstoß gegeben werden kann. Nur so ist es möglich, Pflege zu (unter)stützen.

Ich bin für jeden Beitrag dankbar.


Jeder Beitrag ist enorm wichtig. Nicht nur Geld, sondern auch die Sprache. Sprechen Sie Ihre Mitmenschen an, sagen Sie es weiter. Teilen Sie die Idee in den sozialen Medien. Jede Unterstützung bringt uns einen Schritt weiter.
Sie finden uns unter www.facebook.com/pflegebekommteingesicht

Danke.

story:
Health clubs, spas, and wellness centers, are wonderful.  Yet, imagine a next generation 'World's Fair' of well-being' opening near you that included all of that plus much more.  ... like a learning center, farm-to-table organic restaurant, a pyramidic building whose architecture actually supported your health, a Science Center showcasing the latest healthy living products and technologies, organic farming, environmental solutions, the importance of nutrition, and a new health pyramid acknowledging both the energetic and physical aspects of health.  Oh, and what if a client-centered, integrative health practice was there, too...along with a holistic veterinarian?  If you like what you're reading... hold on because it's coming!

Introducing THE PAVILION: A Jetson's-ike 21st century branded lifestyle center that delivers the best that science, humanity, and the healing arts have to offer -- to enable people to live healthier, happier, and richer lives.

Imagine a Pavilion opening near you soon. Here's what you can expect: 

As you walk inside it's like entering another world -- with waterfalls, trees, ferns, edible plant walls, lots of glass, artwork, and cool tech all around you.  There is a
Life Sciences Center showcasing and making available to you the latest apps, technologies, and discoveries -- in health, sustainable living, energy, human performance, transportation (think electric vehicles and hovering skateboards) -- and everything you need to push the envelope; to live well and make every day count. You can even feel a new found sense of calm wash over you -- as the unique Pavilion architecture, with design technology taken from Egypt's great pyramids, begins to support your health and vitality.

Across the atrium you see the Learning Center , featuring great self-help, self-health, and self-discovery classes -- in the arts, sciences, organic gardening, cooking and raw food prep, and health and wellness.  And there are free, informative weekly lectures you're invited to attend.


    [Grow delicious, fresh foods with Pavilion high-tech, vertical hydroponics]

To help support your physical body, there's a state-of-the-art fitness center, a Mediterranean-styled Spa with infrared and amethyst saunas, hyperbaric oxygen chambers, cold lasers, Pulsed EMF devices... and even an round-the-clock laughter therapy kiosk.  A Pavilion member?  You can use these as often as you'd like.


Sound too good to be true?  We look at it like, "It sounds so good we have to make it true."  And that's exactly what we're doing! 

The Pavilion will also have plenty of social events, too. For example, you'll be able to catch an inspiring TED-like talk after work, or meet up with friends in the farm-to-table restaurant or the organic wine bar!  Monthly themed block parties? Count on it... because we believe that life is to be lived to its fullest.

If ever a sports injury or health issue arises, the advanced, Integrative Health Bio-Center, complete with integrative physicians, acupuncturists, nutritionists, energy psychologists, holistic dentists, and trained health coaches, has got you covered.  

WAKE UP INSPIRED EVERY DAY

Like the bridge of the Starship Enterprise, this Pavilion can be your pipeline to an expanded universe -- and to a healthier, smarter, faster, happier, more capable, YOU. 


Of course, there would be a whole Pavilion community of like minded people who would be sharing this journey with you.  How would it feel to wake up to that every day?  And what if you invited friends and they, too, got inspired?  How long would it be before Pavilion communities everywhere created an evolution ... a revolution... in healthy, engaged, and impassioned living?  And what if YOU helped make it all possible!?     

     

          Pavilion partner WTS International manages projects in 30 countries

With the groundwork completed, a world class advisory board and management team signed on (including WTS International, one of the world's leading names in the design and management of health resorts and healthy living communities), we're ready to launch. Leading sport and health club industry guru, Bobby Verdun said, "I see The Pavilion as both an inspiring contribution to the people it will touch, and a solid, long term, sustainable business model capable of generating strong cash flow and giving even more back to the community." 

Please support this campaign and help us get the first Pavilion up and running in the nation's capital.  Why DC? We believe a presence in Washington will greatly accelerate The Pavilion's growth potential, given the many luminaries, dignitaries, and change-agents who continually pass through Washington.  Besides, we sorely need some changes around here and what better place to model that than in our nation's capital?  As one of my heroes, Buckminster Fuller said, "You never change things by fighting the existing reality.  To change things, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete."  Exactly!

By showcasing the latest in science, innovation, and forward thinking, Pavilion's can help us revitalize and heal America, and perhaps inspire that American drive and ingenuity that made us a beacon of light for the world back in the 20th century.     

On behalf of myself and The Pavilion board and management, thank you for your consideration and support. 

                                       Jim Grapek, Pavilion Founder & CEO
 

What We Need & What You Get

At the minimum we need about $20,000 -- but $62,000 would be amazing.  In return, you get my heart felt thanks and become part of our team... to provide ongoing input and ideas as you desire. 

What will the funds be used for? 

  1. We really want to get get our non-profit, Pavilion Integrative Health Insurance program started!  $16,000 will go to begin the necessary legal filings and groundwork to set this up. The Affordable Care Act has a provision that allows for the establishment of new health insurance companies -- as long as they are not-for-profit and consumer centric, and have a consumer board.  That's fine by me.  I mean... shouldn't insurance companies be consumer focused? Pavilion Board Member Dr. Mark McClure and I -- Dr. McClure founded a dental insurance plan called DentiCare and was President of Capital Integrative Health University in Washington -- are working to roll out a better brand of health insurance even before Pavilions are built. Eventually we'll create a network of top, integrative care providers whose focus is to keep you healthy. And our insurance company will work closely with our nonprofit Pavilion Life Sciences Center (see #2) and the Academy of Comprehensive Integrative Medicine to get you the best SELF HEALTH information out there to keep you in top shape.  [Speaking of Self Health, did you know that about 85% of the health issues experienced by most people can safely and effectively be taken care of without needing to visit a doctor or healthcare provider?]  
  2. To continue needed development of The Pavilion Life Sciences Center, a 501c3.  That includes retaining the right consultant and attending the American Alliance of Museums annual upcoming conference in Atlanta.  (The early bird discount ends February 27th).  I'm super excited about this Science Center. 

    Trust me, you won't find exhibits like ours at The Smithsonian.  In the book "Hot Topics, Public Culture, Museums', Emlyn Koster, former Director of the Liberty Science Center, notes that the majority of museums, as social institutions, have largely avoided confronting convention.  Yet museums and science centers could, and should confront convention, and strive to serve their communities as 'think tanks' for successful, ongoing initiatives to insure the health and vibrancy of the community.  This is how I see the role of these Pavilion Life Sciences Centers... in cities all over.   [Est. $12,500 for consultant's REPORT and flushing out exhibits... and conference for 2].  Again, we will post highlights of the report... and what we determine to be the most important exhibits, and ask for your feedback.
  3. Have you ever had a health problem arise and wonder, "Should I see my regular doctor.. or get acupuncture... or chiropractic... or maybe homeopathy?"  Or maybe you wondered, "Why can't all of these people talk to each other and figure out a better, more comprehensive and inclusive approach to health?"  Exactly!  I think about that all the time -- along with Dr. McClure, Dr. Cowden, and many others.  $7,500 will go towards working with these Board Members, with The Academy of Comprehensive, Integrative Medicine, and bringing health practitioner panels together, to begin mapping out new standards & protocols to cover this relatively uncharted mind/body/soul terrain known as "integrative medicine".  Too often, the "integrative" service being delivered is still built on the conventional medical model and is a mish-mash of various elements.  We must and can do better, and I'm serious about the part of our slogan which reads, 'Reshaping the future of health'.  This road map will be posted for you as it becomes available.  Expect the first installment in late spring or summer.


  4. There may be a lot of websites and health portals out there, but there are a lot of devastating health issues, too.  Our research has found that there is still a need for reliable, smart, integrative health information that has been vetted... and is user friendly.  To that extent, we have identified a proprietary web platform, and developer, with something capable of meeting our lofty demands and want to move forward as soon as possible to lock down him and his team before someone else does, and start on the work at hand.  Our first assignment -- tackling Autism and giving parents and the Autism community some much needed relief to this devastating disease.  Following that, we'll begin on heart disease, cancer, diabetes and so on, the idea being to provide the best and most user friendly experience for someone -- whether newly diagnosed or otherwise.  Our goal is get our first HEALTH website up within 6 months.  This Pavilion exclusive can help sooo many people -- and even more-so when Pavilions start producing evidence based DATA we can start feeding back.  [Est. $26,000 plus]     

The Impact

Enormous.  Not only for thousands... perhaps millions of people, but for the environment, and ultimately world peace, as well. The Pavilion Life Sciences Center and The Pavilion's advanced, integrative health Bio-Center, will offer so much in the way of critical, life changing information and health discoveries that they are sure to spark an evolution in better living.  To paraphrase Nelson Mandela, 'Education is the most powerful tool which you can use to change the world'.  And that.... we will have lots of!

Why Me?

Because when I developed asthma a number of years back and my doctor said I would need inhalers and medication for the rest of my life... I told him that wasn't acceptable.  Over time, I cured myself of asthma ... and later high blood pressure, joint pain, and a few other things, so I have plenty of firsthand experience to share.  I also produced hundreds of educational programs and courses on health related issues -- for clients in both conventional medicine and complementary medicine. Other good 'why me' reasons include I've run large restaurants, hospital food service, worked with a resort hotel, graduated from Cornell's Hotel School (which teaches this stuff), raised kids, WAS a kid <LOL> and more -- which you can read about on my BIO.  

Risks & Challenges

There should not be any substantial setbacks or issues, at least not with regard to fulfillment.  We already have most of the items to send out.  However, with regard to teleconferences, calls, meetings, webinars and things having to do with 'live' people, there is always the possibility that something could happen which could prevent a person from fulfilling their obligation.  In such a case we will do our best to find a close match -- to fulfill our commitment to you. 

As far as risks and challenges with actually getting The Pavilion, or any sizable enterprise up and running, there are, of course, plenty.  These are addressed in our business plan.  Of course, to mitigate these risks, we have on board some of the best professionals our there in their respective fields… and a market, and zeitgeist, that's in alignment with, and waiting for, the evolutionary lifestyle and solutions The Pavilion will bring forward.

Thank you again your consideration.  Your support -- even just sharing our links and raising awareness about our campaign -- sends a strong message to all of us, and potential investors, philanthropists-donors, sponsors, and partners, that the time is right for The Pavilion… and for everyone to enjoy healthier, richer, lives and a better future.
story_txt:
Health clubs, spas, and wellness centers, are wonderful.  Yet, imagine a next generation 'World's Fair' of well-being' opening near you that included all of that plus much more.  ... like a learning center, farm-to-table organic restaurant, a pyramidic building whose architecture actually supported your health, a Science Center showcasing the latest healthy living products and technologies, organic farming, environmental solutions, the importance of nutrition, and a new health pyramid acknowledging both the energetic and physical aspects of health.  Oh, and what if a client-centered, integrative health practice was there, too...along with a holistic veterinarian?  If you like what you're reading... hold on because it's coming! 
Introducing THE PAVILION: A Jetson's-ike 21st century
 branded lifestyle center that delivers the best that science, 
humanity, and the healing arts have to offer -- to enable people to live 
healthier, happier, and richer lives. Imagine a Pavilion opening near you soon. Here's what you can expect:  As you walk inside it's like entering another world -- with waterfalls,
trees, ferns, edible plant walls, lots of glass, artwork, and cool tech all around you.  There is a Life Sciences Center
showcasing and making available to you the latest apps, technologies, and
discoveries -- in health, sustainable living, energy, human
performance, transportation (think electric vehicles and hovering skateboards) --
and everything you need to push the envelope; to live well and make every day count. You can even feel a new found sense of calm wash over you -- as the unique Pavilion architecture, with design technology taken from Egypt's great pyramids, begins to support
your health and vitality. Across the atrium you
see the Learning Center , featuring great self-help, self-health, and self-discovery classes -- in the arts, sciences, organic gardening, cooking and raw food prep, and health and wellness.  And there are free, informative weekly lectures you're invited to attend.    [Grow delicious, fresh foods with Pavilion high-tech, vertical hydroponics] To help support your physical body, there's a state-of-the-art fitness center, a Mediterranean-styled Spa with infrared and amethyst saunas, hyperbaric oxygen chambers, cold
lasers, Pulsed EMF devices... and even an round-the-clock laughter therapy kiosk.  A Pavilion member?  You can use these as often as you'd like.
Sound too good to be true?  We look at it like, "It sounds so good we have to make it true."  And that's exactly what we're doing!  The Pavilion will also have plenty of social events, too. For example, you'll be able to catch an inspiring TED-like talk after work, or meet up with friends in the farm-to-table restaurant or the organic wine bar!  Monthly themed block parties? Count on it... because we believe that life is to be lived to its fullest. If ever a sports injury or health issue arises, the advanced, Integrative Health Bio-Center, complete with integrative physicians,
acupuncturists, nutritionists, energy psychologists, holistic
dentists, and trained health coaches, has got you covered.   
WAKE UP INSPIRED EVERY DAY
Like
the bridge of the Starship Enterprise,
this Pavilion can be your
pipeline to an expanded universe -- and to a healthier, smarter, faster,
happier, more capable, YOU.  


Of course, there would be a whole Pavilion community of like minded people who would be sharing this journey with you.  How
would it feel to wake up to that every day?  And
what if you invited friends and they, too, got inspired?  How long would it be before Pavilion communities everywhere created an evolution ... a revolution... in healthy, engaged, and impassioned living?  And what if YOU helped make it all possible!?      
      

          Pavilion partner WTS International manages projects in 30 countriesWith the groundwork completed, a world class advisory board and
management team signed on (including WTS International, one of the world's leading names in the design and
management of health resorts and healthy
living communities), we're ready to launch. Leading sport and health club industry guru, Bobby Verdun said, "I see The Pavilion as
both an inspiring contribution to the people it will touch, and a solid, long
term, sustainable business model capable of generating strong cash flow and giving even more back to
the community."  Please support this campaign
and help us get the first Pavilion up and running in the nation's capital.  Why DC? We believe a presence in Washington will
greatly accelerate The Pavilion's growth potential, given the many luminaries, dignitaries, and
change-agents who continually pass through Washington.  Besides, we sorely need some changes around here and what better place to model that than in our nation's capital?  As one of my heroes, Buckminster Fuller said, "You never change things by fighting the existing
reality.  To change things, build a new model that makes the existing model
obsolete."  Exactly!By showcasing the latest in science, innovation, and forward thinking, Pavilion's can help us revitalize and heal America, and perhaps inspire that American drive and ingenuity that made us a beacon of light for the world back in the 20th century.      On
behalf of myself and The Pavilion
board and management, thank you for your consideration and
support.                                         Jim Grapek, Pavilion Founder & CEO  
 What We Need & What You Get At the minimum we need about $20,000 -- but $62,000 would be amazing.  In return, you get my heart felt thanks and become part of our team... to provide ongoing input and ideas as you desire.  
What will the funds be used for?  


We really want to get get our non-profit, Pavilion Integrative Health Insurance program started!   $16,000 will go to begin the necessary legal filings and groundwork to set this up. The Affordable Care Act has a provision that allows for the establishment of new health insurance companies -- as long as they are not-for-profit and consumer centric, and have a consumer board.  That's fine by me.  I mean... shouldn't insurance companies be consumer focused? Pavilion Board Member Dr. Mark McClure and I -- Dr. McClure founded a dental insurance plan called DentiCare and was President of Capital Integrative Health University in Washington -- are working to roll out a better brand of health insurance even before Pavilions are built. Eventually we'll create a network of top, integrative care providers whose focus is to keep you healthy. And our insurance company will work closely with our nonprofit Pavilion Life Sciences Center (see #2) and the Academy of Comprehensive Integrative Medicine to get you the best SELF HEALTH information out there to keep you in top shape.  [Speaking of Self Health, did you know that about 85% of the health issues experienced by most people can safely and effectively be taken care of without needing to visit a doctor or healthcare provider?]   


To continue needed development of The Pavilion Life Sciences Center, a 501c3.  That includes retaining the right consultant and attending the American Alliance of Museums annual upcoming conference in Atlanta.  (The early bird discount ends February 27th).  I'm super excited about this Science Center.  Trust me, you won't find exhibits like ours at The Smithsonian.  In the book "Hot Topics, Public Culture, Museums', Emlyn Koster, former Director of the Liberty Science Center, notes that the majority of museums, as social institutions, have largely avoided confronting convention.  Yet museums and science centers could, and should confront convention, and strive to serve their communities as 'think tanks' for successful, ongoing initiatives to insure the health and vibrancy of the community.  This is how I see the role of these Pavilion Life Sciences Centers... in cities all over.   [Est. $12,500 for consultant's REPORT and flushing out exhibits... and conference for 2].  Again, we will post highlights of the report... and what we determine to be the most important exhibits, and ask for your feedback.


Have you ever had a health problem arise and wonder, "Should I see my regular doctor.. or get acupuncture... or chiropractic... or maybe homeopathy?"  Or maybe you wondered, "Why can't all of these people talk to each other and figure out a better, more comprehensive and inclusive approach to health?"  Exactly!  I think about that all the time -- along with Dr. McClure, Dr. Cowden, and many others.  $7,500 will go towards working with these Board Members, with The Academy of Comprehensive, Integrative Medicine, and bringing health practitioner panels together, to begin mapping out new standards & protocols to cover this relatively uncharted mind/body/soul terrain known as "integrative medicine".  Too often, the "integrative" service being delivered is still built on the conventional medical model and is a mish-mash of various elements.  We must and can do better, and I'm serious about the part of our slogan which reads, 'Reshaping the future of health'.  This road map will be posted for you as it becomes available.  Expect the first installment in late spring or summer. 



There may be a lot of
websites and health portals out there, but there are a lot of devastating
health issues, too.  Our research has found that there is still a need for
reliable, smart, integrative health information that has been vetted... and is
user friendly.  To that extent, we have identified a proprietary web platform, and developer, with something capable of meeting our lofty demands and want to move forward as soon as possible to lock down him and his team before someone else does, and start on the work at hand.  Our first assignment -- tackling Autism and giving parents and the Autism community some much needed relief to this devastating disease.  Following that, we'll begin on heart disease, cancer, diabetes and so on, the idea being to provide the best and most user friendly experience for someone -- whether newly diagnosed or otherwise.  Our goal is get our first HEALTH website up within 6 months.  This Pavilion exclusive can help sooo many people -- and even more-so when Pavilions start producing evidence based DATA we can start feeding back.  [Est. $26,000 plus]     


  The Impact 

Enormous.  Not only for thousands...
perhaps millions of people, but for the environment, and ultimately world
peace, as well. The Pavilion Life Sciences Center and The
Pavilion's advanced, integrative health Bio-Center, will offer so much
in the way of critical, life changing information and health discoveries that
they are sure to spark an evolution in better living.  To
paraphrase Nelson Mandela, 'Education is the most powerful tool which you can
use to change the world'.  And that.... we will have lots of!

Why Me? 
Because when I developed asthma a number of
years back and my doctor said I would need inhalers and medication for the rest
of my life... I told him that wasn't acceptable.  Over time, I cured myself of asthma ... and later high blood pressure, joint pain, and a few other things, so I have plenty of firsthand experience to share.  I also produced hundreds of educational programs and courses on health related issues -- for clients in both conventional medicine and complementary medicine. Other good 'why me' reasons include I've run large restaurants, hospital food service, worked with a resort hotel, graduated from Cornell's Hotel School (which teaches this stuff), raised kids, WAS a kid <LOL> and more -- which you can read about on my BIO.  
  Risks & Challenges  
There should not be any substantial setbacks or issues,
at least not with regard to fulfillment. 
We already have most of the items to send out.  However, with regard to teleconferences,
calls, meetings, webinars and things having to do with 'live' people, there is always
the possibility that something could happen which could prevent a person from
fulfilling their obligation.  In
such a case we will do our best to find a close match -- to fulfill our commitment
to you.  
As far as risks and challenges with actually getting The Pavilion,
or any sizable enterprise up and running, there are, of course, plenty.  These are addressed in our business
plan.  Of course, to mitigate these risks, we have on board some of the
best professionals our there in their respective fields… and a market, and zeitgeist,
that's in alignment with, and waiting for, the evolutionary lifestyle and
solutions The Pavilion will bring forward. 
Thank you again your consideration.  Your support -- even just sharing our links and raising awareness about our campaign -- sends a strong
message to all of us, and potential investors, philanthropists-donors, sponsors, and partners,
that the time is right for The Pavilion…
and for everyone to enjoy healthier, richer, lives and a better future.

story: The money will be used to take my friend to the best nail salon in Austin. $500 isn't necessary but it's the minimum amount needed to create a fundraiser. But, I care about my friend a lot and I just want to boost her self confidence by getting her feet (and hands) looking presentable again. Together, we can all #HelpClairesFeet.

story:
Empower African micro-entrepreneurs to expand their businesses through volunteer mentoring 

Who are we? A registered charity since 2010, Grow Movement works with volunteer business consultants from around the world to transform the lives of people in Uganda, Rwanda and Malawi. We empower African entrepreneurs with the skills to run their organisations more effectively, increase profitability and create jobs in their communities. Our volunteers are global business professionals who offer consultancy sessions for free by Skype, phone and email.

Why? Micro and small businesses represent the backbone of local economies in most developing countries. They are vehicles for accelerating economic growth, generating employment, reducing crime and empowering communities. However, these small enterprises face unique challenges which limit their potential to succeed. 

What do we do?  Each entrepreneur receives 12 sessions of business consultancy with a carefully selected volunteer by Skype and mobile. With coaching in financial management, cost reduction, customer care and marketing strategy new jobs are created, and business sustainability is improved.  

How? We work with local partners in each country to identify entrepreneurs that require business support. Once accepted into the programme, their knowledge gap is matched with the key strengths of a volunteer consultant.


Grow Movement aims to balance out the life lottery that has prevented entrepreneurs from accessing the right skills and training to run their businesses effectively. 

Where do you come in? We need your help to continue to give motivated and inspiring entrepreneurs the skills they need to grow their businesses and create a positive impact. By supporting us in 2015, you will be planting the seeds for these entrepreneurs to help grow Africa from the grassroots up.

The Impact

By reaching £10,000 we will be able to:

•  Put another 50 entrepreneurs through the programme

•  Generate hundreds of local jobs

•  Boost the local economy and empower communities

Spread the word!

•  Share our campaign on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn and Google+ ( Buttons underneath the video) 

•  Tell all your family and friends about how they can help grow Africa

•  Write, blog, vlog and SHOUT about the campaign

#GROWAFRICA2015

story:
PERK UPDATE: We added more weekend, as well as single-day perks. ALSO: anyone who gets a perk $20 or above will get their name written on our back wall. We're Oprahing these perks! YOU GET A SCRIBBLE THANKS! YOU GET A SCRIBBLE THANKS!

THANK YOU!

We are overwhelmed by the support and the encouragement throughout this campaign. While we didn't meet our goal, we did raise enough to ensure that Simple Space will become a reality in the spring of 2015, and we're excited for the next steps.
We are currently getting all the money withdrawn as gold coins and we're planning to have a Scrooge McDuck party at Simple Space. Just kidding.
Instead, the next thing you can expect from the Simple Space team is a series of announcements on renovation progress, perk fulfillment, and—of course—events. 

With that, we present our official 2014 upcoming pre-launch event list:

Oct 31: Totentanz Art Exhibition Halloween Party

Nov 1-Nov 9: Totentanz Art Exhibition

Dec 6: Haven Magazine

Dec 12-14: Zip Zoo Apparel Pop-up

Dec 19-22: Kapture Pop-up

Find out more at simplespace.cc/events or by following us on Facebook andTwitter

We love you all, and thanks so much for your support. See you at Simple Space.


•••••


We bought a building in the historic neighborhood of Over The Rhine in Cincinnati, Ohio for our family to be better suited to love this city well. The stuff that's happening downtown and in OTR is awesome, and we want to be a part of it. We also want to help people launch new things into the world, and into this rad community.

Simple Space is a 600 sq/ft commercial space 1/2 block from Vine St. on East 13th St. designed to be an all-purpose, revolving-use pop-up and event space for limited-runs and exclusive engagements. Some of our ideas for uses include: pop-up clothing shops, food truck dining areas, album release shows, film premieres, art galleries, Etsy retailer spotlights, tastings, storytellings, lesson space, studio space… Maybe even a crowd-funded product launch. 


Here's how Simple Space will work:


Think of it like  Airbnb  for commercial space.

Anyone can book the 600 sq/ft storefront with bathroom anywhere from a 1-day to 6-week lease. Rental contracts would include utilities, internet, video security system, and 24/7 access to the storefront. Merchants would be responsible for organizing, set-up, promoting, running, cleaning, and tear-down of their event. We will provide a blank space on our storefront window for the tenant's signage and posters. And if we're successful in our fundraising goal, a space in our custom-built marquee.


There are a few different ways someone can interact with Simple Space:

1. Tenant
This one is pretty obvious. You have something that you want to share, and you need a space to share it in. Simple. We have the space. We would love to rent it to you. Affordable rates and simple contracts.

2. Host
Maybe you already have a product that sits on a shelf nearby. Maybe it's a tasty treat. Hows about you bring that delicious stuff over here and we'll all munch on it together. Or, maybe you're a musician who has some scrumptious tunes that you want to share. I'm sure tenants and guests would love to have you nearby.

3. Sponsor
It could be that your product or service doesn't make sense to utilize Simple Space. That's okay, you can still participate by sponsoring a tenant  who aligns with you and your offering. You pay for some of the tenant's rental fees, and in exchange, you get your name in front of all their customers and guests. Win and win.

4. Local Influencer
When others nominate you as an influencer, you have the potential to get a free day at Simple Space to do whatever it is that you think will be a good thing for the neighborhood, the city, and the world. Dream big, and nominate an influencer  RIGHT NOW!


What we will use the funds for:


The storefront needs new flooring, HVAC repair, a fresh coat of paint, new lighting, and an updated bathroom. Overall, it's in great condition, and almost ready to move in. We would love to add a hanging sign on the front of the building, and get some quality signage for the window. There are a lot of administrative and legal costs involved in starting a venture like this, not including all the features we want to be available like screaming fast WiFi, a smart thermostat, a great camera security system, and smart locks.

Here are what we are planning for the glassware:

 

If we don't meet our goal:


Simple Space is going to happen, but without proper funding up-front, we may be forced to lease our space out long-term. That would delay the launch of Simple Space by maybe another year or two. Time is of the essence here, and we're going to do what we can with what we raise to bring this little buddy into the world.


Some questions we've asked ourselves:


Q: Why do only temporary events? Why not do a yearly lease?

A: That's actually 2 questions, but whatever. Because expiration dates dictate the freshness of a thing. Exclusivity breeds value and limited edition forces you to reconsider what you really want.


Q: If Simple Space was a person, what would it be like?

A: Generous, enthusiastic, accommodating, friendly, savvy, gracious, welcoming, artistic. Ruggedly handsome. Classy dancer.


Q: What kind of shared values do we want with our tenants?

A: Craftsmanship, quality, rewarding to loyalty, cult following, niche, upstart, local, sustainable.


Q: How much are we going to charge?

A: As with life and TV special offers, this is subject to change. So far, we're looking at pricing our biz like this: 1 day for $300, 3 days for $600, 1 week for $1200, a fortnight for $1800, 3 weeks for $2400, and up to 6 weeks for $4500.


Q: Why Over The Rhine?

A: Recent years have seen a renaissance for OTR. Washington Park, the Streetcar, Main Street shops, Findlay Market, and the vibrant night-life and restaurants on Vine Street have brought new life to the area. Our building is nestled perfectly between Vine St. and Walnut St. directly across from the Art Academy of Cincinnati. It's pretty much the best ever, and fits so well with what others have done, continue to do, and will keep doing.

story:
#CopCoverage
Cops have guns…we have cameras

Fund this Camera Equipment campaign to train and equip community members to expose civil rights abuses by the Fargo PD, via #CopCoverage with audio and video recording devices.

The People’s Press Project (PPP), is a media justice non-profit serving the Fargo, ND and Moorhead, MN area which has launched a community response to numerous claims of excessive force by the Fargo Police department.  The PPP has responded with educational trainings empowering residents with an understanding of their civil, communication and community journalism rights and best practices.

This project benefits anyone who wants to learn their communication rights, the public's rights to film and record in public, and how to exercise them, We also aim to help the public share their stories in the most effective ways. The PPP will be holding trainings, webinars, and community response actions in connection with the #CopCoverage campaign empowering residents to discuss concerns about police interactions, sharing their stories, and seeking remedies together with local law enforcement entities so that together police and community members can shape the face of community policing in the Fargo-Moorhead region.

We are seeking $5000 in funding to pay for training and to purchase video and audio equipment for our non-profit which can be checked-out the public. With this funding we will be able to train and equip over 100 residents with know your rights information and camera and audio equipment to document the police in action.  

The training and equipment will be used to document any abusive or misconduct by the FARGO Police Department. Video and audio will be uploaded to our website and network of media and social media groups in an effort to create accountability with regard to police interactions, practices, polices, and accountability to the public. Funding will be used for training personnel, resources, video and audio equipment and technical assistance to promote and document community stories through the Internet, local independent media, social networks, websites and local news outlets.

The project will disseminate information and equipment to document encounters with law enforcement.  This project will also develop a community coalition to address these issues with the police departments and seek community based solutions to keep the community safe from police misconduct.

Here are some stories that highlight these issues in Fargo, ND:

Local News Coverage, WDAY.com:
http://youtu.be/JhHo5YKb0Yw

FreeThoughtProject.com---13 Cops Dispatched to Arrest One 15-year-old Girl, Because a Cop ‘Smelled Weed’

story_txt:
#CopCoverage
Cops have guns…we have cameras
Fund this Camera Equipment campaign to train and equip community members to expose civil rights abuses by the Fargo PD, via #CopCoverage with audio and video recording devices.
The
People’s Press Project (PPP), is a media justice non-profit serving the Fargo, ND
and Moorhead, MN area which has launched a community response to numerous claims of excessive
force by the Fargo Police department.  The
PPP has responded with educational trainings empowering residents with an understanding of their civil, communication and community journalism
rights and best practices. 
This project benefits anyone who wants to learn their communication rights, the public's rights to film and record in public, and how to
exercise them, We also aim to help the public share their
stories in the most effective ways. The PPP
will be holding trainings, webinars, and community response actions in
connection with the #CopCoverage campaign empowering residents to
discuss concerns about police interactions, sharing their stories, and seeking remedies together with local law enforcement entities so that together police
and community members can shape the face of community policing in the
Fargo-Moorhead region.
We are seeking $5000 in funding to pay for training and to purchase
video and audio equipment for our non-profit which can be checked-out the public. With this funding we will be able to train and equip over 100 residents with know your rights information and camera and audio equipment to document the police in action.  The training and equipment will be used to document any abusive or misconduct by the FARGO Police Department. Video and audio will be uploaded to our website and network of media and social media groups in an effort to create accountability with regard to police interactions, practices, polices, and accountability to the public. Funding will be used for training personnel, resources, video and audio
equipment and technical assistance
to promote and document community stories through the Internet, local independent media, social networks, websites and
local news outlets.
The project will disseminate information and
equipment to document encounters with law enforcement.  This project will also develop a community
coalition to address these issues with the police departments and seek community
based solutions to keep the community safe from police misconduct.Here are some stories that highlight these issues in Fargo, ND:Local News Coverage, WDAY.com:http://youtu.be/JhHo5YKb0YwFreeThoughtProject.com---13 Cops Dispatched to Arrest One 15-year-old Girl, Because a Cop ‘Smelled Weed’Read more:  http://thefreethoughtproject.com/13-cops-dispatched-arrest-15-year-old-girl-cop-smelled-weed/fmppp.org--Excessive Force Claim: 13 officers dispatched to arrest one 15 year old Mexican GirlRead more:  http://thepeoplespressproject.org/cop-coverage/excessive-force-claim-13-officers-dispatched-to-arrest-one-15-year-old-mexican-girlLastRealIndians.com--Excessive Force Claim: 13 officers dispatched to arrest one 15 year old Mexican GirlRead more: http://lastrealindians.com/excessive-force-clai...

story:
According to the Multi-dimensional Poverty Index (MPI), over 645 million people in India are living below the poverty line. According to the Arjun Sengupata Report, 77% of Indians live on less than $0.50 a day!

In addition, the average rural woman will spend 3.7 hours of her day fetching water. 

In partnership with Hand of Hope-Joyce Meyer ministries, Voss Cadillac is aiming to change that! Funds raised will be utilized to provide a clean water well for a community in India lacking access to clean, potable water.

Funds raised will be utilized to provide a clean water well for a community in India lacking access to clean, potable water.

story:
If you have just stumbled upon this fundraiser... Welcome.

If you have been with me for a few months or for the past 4 years, thank you for your support!

The Short Story: I own and operate (Owner/Seamstress/Designer/Manufacture) a handmade clothing and accessories business. Amicable Mediation was unsuccessful so I must currently hire a lawyer to protect my business in a Divorce where in my husband and partner is attempting to acquire large portions (the most profitable portions ) my business as well as the most necessary tools and machines.

The proceeds from this fundraiser will be used as follows:
$3500 Flat Fee for Divorce Lawyer specializing in Small Businesses & Divorce
$743 Donation gift Bag purchase and imprinting.

Donation Totebag:
Black COTTON Canvas Tote Bags. These bags are 100% Cotton Canvas 6 ounce fabric, 15"x16", self-fabric handles. They are great for crafts, hobbies, conventions, grocery shopping or just for carrying. Made from the best quality Plain Cotton tote bags .
Pictured here:



The Long Story:

In 2011, tired from trying to fit in with what would be called a "Normal Job" and motivated by the support of my friends, family and Husband, I left my job and started a business making custom, handmade, gothic clothing. I started out in my living room and with the full support of my husband over the next 2 years built a solid business, more industrial tools, a solid fan/client base, and expanded the business to include a Geek/nerd/fandom line.

The business grew so large it had to be moved out of my home and into an industrial park before settling into a studio located in downtown. With 3 employees, and intern, and a secretary the businesses while not making a lot more than needed to keep it in the black, continued to grow bigger each year.

The business has grown and flourished but as it has, my personal relationship with my husband suffered. My business ate 99% of my time and effort. I eat, live, breath my business. I spend every waking our working sometimes days in a row forsaking food or sleep in order to fill orders that come in.

This has unfortunately caused an irreparable rift between my husband and I and though over the past 2 years we have tried reconciliation and counseling, we have failed.

As the divorce talks have proceeded, we have reached a deadlock as to the business.

The business is 100% run and operated by me. I physically make, pack, ship all clothing. I deal with bills, employees, and all daily functions of the business as well as taxes, financing, etc. It is my life.

I dedicate 100% of my life to my business.

Over 50% of the time he was not physically here to do any of this because he was not in the country with his career job. An additional 25% of the time he was physically at work. The remaining 25% of time he had left was spent Sleeping, resting, gaming, and helping out with the business. In total his physical contribution to the business totaled 5 to 10% of the past 4 years.

That is not to negate his financial contribution to the business. He did support the business before it could support itself. I do not in any way belittle this. This portion, his Investment so to speak, would be paid back in full as part of the divorce.

But this fundraiser is to raise the funds to protect the business from being torn in two during the divorce and protect the hard work, sleepless nights, and so much more that I have put into it since I began 4 years ago.

To those who support.

Thank You.
