story:
Will you help #KeepSoleSpaceOpen ?

For 3 years, whenever Oakland’s artivists and activists have needed a place to meet and build together, we’ve pushed the shoes to the walls and made space - more than 300 times now. BUT with a devastating street closure that began in the Spring and will extend through the Holiday season, it became clear we needed another economic engine to make this unique model financially sustainable...

SO, in July we took a bold leap and opened a new location on Grand Avenue near Lake Merritt to generate more sales - BUT it's not big enough for events AND the buildout was expensive!

We need your support to raise $13,400 so we can afford to keep the original SoleSpace open as a community event space during this transition - while we ramp up on Grand - and beyond, into the future.

Back this campaign so we can #KeepSoleSpaceOpen on Telegraph for community events during this crucial transition period...and beyond!

Photo: Brooke Anderson

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $13,400 to cover the rent on Telegraph for 3-4 months.

That's at least 300 people giving an avg of $44.67 - some more, some less. 

We can do this. We host more than 300 people per week.

Chip in to get our undying appreciation PLUS lots of AMAZING perks:

  • Exclusive invites to our new "Notables" event series feat. Jeff Chang, Favianna Rodriguez, Adam Mansbach, Chinaka Hodge, Josh Healey & more
  • Art & Books by kickass Oakland artists you know and love 
  • Limited edition SoleSpace tee shirts & bags
  • Discounted event rentals & more...

The Impact (they said we should elaborate)

Close your eyes for 20 seconds & relive a great night at SoleSpace. Smile.


Now, imagine the closing party & an Oakland without SoleSpace. Frown.

Other Ways You Can Help

Well, we really need you to give money. Once you've done that, or if you really can't, please help us reach our goal by:
  • Getting the word out - make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools & your own crafty social media skills

Thank you for considering this request. For reals.

Please send questions, suggestions, & critiques: infoATsolespace.com

story:
Who We Are:

2 Dirty Dudes, LLC, was formed by two Environmental Studies students with a passion for food justice and fair food at Temple University as a senior project. 

Peter Usilton is a founding member of Temple University's student-run Rad Dish Cooperative Cafe, and has experience with community gardening, woodworking,  and service learning projects with children. 

Benjamin Bryan is also an Environmental Studies student, with experience in farming, woodworking, and construction.

In February of 2015 we were presented with the opportunity to partner with Beckett Community Center and Union Housing Development, Inc,  to create an urban farm model that produces affordable and nutritional food, as well as provide food education for youth and adults for the North Philadelphia community. Without hesitation, we jumped at the prospect. 

Through the acquisition of hoop houses, hydroponic equipment, and a warehouse space in Olney, we are ready to move forward. We are seeking funding to offset our initial start-up costs (equipment, seeds, supplies, etc.) as well as supplement our garden-educator salaries with the kids, until we have grant money to provide full-time salaries for ourselves and our farm workers. 

2 Dirty Dudes, LLC sincerely believes that it is everyone's right to have access to good food, as well as know where their food comes from. Food is the most essential part of living. Without out it, we don't live. Simple as that. Our health and happiness starts with what we put in our bodies. Let's start with Lawrence St. Urban Farm! 

Check out our pictures and learn more about our farm model on our indiegogo and Facebook page!

Located at a refurbished warehouse in Olney, North Philadelphia, we plan to utilize revitalized space to produce healthy, high yielding greens and veggies for the Philadelphia community. Our farming methods consist of a wide range from hydroponics and aquaponics to raised beds in our 16x50 hoop houses. Learn more about us and see pictures at our Facebook page! Please help us fulfill our goal to provide local, nutritional and sustainable food choices for the beloved Philadelphia community.

story:
Our Story

     

     


     Looking back on our journey to create The Wish List, I cant help but feel an overwhelming sense of gratitude for all that it has given our family. For me personally, it's has been a journey of learning... (to see our story in pictures see the video above.) Since we opened our first shop in Nashville in 2008, I’ve learned so much about what you can accomplish if you work hard and you love what you do. There has been so much joy, bursts of creativity, and struggles too. Being a business owner wasn’t as scary as I thought...it taught me how much you can make a difference in your community, and in the lives of others. I’ve tried to use every opportunity with guests in our shop, or even people passing by, to affect the quality of their day in a positive way. 
   
     We moved back to our hometown of Carlsbad, CA in 2010 to aid in the care of my mother who was battling brain cancer. We searched for the perfect “fixer upper” shop space that we could afford, and were blessed with a wonderful location in the village. We had to politely ask a hive of bees to find another home, give the property a lot of TLC, and once again, The Wish List opened it’s doors. Sadly, my mom was never well enough to visit before she passed away that same year. Opening the new Wish List helped me through that time. It kept me busy and surrounded me with amazing people that enjoyed our shop. I’ve learned it’s not as much about the stuff you sell, as it is about the people you connect with.
      


     Last November we had to close our Carlsbad shop after the owner of the property made plans to sell it. Since then, my faith in The Wish List has been reaffirmed often by people I see in my community who ask if we are opening in a new location soon. I’ve dreamed of a place where our shop would always be accessible to my friends from Nashville, Carlsbad, and all around the country- even the world - anytime day or night. A place where the doors would never close and visitors can check in, hang out, enjoy the shop, and exchange ideas. I’ve been working hard to prepare an online store and blog, but have exhausted my resources trying to overcome roadblocks along the way. I need your help!

      

     When a sweet friend suggested that I start a crowd funding campaign to bring back The Wish List, I realized that many of you may be interested in purchasing groups of creative gifts and products just in time for the holidays! This would help us to get the funding we need to prepare for the launch of The Wish List Vintage Market online by January 2016. Here are some photos of what we are offering:


             

       ( 10 Handmade Greeting Cards)                     ( 3 Architectural Art Prints )

       

               (3 Quote Dictionary Prints)                         (Signed Dictionary Bird Prints) 

                                     

                                (4 Dozen Handmade Holiday Gift Tags $25 Perk)

                                      

               (12 Humorous (and Slightly Inappropriate) Greeting Cards $30 Perk)

Here's what we'll be using these campaign funds for:

Creative-  Design software and hardware. A reliable used Apple computer suitable for design and online store needs (for business use only- sticky hands OFF, kids!),  A versatile new printer that uses ink sparingly and isn't trying to drive me insane with jammed paper and glitches- arrrgh! Enough ink that I won't be going back to Staples every other day. Assorted supplies including bulk blank cards, scrap booking papers, inks, ribbon, glue, scissors, paper cutter, embellishments, etc.  

Packing and Shipping- postal scale, tape, boxes, bubble wrap, packing peanuts, packaging paper, office supplies, Cellophane sleeves, envelopes, mailers, etc.  

Teaching- Supplies for upcoming local painting, art, and craft classes in Carlsbad. Paints, smocks, cleanup supplies, easels, brushes, palettes, canvases, art pencils, glue, assorted craft needs.

Business- Online setup, design and maintenance costs. Advertising and promotional budget. Business and accounting software. POS equipment and materials for local events and shows. 

Inventory- Expand selection of additional unique vintage and one of a kind items, and art.

            

              

              ( Audrey Art Prints )                     ( Framed Bluebirds Print + 6 Matching Cards)
               
                  ( Gift Certificates )                           ( Sheet Music Rose Bouquet )

      

($85 Perk: Best Chocolate Cake EVER! plus 2 dozen Birthday Cake Cookies.... for local delivery only)

Other Ways You Can Help:
-Please spread the word any way you can! Social media, texting,- or go old school and tell someone in person!
-Become a member of our new YouTube Channel after you watch our campaign video! 
- Make sure you LIKE  The Wish List  Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/wishlist.carlsbad
-Get ready to shop and share ideas in January 2016!

Thank you kindly for your support!



 





.

($85 Perk: Best Chocolate Cake EVER! plus 2 dozen Birthday Cake Cookies.... for local delivery only)
Other Ways You Can Help:
-Please spread the word any way you can! Social media, texting,- or go old school and tell someone in person!-Become a member of our new YouTube Channel after you watch our campaign video! - Make sure you LIKE  The Wish List  Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/wishlist.carlsbad
-Get ready to shop and share ideas in January 2016!Thank you kindly for your support!

story: ***

Summary of Project

We want to help SMEs to increase their competitiveness with collection and analysis of data with application of social listening technology.

Who We Are

World New Economy Council envisions a world where technological advancement is fair, open, safe and human-centric as a result of strong awareness of continue governance of the happiness values created and developed across organizations.  We are charity organization registered in Hong Kong Special Administration Region (or “HKSAR” from hereafter) since 2012.

Technology Application in Small and Medium Enterprise

Economy constantly evolves with technological advancements.  Its evolution becomes exponentially faster and larger in scale with the industrialization 4.0 with A.I. 

Corporate and Government using technology to elevate productivity might have profit-efficiency .  The Small and Medium Enterprise, on the other hand, do often lack of resources or inadequate allocation of resources or qualified technical talents to develop/upgrade technology to elevate productivity.

Current Economic Situation in Hong Kong

For retail chains with significant resources, they are likely to possess financial and technical resources to gather customer feedback for continuous improvement of its services and products.  For retail SMEs, on the contrary, they are far less likely to even possess the knowledge about user feedback gathering, analytics and applications for improvement of its competitiveness.

The above unbalanced situation in technology application might perceived by public as more tolerable when the economic situations are booming and optimistic where retail spending is ample o be shared among most retailers.  In the past twelve months, however, HKSAR has experienced 10% drop in tourist population, all the festive events during the past seven months were cancelled due to various reasons given by the organizers.  Economists foresee –1.3% growth in GDP into 2020, which indicates recession.  Leaders of various retail sectors expects an inevitable closure among 11% of retailers.

It is high time that the Small and Medium retailers by definition those retailers with less than 50 employees be given assistance to increase their competitiveness. Qualified SMEs with fewer than 50 employees and in possession of a valid Business Registration and proper F&B License were able to apply for Li Ka Shing Foundation’s HK$1 billion Crunch Time Instant Relief Fund.

What We Need & What You Get

We call for funding to engage market survey companies which applies Social Listening technology to collect timely and direct feedback from the customers of the retail SMEs.

We shall work with this market survey company to gather the required customer feedback and transformed it into data. The data collected from the customers would be analyzed by the Social Listening Market Survey Companies prepare individual reports, comparison reports and industry reports and highlight insight.

The World New Economy Council would be conducting group sharing sessions with the participating SMEs to explain the data summarized in the reports and their implication to their competitiveness.

The World New Economy Council would provide suggestions to increase competitiveness based on the insights created at individual level, competitors level and industry levels.

Scope of Service

  • Work with market survey company to compose customer feedback for SME retailers
  • Work with market survey company to confirm efficient means to maximize information collected
  • Contact Chamber of Commerce to promote SME participation
  • Conduct Briefing sessions to the recruited SME participants
  • Liaise with SME participants the distribution of necessary materials to collect feedback from customers
  • Liaise with SME participants on any potential technical issues
  • Coordinate debriefing sessions on individual reports, competitive reports and industry reports

Projection of Funding

<$50,000: Donation to World New Economy Council and for safekeeping for the same project

>$50,000: engage 50 SMEs for the project

>$50,001 - $100,000: engage 100 SMEs

>$100,000: engage SME with coaching sessions to make use of the insight from the social listening survey

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help, but can't contribute? You can still be a part of making our vision a reality! Share this campaign with your friends and family; help spread the word!

Thank YOU so much for your help! We couldn't do it without you.

----

World New Economy Council Ltd.

HKIR Ch.88 Charity

Mobile: +852 9489 8471

Secretary: +852 3796 2513

Email: worldneweconomy@gmail.com

Web: http://WNEC.ORG

Mail: Level 16, Man Yee Building, 60 - 68 Des Voeux Road Central, Hong Kong

"A WORLD WHERE TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENT IS FAIR, OPEN, SAFE AND HUMAN-CENTRIC AS A RESULT OF STRONG AWARENESS AND CONTINUAL GOVERNANCE OF THE HAPPINESS VALUE CHAIN"
story_txt:
Summary of Project
We want to help SMEs to increase their competitiveness with collection and analysis of data with application of social listening technology.
Who We Are
World New Economy Council envisions a world where technological advancement is fair, open, safe and human-centric as a result of strong awareness of continue governance of the happiness values created and developed across organizations.  We are charity organization registered in Hong Kong Special Administration Region (or “HKSAR” from hereafter) since 2012.

Technology Application in Small and Medium Enterprise
Economy constantly evolves with technological advancements.  Its evolution becomes exponentially faster and larger in scale with the industrialization 4.0 with A.I. 
Corporate and Government using technology to elevate productivity might have profit-efficiency .  The Small and Medium Enterprise, on the other hand, do often lack of resources or inadequate allocation of resources or qualified technical talents to develop/upgrade technology to elevate productivity.
Current Economic Situation in Hong Kong
For retail chains with significant resources, they are likely to possess financial and technical resources to gather customer feedback for continuous improvement of its services and products.  For retail SMEs, on the contrary, they are far less likely to even possess the knowledge about user feedback gathering, analytics and applications for improvement of its competitiveness.
The above unbalanced situation in technology application might perceived by public as more tolerable when the economic situations are booming and optimistic where retail spending is ample o be shared among most retailers.  In the past twelve months, however, HKSAR has experienced 10% drop in tourist population, all the festive events during the past seven months were cancelled due to various reasons given by the organizers.  Economists foresee –1.3% growth in GDP into 2020, which indicates recession.  Leaders of various retail sectors expects an inevitable closure among 11% of retailers.
It is high time that the Small and Medium retailers by definition those retailers with less than 50 employees be given assistance to increase their competitiveness. Qualified SMEs with fewer than 50 employees and in possession of a valid Business Registration and proper F&B License were able to apply for Li Ka Shing Foundation’s HK$1 billion Crunch Time Instant Relief Fund.
What We Need & What You Get
We call for funding to engage market survey companies which applies Social Listening technology to collect timely and direct feedback from the customers of the retail SMEs.
We shall work with this market survey company to gather the required customer feedback and transformed it into data. The data collected from the customers would be analyzed by the Social Listening Market Survey Companies prepare individual reports, comparison reports and industry reports and highlight insight.
The World New Economy Council would be conducting group sharing sessions with the participating SMEs to explain the data summarized in the reports and their implication to their competitiveness.
The World New Economy Council would provide suggestions to increase competitiveness based on the insights created at individual level, competitors level and industry levels.

Scope of Service

Work with market survey company to compose customer feedback for SME retailers
Work with market survey company to confirm efficient means to maximize information collected
Contact Chamber of Commerce to promote SME participation
Conduct Briefing sessions to the recruited SME participants
Liaise with SME participants the distribution of necessary materials to collect feedback from customers
Liaise with SME participants on any potential technical issues
Coordinate debriefing sessions on individual reports, competitive reports and industry reports

Projection of Funding
<$50,000: Donation to World New Economy Council and for safekeeping for the same project
>$50,000: engage 50 SMEs for the project
>$50,001 - $100,000: engage 100 SMEs
>$100,000: engage SME with coaching sessions to make use of the insight from the social listening survey

Other Ways You Can Help
Want to help, but can't contribute? You can still be a part of making our vision a reality! Share this campaign with your friends and family; help spread the word!
Thank YOU so much for your help! We couldn't do it without you.
----
World New Economy Council Ltd.
HKIR Ch.88 Charity
Mobile: +852 9489 8471
Secretary: +852 3796 2513
Email: worldneweconomy@gmail.com
Web: http://WNEC.ORG
Mail: Level 16, Man Yee Building, 60 - 68 Des Voeux Road Central, Hong Kong
"A WORLD WHERE TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENT IS FAIR, OPEN, SAFE AND HUMAN-CENTRIC AS A RESULT OF STRONG AWARENESS AND CONTINUAL GOVERNANCE OF THE HAPPINESS VALUE CHAIN"

story:
Introducing Good Night Out

Launched in London on International Women’s Day March 2014, Good Night Out is a volunteer-run campaign that works with clubs, bars, pubs and venues, training staff, security and management on how to deal with and prevent the harassment of women and LGTBQ people on their premises.  

Good Night Out was developed in response to the overwhelming amount of stories we received on our Hollaback London website about harassment on nights out (e.g groping, leering, grabbing, sexually aggressive behaviour, stalking, humiliation, and homophobia) where all too often responses from staff and security fell way short of acceptable. 

Participating London venues we have worked with so far include fabric, The Old Blue Last, Birthdays, Village Underground, University of London Union, Dance Tunnel, Dalston Superstore, The Lexington and more.

Good Night Out has already been featured in The Guardian ("Sexual harassment is normal in clubs, but are things about to change?") Evening Standard ("Time to reclaim the streets from London's leches") and NME ("Groping at gigs must be stamped out") we've spoken about gender-based harassment on LBC Radio, The Community Channel and on the BBC many times. 

Each participating venue undergoes a training session from Good Night Out and displays prominently to their patrons a poster pledge that reads: 


Since our launch, people from across the UK, Ireland and beyond have been contacting us saying how badly their town needs Good Night Out.  

We need your help to make this happen and roll the campaign out nationwide.

What we'll do

We plan to roll out Good Night Out as an independent, trusted safety mark for venues, pubs, bars and clubs across the UK and Ireland. It will be coordinated in London by Julia Gray and Bryony Beynon from Hollaback London, with regional organisers around the country.

We’ve developed an efficient volunteer-led framework for delivering the campaign, drawing on a range of individuals,  activist groups, universities, and organisations such as regional Rape Crisis centres in the following areas across the UK and Ireland: Edinburgh, Glasgow, Norwich, Medway Towns in Kent, Oxford, Nottingham, Coventry, Brighton, Bristol, Sheffield, Limerick and Galway, with more signing up all the time. 

It will launch over Fresher’s Week, September 2014. 

We've been working closely with NUS Women’s Officer Susuana Antubam, getting involved with the National Lad Culture Strategy to help create, safer and more accessible student communities. 

What We Need 

£5000 represents a proportion of one year’s national operation of the Good Night Out campaign, based on a volunteer-led distributed leadership model.

Your donation will enable us to run this national programme effectively by covering all or part of the cost of:

  • Professional design and print work

We have worked pro-bono with graphic designer Heather Weil to develop our popular strongly branded campaign materials, and your donation will enable us to extend this identity into bars and clubs across the country

  • Website

We have negotiated a reduced quote from a trusted developer to produce a fully-featured website that explains our mission and brings together each regional organiser, allowing them to display their own content about the participating venues in their town, their contact email and other multimedia content.

  • Training for Organisers
We will develop and deliver ‘train the trainer’ modules for our regional organisers to ensure that training delivered around the country matches the quality of training we give to our very happy participating venues in London.

  • Administration and delivery costs

For the first time ever, we’ll be aiming to cover a small amount of the many hours of admin time that goes into making our campaigns work.


The Impact

We have found that once venues, pubs, bars and clubs were confronted with the scale of the problem and given the tools to confront it, real change takes effect. We partnered with fabric to develop their landmark harassment policy in 2012 and have since trained many venues (from small bars to thousand+ capacity venues) around London about keeping women and LGTBQ people safer on nights out, encouraging good responses from staff and changing organisational policy to ensure there is zero tolerance.  The feedback so far has been overwhelmingly positive and welcoming. We have directly held venue management accountable in a open, collaborative process of accountability and improvement and we are very confident we can continue this work across the country.

Here are some quotes from industry leaders who have benefitted from our training:

“Being part of Good Night Out is soooo important to us as a music space, as we want everyone to be able to enjoy themselves and feel safe in our venue. We’ve received some really positive messages from women thanking us for taking this stance and having their backs since we started publicising the campaign.”

Kirsti Wier, Press Officer, fabric

"Having been in the industry for over 20 years it's refreshing to still be able to learn valuable skills and techniques when dealing with sensitive issues such as those brought to our attention by Good Night Out. Bryony [trainer] and her valuable insight to such an important but sometimes overlooked issue was unanimously applauded by the VU team. We are proud to be a supporter of Good Night Out and their campaign to raise awareness among staff and punters in late night establishments." 

Tyvian Vigrass, Operations Manager / DPS, Village Underground

"The ladies loos are a refuge and a sanctuary, and are often the place where you end up taking stock of your night and realise it's not going as well as it could be. Seeing this poster on the back of a cubicle door was a useful reminder that the fault didn't lie with me and that I had every right to tell someone and expect them to understand."

Anonymous feedback, July 2014


Our Challenges

There's always a challenge to taking a campaign from local to national. Context in urban vs. rural areas, bars and pubs that are more difficult to engage with and management that might not want to listen are all challenges that may appear. 

Our experience over the years has shown us how to handle difficult questions diplomatically ('Don't women lie about this stuff all the time?' 'What if they're just seeking attention?' 'Gay guys are just more sexually aggressive') whilst speaking out with the real life experiences of women and LGTBQ people to combat myths and drive home why creating a safer environment on nights out is so important. Funding and delivery: We have a mixed funding model and will grow our pot sustainably by charging some larger venues for training. Regional organisers will be trained by GNO HQ (London) on how to approach, sign-up and train their local venues speak to staff, and will be able to charge a fee to cover their time and expenses, plus a small donation to the development of the campaign.

Our values

Good Night Out was developed by Julia Gray and Bryony Beynon from Hollaback London, part of the global movement to end street harassment. We have a strong track record of making real change and have been organising around issues of gender-based harassment since 2010, with zero funding or financial backing. Our work is endorsed by the National End Violence Against Women Coalition.  We advise local councils on combating harassment and sit on the Transport For London advisory board for Project Guardian. 

We believe in making positive change through changing attitudes, encouraging critical thinking and progressive activity both within and beyond institutions, always working to amplify marginalised voices in everything we do.

Our work is underpinned by the belief that gender-based violence is a continuum, and that if we, as a society, allow even small 'microaggressions' to go unchallenged, then we create an environment where wider-scale injustice can flourish.


Help us out and Get Involved

Every little helps. We haven't focussed on perks because we don't believe that the ability to give more should give a bigger stake in the project, however there are some nice rewards available on the right hand side. If you would like to see your local pub, your favourite gig venue or club sign up to the campaign, please consider giving the price of a pint (or even a round!) towards your next Good Night Out. 

Alternatively, why not tweet at them and ask them to sign up?! 

We have opted for flexible funding so we will receive all money donated from this page even if we don't reach our target.

If you can't support financially, sharing the link to this campaign would be hugely useful, is free and takes a second.

We are expanding our network of regional organisers all the time, and would love to hear from you if you are interested in bringing GNO to your town.

Follow and Like us on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.

Email us with any questions on hello@goodnightoutcampaign.org

story:
Believe in Syracuse is a non-profit organization that promotes the positive features of the Greater Syracuse Area and cultivates connections and civic engagement within the Greater Syracuse community.

The decline of Syracuse that happened between 1950 and 2000 has made fewer people believe that good things are possible here. By changing the conversation about Syracuse we hope to encourage civic engagement and make Syracuse a more positive place to live. Believe in Syracuse can't solve all our problems, but working together, we believe we can start a conversation that makes Syracuse better.

Here's a special message from our founder and President of our board, John DeSantis:

Hey everyone this is John DeSantis with Believe in Syracuse. I wanted to let you in on a very special announcement! Believe in Syracuse is now 20 months old, and after 20 months of promoting volunteerism and the positive aspects of the Syracuse area, we are excited to announce that we have officially become a Non-Profit Charitable Organization! 

The IRS has accepted our application and we are now a 501c3! What does that mean? It means that we are exempt from paying taxes but more importantly it adds more organization and credibility that we will use to build even more consensus in our community about the importance of what we do. Also it means that if you donate to Believe in Syracuse, you can claim a deduction on your taxes. That's why I wanted to talk to you about making an investment in your community with a small donation to fund our programs. 

Our mission is to promote the positive features of the Greater Syracuse Area and civic engagement within the Greater Syracuse community. We've accomplished a lot over the past 20 months, serving breakfast to the homeless and hungry, picking up trash in our neighborhoods and changing the conversation about Syracuse. The fight against cynicism and apathy will not be easy. With my boards oversight, I plan to step up our efforts and investment to reach more people with our message and get them involved in making Syracuse a better place. That's why I am asking you to donate $10, $25, $50 or whatever you can and together we'll keep Syracuse moving forward. It's a city on the rise. 

Thank you!



To contribute by mail, send a check, cash or money order to 1538 Caleb Ave Syracuse, NY 13206. Make checks payable to Believe in Syracuse.

story:
Upholstery + Me = Love.

In 2011, I found a roadside retro chair that forced me to pull over. I took it home, tore it apart and clumsily reupholstered it. I haven't looked back since. After that curbside find it has been chair after chair, couch after loveseat and stool after ottoman of practice. Doing cheap or free commissions gave me the time and knowledge I needed to be where I am today. I went the long route to learn it right. I'm proud to say that 3 years later, there's isn't much I can't recover, revive and renew. It's taught me patience, craftsmanship and pride in my work.
I have also been a bookkeeper and  business manager for a restaurant and bar for 10 years. I know business, I know accounting, and I know what I have to do.  After a hip surgery in July that has taken away a previous life long pain issue, I've got the wind at my back and I'm ready for this. I would like to thank you in advance for reading about me and my business. If you decide to help fund my start up costs, know that I am forever in your debt and appreciate you believing in someone who finally has the guts to go for what they know and love! -Maggie

   


Starting Up with Appreciation.

I have created a budget for rent, monthly costs and supplies. The part I really need help with are the start up costs. Start up costs are always more than you think, and you have to be prepared. Having these costs covered, even in part,  will ensure that my launch pad for this business is clear. I've calculated profit margins, inventory costs and have a clear business plan;  the costs associated with first moving into a new space are what I need help with.  I need to set up a debit machine, buy an inexpensive work laptop to do my webdesign and updates on. I need to make some bulk purchases of supplies like tacking, fabric and upholstery foam. I also need to purchase retail necessities like bags for my pillow sales and signage. Part of the start up costs will be allocated to social media and website promotion. These are things that need to be purchased from the start so that I can concentrate on building stock and booking clients. 

Whoever decides to contribute to my project funding will be forever in my mind, and I want to show my appreciation. For donations of $50 or over,  I will be hand writing special thank you cards along with a set of handmade paper gift tags for your use. For donations over $100, I will gladly send you a 16 by 16 inch pillow cover in your choice of fabrics I have hand-picked. I want you to have a real 'in your hand' (or on your chair!) token of my appreciation. Those that donate $300 and over I will have their names added to a wall in my studio. Your name will be on a plaque to remind me daily that you helped me make my dream possible. I will also add your name to my website on a special "thank you" page.  If posting your name publicly is something you'd rather not have, I'll happily send you a pillow cover, some handmade tags and a handwritten thank you card to show you my immense appreciation. You believed in my vision, and it means the world to me. 

                  



    Seeing is Believing.

    I have clear goals for my business. I have other creative outlets that ensure I am always creating regardless of my list of projects. I sew pillows because I love how easily they transform a room. I love design and especially love the inspiration that can spring from seeing color combinations. I want to vamp up social media and website advertising so that I can successfully sell these items online. I have stores that are interested in commissioning my pillows and paper craft items and I need a studio space to act as a productive hive for stock. Upholstery is my focus, but these other projects ensure that I am always creating and being inspired. It doesn't hurt that they have high profit margins! 
    The upholstery aspect of my work has a few important streams of income. I have been commissioned to do many pieces for people who have fabrics and ideas that they just need someone to carry out. I love working with clients who want their own visions brought to life. Seeing their faces when their project is complete is truly amazing! 
    Design revival is another area I enjoy. Buying a piece that needs TLC is as easy as opening Kijiji in your browser. Everything has potential. When you buy a chair that needs redoing, the possibilities are endless. Choosing the fabric and style has got to be the most FUN I'll ever have with my work. Every piece that I've done this with has sold, and sold quickly. I'm good at this!
    Eventually, I want to be able to teach others to do simple upholstery. After a few years in the studio I'll pursue either in-studio classes or online tutorials. Weekend projects for those who want to learn and who are DIYers don't take away from your business if they are paying you for help and guidance! 

    When I move into my studio and set up all that I need to be successful in my space, I'll be reflecting on how I got here. The inspiration I experience daily will finally be able to flow in a studio atmosphere, and there will be nothing to stop me from achieving my goals. I would absolutely love to have an emailing list of all my funding supporters so that I can update you on progress, achievements and goals.


    Challenges. 

    When you have been in business management for as long as I have, the phrase most uttered is, "expect everything to go wrong". In the bar industry, it was a daily struggle to keep the beer fridge chugging along or the food from the kitchen to come out at a reasonable time. You've got to be ready for anything. It's a bit different in the design industry, but not much. You might need to deal with unhappy clients once in awhile, or your tools may fail you. These sorts of challenges must be met with the same patience, common sense and problem solving skills, though. Keep your clients happy, your inspiration flowing and your income coming. If you chose to do something, do it full on and do it right. My workmanship and dedication to my clients is my focus.

    Business and risk go hand in hand. The sleepless nights before signing a lease aren't different when the business is different. It's both scary and exciting;  you think of the worst case scenarios and you dwell on them. I've done that for a long time. As a solution to worry and risk, I did my research and planning, and when I finished it I realized that I have something great here. I'm ready for all the challenges, risks and fear because I'm prepared for them and I have experience in solving them.

    Competition is always a challenge. But one of the beauties of upholstery is the demand for AFFORDABLE work. I want to conduct my business with that in mind as well. When people find out that I am reasonably priced, I hear the same thing every time: " I have this chair...." And so, my business success is based on my favorite quote: "Everyone has a chair".

    Support isn't just Financial.

    If you believe in me but don't have the financial means to support my endeavor, email me to say so! I once got a thank you card from a couple who I had done a chair for. I still have it, because it reminds me that people love my work, they think I am talented, and they want to tell me so. It is inspirational and it drives me to keep doing what I love. Email me! Write me! I will be forever thankful to you for the effort and support.


      From the bottom of my heart, thank you for your time. - Maggie
story_txt:
Upholstery + Me = Love.
In 2011, I found a roadside retro chair that forced me to pull over. I took it home, tore it apart and clumsily reupholstered it. I haven't looked back since. After that curbside find it has been chair after chair, couch after loveseat and stool after ottoman of practice. Doing cheap or free commissions gave me the time and knowledge I needed to be where I am today. I went the long route to learn it right. I'm proud to say that 3 years later, there's isn't much I can't recover, revive and renew. It's taught me patience, craftsmanship and pride in my work.
I have also been a bookkeeper and  business manager for a restaurant and bar for 10 years. I know business, I know accounting, and I know what I have to do.  After a hip surgery in July that has taken away a previous life long pain issue, I've got the wind at my back and I'm ready for this. I would like to thank you in advance for reading about me and my business. If you decide to help fund my start up costs, know that I am forever in your debt and appreciate you believing in someone who finally has the guts to go for what they know and love! -Maggie

   

   Starting Up with Appreciation.
I have created a budget for rent, monthly costs and supplies. The part I really need help with are the start up costs. Start up costs are always more than you think, and you have to be prepared. Having these costs covered, even in part,  will ensure that my launch pad for this business is clear. I've calculated profit margins, inventory costs and have a clear business plan;  the costs associated with first moving into a new space are what I need help with.  I need to set up a debit machine, buy an inexpensive work laptop to do my webdesign and updates on. I need to make some bulk purchases of supplies like tacking, fabric and upholstery foam. I also need to purchase retail necessities like bags for my pillow sales and signage. Part of the start up costs will be allocated to social media and website promotion. These are things that need to be purchased from the start so that I can concentrate on building stock and booking clients. Whoever decides to contribute to my project funding will be forever in my mind, and I want to show my appreciation. For donations of $50 or over,  I will be hand writing special thank you cards along with a set of handmade paper gift tags for your use. For donations over $100, I will gladly send you a 16 by 16 inch pillow cover in your choice of fabrics I have hand-picked. I want you to have a real 'in your hand' (or on your chair!) token of my appreciation. Those that donate $300 and over I will have their names added to a wall in my studio. Your name will be on a plaque to remind me daily that you helped me make my dream possible. I will also add your name to my website on a special "thank you" page.  If posting your name publicly is something you'd rather not have, I'll happily send you a pillow cover, some handmade tags and a handwritten thank you card to show you my immense appreciation. You believed in my vision, and it means the world to me.                   




  Seeing is Believing.
I have clear goals for my business. I have other creative outlets that ensure I am always creating regardless of my list of projects. I sew pillows because I love how easily they transform a room. I love design and especially love the inspiration that can spring from seeing color combinations. I want to vamp up social media and website advertising so that I can successfully sell these items online. I have stores that are interested in commissioning my pillows and paper craft items and I need a studio space to act as a productive hive for stock. Upholstery is my focus, but these other projects ensure that I am always creating and being inspired. It doesn't hurt that they have high profit margins! 


The upholstery aspect of my work has a few important streams of income. I have been commissioned to do many pieces for people who have fabrics and ideas that they just need someone to carry out. I love working with clients who want their own visions brought to life. Seeing their faces when their project is complete is truly amazing! 

Design revival is another area I enjoy. Buying a piece that needs TLC is as easy as opening Kijiji in your browser. Everything has potential. When you buy a chair that needs redoing, the possibilities are endless. Choosing the fabric and style has got to be the most FUN I'll ever have with my work. Every piece that I've done this with has sold, and sold quickly. I'm good at this!


Eventually, I want to be able to teach others to do simple upholstery. After a few years in the studio I'll pursue either in-studio classes or online tutorials. Weekend projects for those who want to learn and who are DIYers don't take away from your business if they are paying you for help and guidance! 
 When I move into my studio and set up all that I need to be successful in my space, I'll be reflecting on how I got here. The inspiration I experience daily will finally be able to flow in a studio atmosphere, and there will be nothing to stop me from achieving my goals. I would absolutely love to have an emailing list of all my funding supporters so that I can update you on progress, achievements and goals.



  Challenges.  When you have been in business management for as long as I have, the phrase most uttered is, "expect everything to go wrong". In the bar industry, it was a daily struggle to keep the beer fridge chugging along or the food from the kitchen to come out at a reasonable time. You've got to be ready for anything. It's a bit different in the design industry, but not much. You might need to deal with unhappy clients once in awhile, or your tools may fail you. These sorts of challenges must be met with the same patience, common sense and problem solving skills, though. Keep your clients happy, your inspiration flowing and your income coming. If you chose to do something, do it full on and do it right. My workmanship and dedication to my clients is my focus.
Business and risk go hand in hand. The sleepless nights before signing a lease aren't different when the business is different. It's both scary and exciting;  you think of the worst case scenarios and you dwell on them. I've done that for a long time. As a solution to worry and risk, I did my research and planning, and when I finished it I realized that I have something great here. I'm ready for all the challenges, risks and fear because I'm prepared for them and I have experience in solving them.
Competition is always a challenge. But one of the beauties of upholstery is the demand for AFFORDABLE work. I want to conduct my business with that in mind as well. When people find out that I am reasonably priced, I hear the same thing every time: " I have this chair...." And so, my business success is based on my favorite quote: "Everyone has a chair".
  Support isn't just Financial.
If you believe in me but don't have the financial means to support my endeavor, email me to say so! I once got a thank you card from a couple who I had done a chair for. I still have it, because it reminds me that people love my work, they think I am talented, and they want to tell me so. It is inspirational and it drives me to keep doing what I love. Email me! Write me! I will be forever thankful to you for the effort and support.





 From the bottom of my heart, thank you for your time. - Maggie

story:
please check out our updates too!

HELLO,  I AM DENNIS MASON...

...and on Sunday, 1 November 2015, I will be running up the West Coast of Grenada, with a few friends, from St George's to Sauteurs, for my first official A Run For Grenada campaign. While this is a challenge that I will enjoy, it means more than that to me. It is an opportunity to both help and inspire children across Grenada, Carriacou & Petite Martinique, especially those living in care homes, like I did. 

I am excited to announce that running alongside us will be Canadian actor, Brandon Jay McLaren, who plays Dale Jakes in USA Network hit show 'Graceland'. Brandons father is from the town of Grenville in Grenada.  We thank him for his generosity and kindness and very much welcome him into the team.

Dennis, in training for the 2015 A Run For Grenada

Interactive Map of A Run For Grenada

This is not just a run but a movement to help other vulnerable youth Overcome Adversity and Inspire The Next Generation. It’s about being a positive role model to my peers and to the young kids growing up behind me in care homes. I want to show them that despite my start in life, I am not idle, I am not a trouble-maker and I am not a lost cause. With the help of reachwithin, I’ve taken control of my life and my future. Something I never thought was possible.

Through reachwithin’s programs, my peers and I were able to better control our emotions, from stress and anger management to conflict resolution. They also taught us basic everyday skills, from writing a resume to making a personal budget. With their support, I was able to face the various challenges that life threw at me with more confidence.

I now work full-time, I pay my bills, I look after my physical and mental health and I do my best to give back to my community, which includes working as a part-time mentor for reachwithin. I can honestly say that I would not be here today without reachwithin’s programs. That is why I am on a mission to make sure these programs continue for the all of the kids that live in care homes across Grenada!

WHY A RUN FOR GRENADA 2015?

In 2014, I was set to run the TCS New York City Marathon and had been in training for months so you can imagine my disappointment when I learned that I would not be attending. Together with reachwithin program coordinator, Jerry Bascombe, we decided to organise our own marathon to coincide with the one happening in the US, taking us up the west coast of Grenada, from St George’s to Sauteurs. It would be my first marathon. I did have my doubts at the start and wondered if I would be able to finish. From the hot sun to the hilly terrain, could I really meet this challenge?  

Dennis and friends run through Gouyave in 2014 


Well I did it and what made it extra special is that up to eighteen friends and family, inspired by our cause and our solidarity, joined us on our quest, including Monty, who delivers group drumming workshops for reachwithin and some of the boys from Father Mallaghan’s home for boys in Victoria (where I grew up). This was less of a race and more a test of endurance. After running more than 20 miles in the heat and torrential rain, we all triumphantly arrived at the Petite Anse Hotel, Sauteurs in just under six hours.

Dennis and friends at the start of their run in 2014 


I quickly realised that I didn't have to go to the US to help the children of Grenada, I could do it right here in my homeland. I now want to make this an annual event, what I call A Run For Grenada. Besides raising much needed funds for reachwithin programs it will, hopefully, continue to encourage and inspire the next generation of children living in care homes across Grenada. If you agree that every child deserves the best start in life, please donate to our campaign.

WHO IS reachwithin?

Founded in 2008, reachwithin's mission is to improve the futures of children who have experienced adversity or loss by helping them develop social-emotional literacy, self-confidence and resiliency in the presence of caring adults.

reachwithin predominantly works with five care homes in Grenada, including  Bel Air Home for Children and Adolescents in Calliste, St. George's; Queen Elizabeth Home in Tempe, St. George's; Dorothy Hopkins Center for the Disabled in Tempe, St. George's; and the Program for Adolescent Mothers (PAM), in Mt. Parnassus, St. George's and the Emergency Shelter Center in St. George's.

Additionally, reachwithin collaborates with the Roving Caregivers of Grenada program and Grenada’s Child Protection Authority in order to augment their outreach work in at-risk communities.

WHY SUPPORT reachwithin?

There are many charities operating in Grenada and we are all working towards the same goal: to support the most vulnerable throughout the tri-islands. What makes reachwithin unique is we support both the child AND the caregiver. By teaching a child how to regulate their behavior and a caregiver to think think differently about how they manage the child, especially when it comes to discipline, we believe it will encourage a better outcome for all.

                                           a child explores her creative side in an Arts & Crafts workshop

HOW MONEY RAISED WILL BE SPENT?

A Run For Grenada aims to raise $20,000 USD for the following:

Youth Yoga Life Skills program - $9000

Bring three (3) Karma Kids Yoga/Conscious Discipline (CD) trained facilitators in Yoga, Art and Drumming, to five (5) care homes, weekly. They will deliver around 260 classes to +200 vulnerable youth in 2016. 

Caregiver Education program - $4000

Bring early-education expert and CD trained facilitators to four (4) care homes for one (1) year. They will help coach and monitor recently trained and untrained caregivers with best practice and advice.

After Care Life Skills - $2000

Planning and development of a life skills program supporting youth transitioning out residential care.

Program Supplies - $2000

Provide children's books, arts amd crafts supplies, yoga mats, yoga decks, drum refurbishments including CD supplies to children and caregivers across Grenada in 2016.

                                           Monty facilitates a group drumming workshop at a care home

Program Supplies Transportation - $2000

Transport facilitators and supplies for programs  - including a set of 10 drums - to care homes throughout Grenada. Also helps to off-set costs for shuttling children to special events and trips across the island. 

Indiegogo Fees -$1000

perks,  misc. and admin costs.

           up to 10 Djembe drums are transported to five care homes for weekly classes

In the event that we do not reach our target of $20,000 USD by Monday, 9 November 2015, we will allocate the funds that have been raised accordingly: Youth Program- 45%, Caregiver Education- 25%, After Care Life Skills Program- 10%, Supplies- 10%, Program Transportation- 10%, Misc. Fees- 5%.

OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT A RUN FOR GRENADA

Besides monetary donations, you can also support us by:

  • Sharing our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram posts with your contacts
  • Talk about us on social media with the hashtag #ARunForGrenada
  • Leave words of encouragement on our social media pages
  • If in Grenada on 1 Nov 2015 come out and cheer words of encouragement from the roadside
  • The run ends at the Petite Anse Hotel & Restaurant in Sauteurs, St Patricks. You are welcome to meet us there to help celebrate everyone's achievement. It has a great bar and restaurant so you can also enjoy a lovely meal and a drink. And it overlooks a beautiful beach so bring your bathing wear too!

                                        beautiful grounds and beach at Petite Anse Hotel & Restaurant

                                                         Follow us on Instagram

story:
Gram renovation

Gram is Sweden's first zero waste food and product store. We have hundreds of products in bulk as well as a selection of products to help you create less waste. 

We want to improve our beautiful shop in S:t Knut, so we are fundraising for the renovations. We will build more shelving so we can offer more products including zero-waste household products, beauty products, books and more foods. We also need to add essential extra storage space and invest in some new equipment. Most fun of all we will create a cosy place for customers to sit, have a coffee and read the books in our mini library.

What We Need 

  • We are aiming to raise around 13,000 sek to cover the renovation
  • We aim to keep the project as low waste (and low-cost) as possible by using reused and reclaimed materials
  • The funds will be used to pay for:
    • materials and furniture: 1000-3000 sek
    • time for our builder to source second-hand materials and furniture and build shelves and essential extra storage space: 8500 sek
    • coffee making equipment: 1500 sek

We really appreciate any contribution you can make to help us improve. We don't have the funds to do this without some community support.

if we exceed our goal we will invest in making the shop even better!

story:
• Free Car Storage for Deployed Service Personnel
  • Free Charity Car Shows (Venue Location & Insurance)

Provided by AZ Classic Car Center (AZClassicCarCenter.com)

Located in Peoria, Arizona

Details:

·  Safe, secure location with plenty of parking for Charity car shows at little or no cost to the Charity. ( All charities will be vetted to make sure they are legit) We will give priority in scheduling to charities dealing with Vets and Active duty service, also events for First Responders.

·  Safe, secure storage of old school vehicles in climate controlled area at a reasonable cost. We will install lifts to double up some of the vehicles and make 25% of storage areas available to deployed service people. We will get business sponsors to help with those vehicles, so there is no cost  to the service personnel. The Sponsors will be acknowledged at car events at the plaza.

·  We are planning on using a 15 acre plaza for vehicle storage and hosting car shows, Cruise Ins, and other car related events. The location will host a meeting room that will be available to all vehicle related clubs and non profits to hold their meetings and events with access to multimedia equipment for presentations.

·  The ACCC will be the home of the Arizona Automobile Hobbyist Council, an organization that has funded many charity events and keeps an eye on the AZ legislature for automotive issues for over 40 years.

Donations:

All plaque donors will be listed on a permanent plaque on the wall inside the AZ Classic Car Center. All donations made by businesses are advertising expenses. Each plaque donor will receive a Custom Tee Shirt (from the $25 Perk). Silver, Gold, and Platinum level donors will also receive banner advertisement space on AZClassicCarCenter.com (Silver: 3 Months, Gold: 6 Months, Platinum: 12 Months).

Platinum Level:  $500

Gold Level:  $250

Silver Level:  $100

Bronze Level:  $50

story:
Once again we are raising money to have an Inflatable Bounce House at this year's Block Party on Saturday, July 23rd. The money raised will cover renting the bounce house with an attendant for 6 hours.

This should be easy if we all pitch in a little bit...

There are hundreds of families on the block, so please make a donation in any amount that works for your family - no donation is too small. We'll meet our goal if we can get:

   110 families to each donate $5;

   55 families to each donate $10;

   22 families to each donate $25;

   11 families to each donate $50;

   5.5 families to each donate $100.

Why Do We Need An Attendant?

By hiring an attendant the Block Association does not take on any liability risk if anyone gets injured using the bounce house. Also, based on experience at past block parties, it's hard to get volunteers to supervise use of the bounce house: control the number of kids bouncing at one time, enforce time limits so all kids get a chance, etc.

What Happens If We Don't Raise All The Money?

This is an all or nothing effort. If we don't raise all the money, then no one's donation will be collected and we won't have a bounce house at this year's party.

What Happens If We Exceed The Goal?

Extra money will be used to cover other block party expenses such as the DJ, drinks, food, etc.

Why Is The Deadline June 30th?

We need to file with the Mayor's Office to expand our party permit to include an inflatable. We don't want to risk not having a Bounce House because we didn't allow enough time to deal with this bureaucracy.
story_txt:
Once again we are raising money to have an Inflatable Bounce House at this year's Block Party on Saturday, July 23rd. The money raised will cover renting the bounce house with an attendant for 6 hours.
This should be easy if we all pitch in a little bit...
There are hundreds of families on the block, so please make a donation in any amount that works for your family - no donation is too small. We'll meet our goal if we can get:
   110 families to each donate $5;
   55 families to each donate $10;
   22 families to each donate $25;
   11 families to each donate $50;
   5.5 families to each donate $100.
Why Do We Need An Attendant?
By hiring an attendant the Block Association does not take on any liability risk if anyone gets injured using the bounce house. Also, based on experience at past block parties, it's hard to get volunteers to supervise use of the bounce house: control the number of kids bouncing at one time, enforce time limits so all kids get a chance, etc.
What Happens If We Don't Raise All The Money?
This is an all or nothing effort. If we don't raise all the money, then no one's donation will be collected and we won't have a bounce house at this year's party.
What Happens If We Exceed The Goal?
Extra money will be used to cover other block party expenses such as the DJ, drinks, food, etc.
Why Is The Deadline June 30th?
We need to file with the Mayor's Office to expand our party permit to include an inflatable. We don't want to risk not having a Bounce House because we didn't allow enough time to deal with this bureaucracy.

story:
BUBDESK - PERTH’S FIRST WORKSPACE WITH A CRÈCHE

Poised to open on February 15th, it will be Perth’s one & only co-working space with a crèche, providing entrepreneurs and those with flexible work arrangements the total support structure they need to get the most from their own business in a productive and supportive environment or transition back into work following the birth of a bub. The plan is to have several branches around Perth by the end of next year, shortly followed by our interstate launch.

CHEER SQUAD

MAKE 2016 YOUR YEAR

Whatever your line of work BubDesk is available to assist you in creating the lifestyle you've been searching for.

CRÈCHE FACILITIES

BubDesk’s crèche is state or the art:

  • Staffed by qualified nannies
  • Nap zone 
  • Breastfeeding room

 

Our crèche caters to bubs aged 3 months to 4 years, so if day care is an issue for you please feel free to bring them along. The bub space is upstairs, while the majority of work is downstairs, allowing you to work undistracted.

THE STORY

Meg Burrage noticed this gap in the market when she herself became a mum and did not want to return to full time work, but at the same time, she wasn’t ready to give up her career either.  

With our vast array of family friendly dining, events and amazing play spaces, not to mention the beaches… how was it that Perth catered for parents in every area except co-working spaces?? 

Meg started to spread word of her intentions to open BubDesk and pretty soon (like a matter of weeks!) the idea took off and in partnership with Power of Circles founder, Asha Stabback, she was on the brink of launching the solution for so many parents in Perth.

BUBDESK FOR THE WORKING PROFESSIONAL

You don’t have to be a self-employed entrepreneur to belong in the BubDesk community. BubDesk is also the answer for those parents on paternity leave looking to transition back into the workforce, but finding that either day care is an issue or that they’re simply not ready to be separated from their baby throughout the day. In conjunction with The Mummy Coach we can offer Perth businesses full return-to-work programmes for their new parents to encourage them back into the workforce as soon as they’re ready, helping businesses to attract and retain good female talent, while building their repuation as an employer of choice.

NO BABY?

BubDesk may offer crèche facilities, but that doesn't mean you need to bring a baby with you! For the Workshop Warriors amongst you, how much higher would your attendance be if you could offer your workshop as complete with crèche? For the consultants amongst you, how much easier would it be to work with your clients if they could pop their bub into the crèche for an hour while you book out a meeting pod?

BECOME A FOUNDING MEMBER

BubDesk is built on the foundation that there is incredible power when people come together to collaborate. With your support BubDesk will be able to bring the first female-inspired co-working space to Perth encouraging an inspiring and diverse support system.

The following women have already jumped on board and will be seen regularly at BubDesk collaborating, workshopping, mentoring and inspiring you to achieving your goals.

Like what you hear? Join the movement by contributing to our Indiegogo campaign. 

When you do, you will be become a founding member of BubDesk. Through your generosity, funds raised through will:

  • Help secure our dream building, the Old Perth Flour Mill, centrally located at 12 Lindsay St, Northbridge (you're going to love this place!)
  • Allow us to create some amazing spaces (private offices, inspiring boardroom, workshop, chill-out lounge and open co-working areas, not to mention the coolest crèche you’ve ever seen!)
  • Establish you as a founding member of BubDesk and in return, deliver investment related rewards


THE REWARDS

We really wanted to put together a list of rewards that would be greater than the contributions you have given us. After giving it a lot of thought, we were able to create an incredible list to show our deepest appreciation for our incredibly generous backers. 

Among this list you will find:

  • Co-working space
  • Meeting Room Hire
  • Boardroom or Training Room Offers
  • Monthly Memberships
  • Business Coaching Sessions

If you're looking for seriously crazy value check out the 3 month specials!!

THE DETAILS

BubDesk membership offers access to our elegant, collaborative, and female-inspired co-working space at a variety of pricing levels. Memberships range from the use of private offices to drop-in collaborative spaces. We also offer mentoring, business coaching and workshop space.

THE TEAM

Alongside Meg Burrage, founder of BubDesk and mother of one, is business partner Asha Stabback, founder of Power of Circles and Community Director at BubDesk & Nanny Agent Extraodinaire, Amy Evans, of AJ Nannies.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 There are several ways you can assist without spending a cent:

* Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word – who could do with this amongst your friends or family?

* Handyperson services - electrician, carpenter, plumber all needed

* Perhaps you're a journalist or blogger and can assist with some media exposure?

* Maybe you're a business owner and interested in offering your employees a return to work programme in conjunction with BubDesk

For further information check out www.bubdesk.com.au and for all the latest updates head to www.facebook.com/bubdesk

Feel free to email and discuss your requirements info@bubdesk.com.au

We also offer mentoring, business coaching and workshop space.THE TEAMAlongside Meg Burrage, founder of BubDesk and mother of one, is business partner Asha Stabback, founder of Power of Circles and Community Director at BubDesk & Nanny Agent Extraodinaire, Amy Evans, of AJ Nannies.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP There are several ways you can assist without spending a cent:* Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word – who could do with this amongst your friends or family?* Handyperson services - electrician, carpenter, plumber all needed* Perhaps you're a journalist or blogger and can assist with some media exposure?* Maybe you're a business owner and interested in offering your employees a return to work programme in conjunction with BubDeskFor further information check out www.bubdesk.com.au and for all the latest updates head to www.facebook.com/bubdeskFeel free to email and discuss your requirements info@bubdesk.com.au

story:
Our Story

Melissa and I have been friends since high school. On top of being an amazing friend, she is one of those rare people who is always thinking of ways to give her resources, time and energy to others. She works as a special education teacher and has given her summer breaks to serve orphan children in Uganda. While in Uganda, she met a baby girl with cerebral palsy named Lola. Melissa knew instantly that she was looking at her daughter. Ever since meeting Lola, Melissa has been working tirelessly to adopt Lola and bring her home. 


When I began to think of ways to celebrate my 30th birthday, I quickly realized that what I wanted most was to give back to a friend who has given so much to me. Please help me celebrate my 30th by bringing Lola home! 


The Impact

Right now, Lola lays on a bed in an Uganda orphanage without the medical attention she needs due to her cerebral palsy.  Doctors have evaluated her and said that there is no reason she couldn't be walking and talking with the proper therapy. What she most needs is the love of a family and the proper, daily physical therapy.  These are two things that due to tremendous lack of resources and overpopulation the orphanages in Uganda simply cannot provide. 


By giving to Bring Lola Home you will be providing Melissa with much needed funds to adopt Lola and to cover medical expenses.  You will be helping a little girl find a good home and the care she needs.  I don't know what God has in store for Lola, but I do know He has an amazing plan in mind for this little girl. Please give what you can and know that every penny you give will be of a huge help to this new family. Every penny you give will be an investment in Lola's future. 

What We Need & What You Get

Melissa lives on a teacher's salary, and though she has never asked for funds from her friends, I know that  adopting as a single mom is tough enough without trips to Uganda, and the medical expenses of a special needs child. My goal is to raise as much as possible to help Melissa focus her energy on getting Lola healthy and happy. 


No amount is too small. Please give what you can. 

Let's see how much we can give in 30 days for my 30th birthday.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please use the share tools on this page to get the word out about Bring Lola Home. Please tell as many people as you can to give an amazing gift to these two extraordinary people.

story:
Our Story

We're looking for startup capital to open Reliable Cheese Company, Durham, NC's first artisanal cheese shop! Durham was recently named America's foodiest small town and yet the only place to get good cheese, cured meats, beer or wine is at a national chain grocery store. I've spent the past five years working at some of the best cheese shops in New York and now I'm in North Carolina and ready to bring the sort of small, friendly & knowledgeable neighborhood shop that is prevalent there to this area.

We see our customers as people who are no longer simply satisfied by a cheese that is "all natural" or free from added hormones. They want one that is produced using traditional methods (some dating back thousands of years), from the milk of well cared for animals and shaped by the hands of real people, not machines. Cheese that not only tastes amazing, but is a doorway to the small farms of Europe or the amazing farms in our own region. Our customers are excited about food. We want to be there to share that excitement with them.

We're in the process of securing a space in downtown Durham and expect to open in early 2011. In order for this to happen, we need funding to purchase equipment and inventory. Having no assets and being a small food business, bank loans are not available to us. We need to reach out to the food loving community and ask that they help us bring great cheese to the area.


The Impact

Right now, there is no place in the area that a cheese lover can get high quality cheese cheese cut to order by the sort of professional cheesemongers that populate the streets of Europe, New York and other larger American cities. We will bring a level of quality and personal service that customers have come to expect at their local wine shop and expand that to the world of cheese and charcuterie. We also hope to pave the way for more retail shopping in an area where recent growth has primarily centered on restaurants. 


What We Need & What You Get

The first thing we need to do is fix up our space and get it ready to go. We need to upfit the plumbing and electricity to support our cheesy ways.

We also need to buy a lot of equipment. Everything from deli cases, a cutting board, refrigerators, displays and a cash register to sinks and cleaning equipment all needs to be purchased and installed before we can open.

And finally there is the cheese. We can't open without anything to sell so we need funds to buy inventory.

Though our goal is $10,000, every little bit helps. If we do not reach our goal, we intend to, as we do now, continue to seek out other sources of funding. Without the help of cheese fans out there, we can't open our doors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Most people aren't deep pocket investors so the power of crowd sourced funding is in numbers and the best way to insure our success is to get as many people as possible in on the action.


So share this on your blog, tell your Facebook friends, tweet about us, make cold calls, send chain letters - do whatever you can to help us raise the money we need to open our store! 


Lastly, you can help by contributing manual labor. This is primarily for the locals (but if you want to travel to help out we won't turn you down!). We will begin working on the space to get it ready to open as soon as we sign our lease (hopefully February 1, 2011). We will need help painting and building displays. We have very limited carpentry skills so any help in that area is especially needed.  The plan is to build our counter, shelving, tables and any other display surfaces out of reclaimed wood, so we also need help sanding, refinishing and otherwise preparing the wood for use in the store.


The reclaimed wood will come from the Moes Cider Mill in Vermilion, OH (Northeast Ohio, near Cleveland), and we need volunteers to help here too. As some of you may know, Patrick's family owns Moes Cider Mill. I grew up on the farm next to it and the business is very much a part of my family's history. The cider mill ceased operation about 15 years ago and has been sitting vacant since. There is a possibility it will be torn down in the near future and I want to keep this bit of history alive, so I have decided to incorporate as much of it into my store as possible. I will need help in removing any usable wood from the structure, including a barn door with a painting of Johnny Appleseed.


In addition to volunteers we also need any tools you can bring. We have a few basic hand tools, but will need a lot more to do this work, and we'd rather spend the money we have on things for the store instead of tools.

story:
Social Socials along with St. Lukeï¿½s Roosevelt CCC/The NiteStar Program asks for your help!

 

 

The NiteStar Program began their friendship with Margaret Boogere the caretaker of The Orphans Club after we adapted their story to stage from Rory Kennedyï¿½s documentary film, ï¿½Pandemic: Facing AIDSï¿½ in 2003.  As a company we were touched by the strength the children had living with HIV and AIDS in the face of stigma, poverty and other insurmountable odds. Every year since, NiteStar has sent a donation of clothing, shoes and other gifts to the orphans.  In order to send these items we must raise over 2,000 dollars in shipping costs.  On May 19th Social Socials assisted us in hosting a Relief Jam.  It was an evening filled with a variety of performances.  We collected lots of clothes and about 400.00 but are still far away from being able to ship the clothes to the students in Uganda.   We need at least 1,000 dollars to ship the clothes and if we raise 2,000 more we can also send the students shoes, something many of them have never had before.

 

The Tororo Orphans Club currently is sponsor to 150 students either infected or affected by the HIV epidemic.  Many of them have become to primary care givers in the family after loosing the older generation to HIV/AIDS.  The Orphans Club provides shelter, support, clothing, food and a creative outlet to their affected students in Uganda.  They do this almost entirely through donations.  In a country where approx. 130,000 of the people infected with HIV are children they need our help!  Please find it in your hearts to donate $1, $2, $10 to our cause.  If a lot of people do a little bit, we can make a difference in the world.

 

 

 Founded by Dr. Cydelle Berlin twenty two years ago, The NiteStar Program is a special project of St. Luke Rooseveltï¿½s Center For Comprehensive Care and uses a theater based model incorporating drama, music and peer education to help guide pre- adolescents, adolescents and young adults as they confront the many challenges of growing up in the age of AIDS. Productions are all original, created by the members of the company. They are culturally appropriate and age-specific, designed to diffuse myths, provide HIV/AIDS awareness, pregnancy, substance abuse and relationship violence prevention, help youth to make informed decisions, provide options for changing attitudes and prejudices, and create opportunities for behavioral change.

 

Social Socials is an organization built on the idea that helping people should be fun and enjoyable. We are entirely volunteer-based, from top to bottom. Our operating costs are typically minimal due to the fact that we work in large part in donated spaces with extraordinary talent that donate their time. No money raised goes into our own pockets, but instead goes straight to the causes for which we are celebrating. It is our goal here not only to do as much good as we can for the world, but to provide an avenue for everyone to give or to do just a little to better the state of human kind. Our purpose as people is to help and provide for one another so that our growth as a global society is constant and shared. The purpose of Social Socials to to make sure that we enjoy it.  For more information on Social Socials please email: joereese623@gmail.com

story:
How can YOU save TWO lives?

Imagine
• a service dog that can free your special needs child and allow him or her to learn, grow, and be safe.
• the reality of a service dog that can so greatly help your child, costs up to $30,000 from most non-profit agencies.
• that you could have a service dog for your child – free of charge from MERLIN’S KIDS…a New Jersey “Non-profit” CHARITY. All donations are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

The Reality
• You want a service dog for your special needs child, but the only way to afford one is to pay an agency by raising funds from family, friends, and businesses.

• You spend every penny paying for Occupational Therapy, Physical Therapy, Speech Therapy, teachers, therapists, and aides, not to mention medications.

• You not only do not have extra money, but no extra time to fundraise and why should you? You have more important things to do…like care for your child, his/her siblings, and on top of it all, keep up paying the bills.

• You tolerate condescending looks in public places, those “why are you not controlling your child” glares from those unaware that your child is not “typical”, but they just don’t get it. They are quick to judge because the “curse” of AUTISM is that these beautiful children “look normal” so why would anyone assume otherwise?

• Now realize that there is affordable hope for you and your child! This is where “saving two lives” comes in.

Save a dog. Save a family.
Merlin’s KIDS is a non-profit organization that provides FREE service dogs for children with autism and other special needs. We rescue dogs from shelters (many snatched from death row) rehabilitate and train each one to the specific needs of the child and family.

Merlin’s KIDS not only gives these dogs hope and a chance at a new life – they are also the life line for a special needs child. Help us help you save two lives at a time. All services are provided free of charge to families, because we want you to enjoy spending time with your family and help your child be the next Temple Grandin, not the next Room 314 Bed 2.

For more information about how you can save two lives, please visit www.merlinsKIDS.org. Watch our video with Temple, and enjoy our Merlin’s Kids Mix by Buck Smooth.

PLEASE DONATE NOW TO HELP SAVE LIVES! Don’t wait for someone else to help! YOU ARE SOMEONE ELSE and your donation of even $10, joined with hundreds of others, will save lives and change worlds. Larger donations of $75 or more earn you GREAT GIFTS so CARE ENOUGH TO DONATE NOW! All Merlin’s KIDS donations go directly to providing free services and free service dogs to children and their families. All Merlin’s KIDS donations go directly to providing free services and free service dogs to children and their families. Save a dog. Save your family.

Merlin’s KIDS. Animals and Children Helping Each Other™. NJ 501©3
