story:
Our Story

CosplayMedics is a small business dedicated to nurturing cosplayers by providing resources like theatre quality make-up; "crossplay" supplies for both men and women; and wig sprays and detanglers. We encourage young costumers to embrace their craft and take pride in it. Cosplay is a creative art, and a chance for individuals to express themselves through fashion and roleplay.We won't sell you a costume, but we'll give you advice, and provide you with resources and encouragement along the way. With almost 14 years of cosplaying under our belts, we've accepted plenty of help with our costumes. It's time for us to return the favor.

Our campaign is actually two endeavors that happen to play well together. Good hygiene is a problem that plagues the cosplay community, and CosplayMedics wants to grow and nurture that same community. So, any funds that do not directly assist in freshening up convention attendees, will then be given to CosplayMedics to help with business costs. CosplayMedics will then, work to create enough profit to purchase more supplies to freshen up even more convention attendees.

The Impact

This campaign is a battle for a better con experience. Ever walked into the convention hall and caught a whiff of someone who makes your nosehairs curl? Or caught a terrible case of the "con crud"? These issues wouldn't nearly be as bad if everyone attending simply showered daily, wore deodorant, and washed their hands regularly.

That's not to say that simple means easy. Hygiene problems have plagued conventions ever since the beginning of Geekdom, and it will take a lot of time and energy to help make it better. We plan on educating attendees, as well as providing solutions, in hopes that eventually, every con-goer will smell as sweet as a spring breeze.

We will start at Sakuracon 2012, and move on from there. The more people donate, the more conventions we can visit!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The biggest problem with getting people to wash, is to make sure they are provided with enough resources and encouragement. This means purchasing travel-sized amenities in huge quantities and having people around to hand them out. While I plan on volunteering my time for these endeavors, if I need more manpower, I will most likely be thanking my helpers with meals and convention badges.

If we just barely miss our goal, and raise $3999, the cost break down will look like this.

     $1360 - Deodorant wipes in masculine and feminine scents

     $1200 - Soap, toothbrushes and toothpaste

     $1080 - Donation gifts, convention badges and meals for helpers

     $359.91 - Indiegogo fees

     $0.09 - Invested in CosplayMedics, to help grow the business and spread the love to other conventions

So, what do you get out of this?

Well, approximately $0.64 out of every dollar will go towards amenity kits for the stinky masses, so you will know that no matter how much or little you help us, you will be making at least one person cleaner. Other than that, there are some gifts that might interest you. The Con Survival Kit is there to save you from hunger, as is the "Food and Drink" event. The more people that choose the "Food and Drink" event, means more money for better food and a better venue. The venue will be locked down 3 weeks before Sakuracon 2012. The rest of the perks are pretty straight forward; if a little cosplayer-centric. Of course, you can opt to not take a perk, in which case, you would be gaining that much more love from us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have a lot of cashola? That's fine too. CosplayMedics still needs lots of people to spread the word! Feel free to link us on Facebook, Twitter, your favorite forum, whatever! The more people who see this, the better chance we have of meeting our goal.

 

About The Video

For those who are curious, our promo video was made with Ren'Py (www.renpy.org) and captured with Fraps. The music was provided by ç…‰ç„åº­åœ’ (http://www.rengoku-teien.com/). Many thanks to those who those people who were around offer advice and assistance during the production!

story:
The (brief) Vision

I've been a proud resident of Muncie for nearly 16 years. I've been working in Indy for 5 of those, and in that time I've gotten to experience some things that Muncie just doesn't have.  One of those things is the beauty of food trucks.  By now, most of you have heard of them, and hopefully you've gotten to enjoy them.  I would like to get the ball rolling with Muncie's first food truck, Slop on Top.

What Slop on Top Needs 

Very simply, we need some money and interest to get things started.  I'd like to prove that there is enough interest in order to make this happen as well.  The more supporters I have, regardless of size, the more proof I have that this is something Muncie wants and deserves.  All but the smallest pledges will get you a fairly-priced return from the truck.  This isn't a handout, this is the equivalent of a pre-order, so pledge generously, and I'll be able to this thing running in time for the first months of BSU.

I already have the truck, so the money will be going to make the modifications to turn it into a Slop-slingin' Supertruck. The goal amount of $8000 is based on the various things that need to happen to the truck before its ready for prime time.

  • Cooking/restaurant equipment ( majority of expenses )
  • 3 bay sink & wash sink installed
  • Ventilation 
  • Plumbing, both water and gas
  • Generators & electrical work to accomodate 
  • Installation of serving window 
  • Fresh water storage and waste water collection
  • Vinyl graphic wrap for the truck

The Bigger Vision

I want to give back to Muncie.  I want to see it be able to revel in some of the fun and deliciousness that is experienced elsewhere.  I think we can start something big with this first foray into food trucks in Muncie.

"So wait, what will Slop on Top serve?"

I love delicious food, but equally, I love affordable.  I want to offer something that hits both of those marks.  Slop on Top, as the name suggests, will be serving you a delicious ( though admittedly "sloppy" ) concoction atop a bed of rice ( or potentially some other "substrate" ).  So many cultures have found the beauty of rice, and made it a staple in their dishes. Take some time and imagine how many different cultures do this: Indian, Chinese, Thai, Mexican, Cajun/Creole, African, Spanish, and surely many more. Many times this is in the form of some colorful, tasty goodness, heaped on top of a bed of rice.  That is approximately the vision of Slop on Top: a heap of rice, covered with a tasty concoction, served to you at a price that will make you feel happy.  

"I don't have much money, but I love the idea... "

Ok, there are going to be some people that I will hear say this.  Don't worry about it, but please consider giving a small pledge, and give us a whole bunch of social support.  Tell your "wealthier" friends, and encourage them to be a part of this movement!  You know how this stuff works.  Twitter and Facebook have changed the world, and I'm expecting your help in doing so here in Muncie. :)

story:
About the brand

Born and raised in India, Avni Trivedi has a unique vision in the fashion industry and has established herself as a women's clothing designer, based out of Boston.  

Avni's mission is to create environmentally conscious fashion collections that support the cottage fabric-making industry and the talented artisans in her native country.  The fabrics used in Avni's collections are 100% hand-dyed, woven, and embroidered by artisans.

With a new addition to the designer and her family, their daughter Aanya, there will also be an addition to the Avni brand; an organic, naturally dyed baby wear line.

This campaign is to help fund the development of this line. Organic products are crucial to newborns to ensure their healh, safety, and development.  Each garment is hand-made and dyed using various herbs and flowers found in nature.  The dyes are created from recycled flowers, pomegranite skins, and even onion peels.

We strive to make organic baby wear an affordable option for consumers.

How will my donation be used?

Our goal to start production of the baby wear line is between $10,000 and $15,000.  This money will help pay for materials needed, labor costs, and distribution of the products.  

The materials needed to produce the line include: fabric, dyes, thread, buttons, snaps, zippers, etc. 

The funding will also help cover the labor costs for the artisans in India.  They include our embroiderers, stitchers, fabric-makers, dyers, and our pattern makers.

Your donations will also be used to support the "Because I am a Girl" foundation.  This charity is focused on providing opportunites for underprivileged girls around the world.  Donations made will not only help to provide food, clean water, and healthcare, but will also enable these young ladies to receive an education and pursue their dreams. 

If we do not reach our goal, these funds will be used in the same manner to assist with the production of the organic baby wear line.

The Impact

The rise in awareness of the benefits of organic products has created a demand in the market for environmentally friendly products.  These products do not only benefit the environment, they also benefit our health and our future.

Organic products are especially important when it comes to babies.  A newborn's skin is extremely thin and sensitive and will very easily absorb the harmful chemicals that are commonly used in clothing production.

At Avni Fashion, we are striving to make organic baby wear more readily available for the continually growing eco-friendly economy.

What's in it for you?

With your generous donation, we are offering many different perks to show our appreciation.

story:
Remembering Jaclyn

IF you are looking at this, you were impacted by Jaclyn's friendship. She was the kind of person who would drop anyhing to help. She was always talking about her children, she loved them with every fiber of her being. The goal of this fund is to make sure we as a community take care of her children, in whatever way we can.

Jaclyn was planning Andy's birthday before she died, I'd like to be able to meet the goal to be able to give it to him on his birthday.

 

What We Need

I set the goal at $2,000. 

The children's grandmother Sandy is taking care of the children. Lets support her as a community and help her financially. Is 2,000 a good goal? I'm not sure, but I'd like to think its a feasible one for the time being.  

The Impact

Jaclyn's children lost everything in an instant. We are all heartbroken for them. A monetary gift for Andy's birthday would remind the family that we are standing by them. We will never forget Jaclyn, she was a beautiful mother.

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember that food and cards are helpful too even if you can't give money. Most of all, never forget who Jaclyn was. She was our friend and we loved her. Keep her in your heart forever.

story:
Justice4Vee Campaign

Friday, Sepember 21 Eva (Vee) Ampaw was unjustly removed from her business by Mr. David Hillary, owner of Hillary's Cleaners in Ottawa. After the incident, she was left with nothing from her business, and now has to fend for herself.

Hi Everyone, my name is Phoebe Ampaw and I am campaining to raise money to help cover the legal costs for my mother Vee. 

Just a taste of who Vee really is, my mother is that woman who always makes sure people are welcomed and feel at home. As a university student, I have many friends that live on campus. And the one thing that really amazed me about my mother was on Thanksgiving Day when my she asked me to invite all my friends who were away from home to come and have Thanksgiving dinner with our family. She did this because she knew the value of family and, as a student, being far away from home on a family holiday is not easy. It makes me laugh, as I remember my mother dishing out leftovers in tupperware for my friends to take back to to their homes on campus.

This campaign is very dear to my heart because Vee is the kind of woman and mother who is always giving out of the depths of her heart whether or not she has. Now that her business has been unjustly taken from her, it really bothers me to see my mom struggle to afford a lawyer. So, I have taken matters into my own hands along with my sister (Anna Ampaw), and two very close friends (Vanessa Hayford and Samih Abiad) to give back and help my mother out.

As of now, Vee has contacted a lawyer and costs will undoubtedly come up as the legal process goes on. Our plan is to raise $5000 which we hope will cover these costs.

Hillary's Cleaners is a large dry cleaning chain in Ottawa which has been around for over 60 years. We find it it so unjust that such a big company can take advantage of a small company such as Vee Tailoring. As Canadian citizens we all have rights and priviledges and those who feel they have the power to override these rights must be held accountable for their actions. We have complete faith in our community and we are confident that justice will prevail.

Article of the story in the Ottawa Citizen: 

http://www.ottawacitizen.com/news/a9ans+businesswoman+claims+been+taken+cleaners/7317276/story.html

How can you help?

Financial contributions of any amount will be accepted.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Spread the news by using Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter and all other platforms of social media to share the story.

Facebook Group: http://www.facebook.com/groups/justice4vee/

story:
My Story

I am an Artist ,a Creative Consultant, and an adjunct faculty member at Harford Community College and the TAI Sophia Institute for the Healing Arts, both in Maryland.  I believe in the importance of creative service.  I do this through sharing my personal artwork and helping others tap into their creativity by sharing knowledge and experience from my life.


On October 14th, 2011, I leave for Kenya, Africa. Through a program entitled “Kenya Calling”, I have the opportunity to experience African culture through direct, hands-on experiences.  Under the leadership of facilitators David Baum and Kathy Karn, who have partnered with “Free the Children” and “Me to We”, I will visit Kenya for ten days.  David and Kathy specialize in bringing together groups of strangers from all walks of life and creating communities that make a difference in the world.


In a unique cross-cultural exchange with the local people of the Masai-Mara, I'll engage in personal encounters with women leaders and local elders,and perform service work within their community.  I will also assist in building a school.  By immersing myself in the community David and Kathy and the Masai-Mara create with us, I will absorb a great deal that I can pass on to others.


Why am I going to Kenya specifically? Thirty years ago, I was working in a bookstore in Washington, DC when a book entitled Masai appeared on our bookshelves. The visible joy and nobility of these people was captivating to me.   I promised myself that if the opportunity to visit arose, I would take it.  There are moments in our lives that open up before us as potential soulful encounters.  Seeing the photographs in that book was Kenya calling to me. I am responding with an enthusiastic "Yes!"


When I show up to any situation, I show up as an artist.  There is no way to separate who I am from what I do.  As artists, we envision, we dream, we bring possibilities..  Possibilities bring engagement and engagement benefits every community.   From the moment I said yes to this trip, I have felt profoundly inspired.  Inspiration is contagious.  Help me pass it on.

.


The Impact

Through this experience in Africa, I hope to find a deeper strength inside myself, the joy of giving, and profound inspiration.  I will be exposed to different people, customs, languages, foods, smells, wildlife and the extraordinary heritage of the Kenyan landscape.    Entirely new sensations and experiences will inspire art work that would not be possible to create if I stayed at home.  I will be profoundly changed by this trip and a dream, 30 years in the making, will be fulfilled. 


Upon my return, I intend to find a way to effectively communicate my experience with as many people as possible: reflections on the impact that each of us has on the entire planet, a better understanding of water as a precious resource, an embodiment of deep gratitude that world travel, especially to developing countries, offers us.


Thus far, I am planning talks, free and open to the public in the Baltimore, Harford County, MD and New Rochelle, New York communities.  My college students, creativity group, and those I consult with will also benefit.

 

What I Need & What You Receive in Exchange

 $7,085 will pay for the following expenses:

 Remaining vaccinations and required medications:  $809
 Round trip airfare:                                                   $1728
 Balance on "Kenya Calling" workshop (which includes all lodging, meals and in-country transportation)   
                                                                                 $3995                        
 Visa in Kenya -                                                            $50
 Travel Insurance -                                                     $503

 If I do not meet my financial goal here, I will use the amount raised towards the trip and the search for funding will continue  I am definitely going to Kenya!  I have additionally applied for several development grants which are pending.

 

In exchange for your support, I will bring creativity to your door.   You will receive original signed art work for donations starting at $25!  I have limited edition prints as well.  In addition, I am offering a one-day or a weekend creativity workshop at your home with a group of friends or family.  I supply all the materials.  Lastly,for the big donor, I am offering a commissioned portrait of the person of your choice.  
See examples of my work: www.ginapierleoni.com and http://bakerartistawards.org/nomination/view/Gi...  


Other Ways You Can Help

I welcome your support and the support of your communities!  I love the vision of a human net of manifestation. Remember, even the smallest gift has an enormous impact.

Other ways you can help:

  ** Spread the word!  Post a link on your Facebook or other social media page.

  ** Request that someone make a donation in your name instead of giving you a birthday/anniversary or other kind of gift you don't really want or need.

  ** Make a donation in the name an aspiring artist you know.

  ** Donate a week's latte and pastry money.  Food is essentially rented and the gift you'll receive for donating is for keeps.

  ** You can give a gift anonymously just because it makes your feel good.


Share your dreams so that others can support you in attaining them!  Thank you for your support!

story:
What is A Loving Legacy all about?

          A Loving Legacy is a non-profit organization dedicated to preserving the legacy of children and adults who have a serious or terminal illness (Cancer, ALS, Alzheimers, etc.), as well as seniors in the "Golden Age" of life (75 or older), regardless of health. 

"Legacy" videos are produced FREE of charge for our clients!!

            Legacy" videos provide a way for our clients to tell the stories about their lives they want people to remember.  Some have recounted stories from their youth and how they were raised, and the memories they have of those days gone by.  This is also a good opportunity to tell your family history.  Others have taken the opportunity to speak about their illness and how it has affected their outlook on life.    Legacy videos are also an excellent opportunity for people to leave behind parting words of Love, Wisdom, and Encouragement for friends and loved ones, for some of life's future events such as;  Graduations, Weddings, or the birth of a child

            A Legacy video is a not only a great way to preserve your legacy within your circle of friends; it also serves as a great benefit to future generations in general.  Who better to hear stories from the past, than from those who actually experienced it?

            For young children, we focus on the positive!  The videos we produce for their families highlight the spirit within the child.  We spend some time with both the child and their family and capture them at play, and being creative.  We then take the footage we capture, and add it to home video and photos provide by the family, to make a final video that celebrates the child's young life.

The Impact

The response we have received from surviving family members, hospital administrators, and video subjects themselves has been overwhelming.  Most all have said that our service is something they would have never thought of, or had the capability to do on their own.

On a personal note, I now know first hand just how important and impactful a Legacy video can be.  During the structure of this campaing, my father passed away from a sudden heart attack.  Thankfully, just 6 weeks prior to his un-expected death, we sat down with him and filmed him telling his life story.  Now, myself and my siblings will always have that video to watch, when we are missing him and just need to hear his voice again.  More importantly, my 6 year old daughter, will be able to watch that as she grows older, and remember who her grandpa was and what his life was like. 

What we need:

We are currently working in conjunction with several well known hospitals to provide our service to seriously ill patients at their facilities.  However, a hospital is not the most quiet and private place to shoot such an emotional video.   Not to mention the fact that there are many other patients in the facilities, that can be easily disturbed by us setting up our equipment, even though we shoot with a single camera, and no lights.  So, after several meetings with staff and administrators, we have agreed that having the ability to bring a mobile studio to the hospital, and bring the patients out to us would be the best all around solution.  This allows us to have complete control of the production environment, as well as making it comfortable for other patients in the hospital.    

**UPDATE***  We have recently been invited by several organizations that deal with ALS, Alzheimers, and Cancer patients to attend various events they are putting on.  The ability to have this trailer on-site at these events, means that we will be able to produce several videos at each event. 

 

We need to raise $20,000 in order to purchase the trailer and get it set-up.  Your TAX DEDUCTABLE  donation will go toward the following:

20 foot enclosed cargo trailer -              $8,000

Sound Walls for inside of trailer -           $2,000

Custom Trailer Wrap -                          $2,000

Studio Lighting -                                  $1,500

Sound Equipment                                 $1,500

Generator                                            $1,000

Misc. (chairs, backdrops, etc)                 $1,000

Structural and Electrical Modifications       $2,000

Air Conditioning Unit                             $1,000

 

Our organization and production team is made up of  all volunteers who work in not only the professional film and video industries, but various other professions such as Marketing and Accounting.  All have agreed to donate their time to help our organization provide this service.

A Loving Legacy is a designated 501(c)3 organization our tax id number is 27-4831805

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word about our organization and this campaign:

Facebook:   http://www.facebook.com/alovinglegacy

Twitter: https://twitter.com/alovinglegacy

Website:  www.alovinglegacy.org

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Why LFE?

The conventional way to help the homeless is to feed them, clothe them, and maybe provide them with shelter or affordable housing. I call people who do this, heroes. Their hearts are big and they are selfless in spirit. This is the way it is done now and it's the way it has always been done.

But I want to provide another option. I feel that the root of the problem is not addressed. From what I've read, a single homeless person can cost between $35,000 to $95,000 a year. That's the money it takes to feed, clothe, train, etc...

For the amount to take care of two people a year, LFE can help dozens, forever. Once the initial cost of growing crops, building self-sustaining homes and training are complete, the community runs itself. We can even build a small farmer's market to sell excess crops and make things to sell online. The money can go back into the community to buy thing they need and more land, to help more people.

We already have the 40 acres. We just need the funds to get this started. We aren't trying to help people survive. We are trying to help people have a sense of purpose again and the ability to provide for themselves and their children.

Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
~Chinese Proverb
 
There are dozens of tent cities around the US and within those tent cities, there are families with children that have lost everything. For the cost of a small house, we plan on using the 40 acres we already have to build a self sustaining community for these families. The money donated will go to buy equipment and build the infrastructure to start this plan. 
 
Our initial plan outline is as follows:
1. Establish base camp
    - level tent sites
    - fire rings
    - toilet
    - bath house
2. Water Tank(s)
    - dig and level foundations
    - rain catchment
    - water filtration
3. Semi permanent dried structure
4. Camp Kitchen
    - cob stove
    - rocket stove
    - BBQ
5. Earth Work
    - dig foundations
    - swales/ponds
    - roads
 
Once we get the first the crops planted and the first couple of homes built, we will start the process of moving a homeless family with children into their new home.
 
Help us spread the word to make this idea a reality. You can keep up with our progress on our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/LandForEveryone
 
Even a dollar helps!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute, but help us get the word out on our campaign. Help us spread the word by:

Posting our campaign link to your Facebook page.

Liking and linking our Facebook page to your Facebook wall.

story:
My sister and I need a attorney who will fight for us.

 

WE NEED TO BRING LIGHT ON THE FOSTER CARE SYSTEM WHO ARE USING CHILDREN FOR FINACIAL GAIN! THIS CHILD HAS BEGGED TO COME HOME OR BE PLACED WITH HER SISTER (ME) AND SHE IS NOT BEING RETURNED DUE TO MY MOTHER HAVING ASPERGERS SYNDROME AND IS BEING DISCRIMINATED AGAINST.

 

My name is Amber and my little sister has been in foster care for over 3 years now. I have been trying to gain custody of her since she was removed from my mother's care. I was never contacted or offered custody when she was taken, and I have been fighting ever since but since I have no legal background or money to hire an attorney both my rights and my sister's rights are continuing to be violated. This video was taken 6 months after they were removed from my mother's care and she is trying to explain that she was being physically abused; bitten, scratched, hit by an adult in the home. The more I have tried to fight for our rights the more I have been ailenatied from my sister. I have not been allowed phone calls for over 5 months, when I did get a short visit 2 years ago she did nothing but cry to come home, she complained about her tummy hurting, and aches in her limbs. All caused by improper food she is given. She has celiac disease and can not tollerate wheat or gluten in her diet. Yet the county has refused doctor paperwork and continues to feed my sister food full of gluten. She was on a wheat and gluten free diet for 5 years prior to being taken. Now not being on the proper diet is shattering her insides. She needs to be back on the diet ASAP!

I was told by the social workers that because I have a good relationship with my mother that is why they "punish" me from having contact with my sister and refuse to act on my requests to have her placed in my home. I have researched my rights and I know what they are doing is illegal but without a lawyer who knows the proper steps to take to express my rights and my sister's rights we will cnntinue to suffer at the hands of a very cruel state. 

 As you can see in the additional video I have 2 sisters who are both in foster care.

What We Need:

I need funds in order to hire a attorney who is established in juvenile law and is familiar with CPS and childen in foster care. I have reached out to many attorneys and no one is willing to help without being able to be paid.

Any money raised will go toward legal help to bring my sister back home to me. I feel we are lost in the system and I will continue to fight for my sister.

 

The more I research and try to find help for my family, the more I find there are  so many children who are being abused in state care, if you can't contribute financially I beg everyone to share this video, please help me spread the light on a very corrupt system.

story:
The Vitruvian Brew Corp (VBC) is a specialty-beer microbrewery located in Yellow Springs ,OH.  This is a new business in its start-up phase, seeking investment capital.



Initial products will include a signature India Pale Ale, catering to the pallet of a craft-beer enthusiast, and a crowd-pleasing Pale Ale, intended to appeal to the consumers of the American beer giants.VBC intends to handcraft a rotating lineup of premium, unique microbrews.
Vitruvian Brew Corporation plans to start production at approximately 520 barrels per year and gradually phase expansion to the constraints of the location, approximately 12,000 barrels per year.

We love brewing  and our product speaks for itself. The work is a testament to the interconnectedness of art and science. Our brewing philosophy and name stems from Leonardo daVinci's famous study the Vitruvian Man. The Vitruvian man is also referred to as the Cannon of Proportions because of its intention to apply architectural measurements to construct the perfect proportions of the human body. What da Vinci tries to establish in his studies on proportions of human beings, we mirror in our study of beer, a perfectly proportioned and precisely constructed brew.

We work and live in the small town of Yellow Springs, Ohio. Yellow Springs is already a well-known travel destination. Our location is directly on the bike path named the Little Miami Scenic Trail. This is one of two entrances people will be able to access our growler filling station and retail store.
This isn't just about selling beer for us. We're working to create a business model that is sustainable and builds our community. We are using our spent grain to feed local livestock, reclaiming our bottles, and recycling water that is not being used directly in the brewing process.

We are taking our love for our community and brewing to the next level. We welcome all inquiries and encourage people to visit with us. If you are interested in reading our business plan feel free to be in touch. Please help us to develop and fulfill our dream.
story_txt: The Vitruvian Brew Corp (VBC) is a specialty-beer microbrewery located in Yellow Springs ,OH.  This is a new business in its start-up phase, seeking investment capital.  Initial products will include a signature India Pale Ale, catering to the pallet of a craft-beer enthusiast, and a crowd-pleasing Pale Ale, intended to appeal to the consumers of the American beer giants.VBC intends to handcraft a rotating lineup of premium, unique microbrews. Vitruvian Brew Corporation plans to start production at approximately 520 barrels per year and gradually phase expansion to the constraints of the location, approximately 12,000 barrels per year.We love brewing  and our product speaks for itself. The work is a testament to the interconnectedness of art and science. Our brewing philosophy and name stems from Leonardo daVinci's famous study the Vitruvian Man. The Vitruvian man is also referred to as the Cannon of Proportions because of its intention to apply architectural measurements to construct the perfect proportions of the human body. What da Vinci tries to establish in his studies on proportions of human beings, we mirror in our study of beer, a perfectly proportioned and precisely constructed brew.We work and live in the small town of Yellow Springs, Ohio. Yellow Springs is already a well-known travel destination. Our location is directly on the bike path named the Little Miami Scenic Trail. This is one of two entrances people will be able to access our growler filling station and retail store.This isn't just about selling beer for us. We're working to create a business model that is sustainable and builds our community. We are using our spent grain to feed local livestock, reclaiming our bottles, and recycling water that is not being used directly in the brewing process.We are taking our love for our community and brewing to the next level. We welcome all inquiries and encourage people to visit with us. If you are interested in reading our business plan feel free to be in touch. Please help us to develop and fulfill our dream.

story:
We are Robert, Diane and Ana and we love our neighbourhood! 

When Robert Sutherland came up with the idea of bringing this old Studebaker truck from the farm to the city and giving it a new life serving the needs of the community, everyone got pretty excited.

We believe in preserving things of value, both old and new, finding ways to give back and building resilient communities where people help each other out. And that's exactly what this truck will help us do. 

Everyone has ideas about how the truck can be used to help out around here- from urban agriculture to street party fundraisers, and we know "Clem" will become a beloved member of the Mount Pleasant family. Officially an M16-52 this truck has an amazing personality and a strong family history of service going way back from the early days of the first Studebaker covered wagons in the 1850's to the Second World War and beyond. (history buffs see more in the link below . . .)

But let's let Clem tell the story of how he came from the farm to the city from his point of view . . .

*   *   *   *   *   *  *   *  *   *

Howdy folks! My name is Clement but most everybody calls me "Clem". I am named after Clement Studebaker who was the founder of the Company with older brother Henry in 1852.

I was born in 1946. Some people would say that’s too old to be starting a new life, but I disagree. I’m pretty stoked (as the kids say) about my move to the big city!

But let me tell you a bit more about myself first. . . .As I said, I was born 66 years ago, just after World War II. A lot of my brothers and sisters served in that war, and the previous one.

But the history of my family goes way back to 1852 and the covered wagon that brought the Studebaker family to South Bend, Indiana where they set up their blacksmith shop.

My relatives did some pretty famous things way back- won an award at the World’s Fair in Paris, drove presidents and other famous people, even had electric cars in the family for a bit before anyone else – and one of my distant relatives was the famous Pierce Arrow. 

 

As for me, I’ve served most of my life so far on the farm - I hauled coal and grain. Nothing fancy . . . . ended up on the farm in Penhold, Alberta, with Jim, who took real good care of me for the past 8 years - I guess you could say I was retired there for a bit- had a nice shed that kept me warm and dry. But not much to do . . . it was a bit boring, to tell you the truth.

And then to my surprise, Jim started to look for a new home for me. His ad was answered by Robert Sutherland, community organizer for Livable Laneways, all-round good guy, and jack of all trades who lives here, in Mount Pleasant-- a guy who loves old stuff as much as Jim does so they hit it off right away, and a few weeks back, Rob journeyed by train and bus over the mountains and came out to the farm to meet me.

Liked him right off. He’s a quiet guy, like Jim. No nonsense. Down to earth.

 

Well, long story short, they loaded me onto a big old transport truck and off I went to my new home here in Mount Pleasant. Never would have imagined that in a million years!


 

Anyway - what my new friends want to do is get me back into doing what I do best- helping folks get stuff done. Only here in the city it’ll be a bit different.

  • Jude and Charmaine at The Beaumont Studios say I’ll come in handy as a stage for community events- like Car Free Day!

  • I can haul wood for building things around the neighbourhood- that’s what Rob does and boy does he need my help! 

 

  • I can help out with moving loads of soil for community gardens . . .this is Kristy with Rob at the garden.

 

  • Mike over at eight 1/2 bistro & lounge, along with the Mount Pleasant Business Improvement Association, has a plan for collecting compost from local restaurants and I can help out there too. Tell you one thing- I won’t be bored.

 

So here’s what I’m thinking - I’m a bit short on the things the team here needs to get me up and running safely - get me back into top shape for my new tasks. What I need is a makeover!

Here's what I look like now . . . a little bit the worse for wear . . .

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

. . . and here's what I'll look like after my makeover! Awesome!

 

So folks we sure could use your help!

We're asking all our friends for a few gifts this Christmas that will help get me fixed up so I can give my best to my new family here in Mount Pleasant. Every little bit helps!

We're proud to say we have local trades, craftspeople and artists to handle the restoration work and advise the team so that all the work is done right. The basic list goes something like this:

  • I sure could use a new set of tires --$2,000

  • Seat belts were never a worry where I lived before, but I'll need those here for sure!--$500
  • Inspection and licensing is important-can't go anywhere without that!  -- $500
  • My mirrors are missing as are wipers, and the electrics could use a re-doing. Seats not good for much any more either.  -- $2,000
  • All my rubber seals on doors and windows as well as the interior liners need replacing too! Don't want the rain getting in. --$1,000

  • My paint has worn thin and is starting to show bare metal – not good in rainy Vancouver.  A good thorough job from top to bottom so that my next 66 years are as great as the last will cost  --$3,000

  • And I'll need a home-- a safe place to live until we're up and running and I can afford to pay the rent myself --$1000

     

The Big Picture- Why is this important now?

You might be wondering exactly what the bigger picture is here. How will your contribution help make a difference beyond fixing up an old farm truck? Well I'll tell you. I'm proud to say that when I'm ready to go, I will become a kind of symbol around here. People will say "there goes Clem". Folks will have their picture taken with me. I'll be like a member of the Mount Pleasant family. And that means I'll play a role in making folks feel more connected.

What's often missing in the big city is a feeling that you are part of a community. And that's a sad thing- something that we can help to change. I'll be all about helping folks help each other. Bringing people together to make this place better. And I hope I'll be a good example of what you can do in YOUR community- maybe through an indiegogo campaign like this one-- to bring back that feeling of connection and interdependence. You gotta start somewhere!

 

Your support means a lot to me and to my new neighbourhood! So we've come up with some cool gifts for YOU in return-- to say thanks!

(sorry we can't show you the finished designs just yet  . . . but trust me - they will be worth it!. We've launched a contest for local artists to come up with a winning portrait of Clem that will end up on all the perks).

Your $10.00 contribution-"Clem loves crowdfunding" button-Wear this button proudly on your backpack or jacket lapel and show you support local community!

$25.00-"Clem" Mug-Enjoy your Cuppa Joe with me smiling at you! You'll be the envy of all your friends!

$50.00-"Clem" trucker's hat-Shade your eyes and look cool around the 'hood. Get 'em while they last- a collector's item!

$75.00-" Clem" T-shirt-Limited edition Clem T-shirt- ladies' or gents'.

$100.00- Photo Op with Clem-When I'm up and running, I'll visit your favorite spot in the neighbourhood and we'll have our photo taken. Digital download available for printing and  sharing with your friends. AND we'll post it on our facebook page, if you choose, as a public thank you for your support!

$100.00- Clem Button & Hat as above

$100.00-Clem T-shirt & Mug as above

$250.00-You Immortalized! your NAME engraved on the old wooden box as a Donor and neighbourhood supporter for all to see.

$500.00 - Local Business Sponsor-Your business name/logo prominently displayed on the truck box. Local businesses only.

$1000.00- 4 hours of my time to do a local job for you and your name or logo on the truck, AND your choice of 2 "Clem" t-shirts or 2 "Clem"hats. Local only.

Here's a little something to get you "In the Mood"-- don't forget to come back!

The team behind this campaign:  

Robert Sutherland is a tireless community organizer and proponent of the Mount Pleasant neighborhood as a hub of creativity and local economy. He volunteers hundreds of hours to local place-making and community-building. Rob is the key organizer of Livable Laneways, a non-profit organization dedicated to transforming the overlooked laneways and alleys of Vancouver into pedestrian-friendly civic spaces. He is also a founding member of the Mount Pleasant Artists’ Society. He is passionate about keeping the character of this unique neighbourhood alive and thriving.

Ana Mateescu is an award winning documentary filmmaker and television producer originally from Romania. She has won acclaim for her films about the war in Iraq and transsexuals in Amsterdam, among others. Ana gave up her established career and came to Canada with her family three years ago, speaking no English, so her daughter would have better educational opportunities. Like many immigrants, she started out working at a low-paying menial job to help support her family and in that short time, she has learned English, volunteered in the Downtown Eastside, studied documentary film at Langara, served on the Student Union and as a member of the Board of Directors at VCC, and started to tell stories through film, her first love.

Diane Lefroy is a painter and an active member of the local art community, having served as coordinator of the Drift Art Walk & Studio Tour for several years. She has lived in Mount Pleasant for 14 years. In addition to helping produce this project, she is co-producer of an interactive documentary project with Ana called Erin's Neighbourhood, which will tell more stories about what makes Mount Pleasant the coolest 'hood in Vancouver. Check out our facebook page for more on the neighbourhood.

 

Click on the gallery tab for more background video and images . . .

AND Here's where you history buffs can go to find out more about the Studebaker family history  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford a gift of money- that doesn't mean we don't need you. You can tell folks about me and share our campaign with your friends and family. A good way to do that is to "like" and "share" this story on facebook.

Or you can send a link to the campaign page in an email to everyone you know who might be interested in my story.

Thanks! And watch for updates . . .

story:
Dawn and Jacob Bender live in the Rockaways (in Queens, NY), which is one of the neighbourhoods that Hurricane Sandy ravaged in late October. The house they live in was flooded. Many people in their neighbourhood have lost everything. Dawn, Jacob, and their two girls (Emilly (3) and Brooklyn (7 mos)) are staying in Sunset Park (in Brooklyn, NY) while they rebuild their home, help their neighbours, and continue working as Creative Pastors at the New York Dream Centre. 

Money will go toward gas (to get to and from The Rockaways), supplies for cleaning and rebuilding, and increased living expenses from displacement.

Here are some photos from The Rockaways:

http://gothamist.com/2012/11/05/photos_rockaway_beach_parking_lot_l.php#photo-18

Here is what the New York Dream Center is doing this week to help: 

http://nydc.tv/2012/11/rockaway-relief-for-the-week/

...

You may wonder how I will get the money to Dawn. It will be deposited in my account by IndieGoGo and I will either give her a check or cash. I will be SURE to let her know that it's from everyone in the Facebook Babies!! Group. :)

story:
Short Summary

Working with body awareness and gentle inquiry, we can discover together what is true in each moment, letting go of old ideas and painful stories that no longer serve us, and are frankly no longer true.

Toward this end, I have started Body of Wisdom, offering workshops, classes, and counseling sessions to people who are ready to step fully into their lives. Our bodies are a source of endless wisdom and wonder, and hold the key to our unfolding.

Our campaign is to raise funds to cover some important startup costs: software, webhosting, marketing, and deposits for site rentals for the workshops and classes I'm going to teach. In particular, having the right kinds of meditation cushions available will help people be relaxed in their bodies so that they can get the most out of our body-awareness practices.

Your contributions will help us support people in waking up to their full potential, learning from their bodies how to heal and how to love. It has been our experience that people who are alive and awake in this way become more available to give back to their families and communities. They are less prone to addiction and distraction. They discover the true nature of freedom.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $4000 to cover some of our more expensive startup costs:

  • $2500 for meditation cushions, including zafus, zabutons (floor cushions), gomdens, and small pillows for fine adjustment.

  • $600 for software and web-hosting, including database and Adobe design software.

  • $700 for site rental deposits for workshops and classes.

  • $200 for marketing expenses, including ads, fliers, and free introductions.

Our perks:

  • We have decided to offer things that we ourselves have found useful for meditation: stainless steel water bottles, cozy fleece blankets, and our favorite local meditation cushions:

  • The zafus made by Dream Pillows of Milwaukee, Oregon, are covered with durable hemp fabric and stuffed with millet. We love them because they are both firm and supportive while conforming fully to the body's contours. They can be easily adjusted to support you in your favorite sitting position. Should you choose this perk, we will write to you to offer you a choice of colors.

  • We also offer discounts and complementary workshop attendance, culminating in a private 12-person Body of Wisdom intensive for one lucky contributor.

If we raise more than our goal:

  • It is important to us to keep our offerings affordable. Any funds raised in excess of our stated expenses will go toward making our workshops and classes available to people with low incomes.

The Impact

I am truly excited about this work and am so blessed to have the support of my family and friends in pursuing my heart's calling. Here's why I think it's important:

  • Our culture is in crisis. It is clear that rampant materialism and endless opportunities for distraction are taking a toll on our families, our communities, and our home, the Earth.

  • This work is a vital piece of the solution. When people can tune into the abundance of the present moment, they are more able to be there for others. And they don't need as much stuff. They rediscover their connection with the sacred world, and become caretakers of the planet rather than consumers.

  • I have taught and organized personal growth and spiritual retreats since 1998. With the support of an extended community of people who have benefited from this work, I am confident that these workshops and classes will be successful, and more importantly, that they will change people's lives in a real way. This work already has....

    "It's a process I've never considered or been aware of, so I feel blessed to have been able to participate. Know that you've made a difference in my life at a time when I was feeling a deep sadness, even though I was reaching goals and doing well. Thank you so much and please continue your work."
    –Evan S.

    "This weekend has been both amazing and transforming. Becca helped create a heart-centered community of friends, and with the support staff she nurtured, questioned and gently offered a choice of new paths. I reached into a deep kernel of trauma that I had worked around for years, pushed past the numbness and felt my way through it. I feel renewed, connected and ready to move deeper into my life."
    –Warren B.

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that many of you don't have the financial means to contribute as much as you would like to this campaign. There are so many other ways you can help us:

  • Please share our campaign with others through Facebook and other social media. You can use the Indiegogo share tools. 'Like' our page on Facebook.

  • Tell your friends and family about our workshops and classes. Attend a free introduction and bring someone. Come to our weekly free meditation group (starting in late October).

  • Comment on the "comments" page to increase our visibility on Indiegogo.

  • If you have any specific skills that might be helpful to Body of Wisdom's launch, please do write to us.

  • If you have any ideas or feedback for us, we'd love to hear it.

  • Open your heart and share your gifts with the world, whatever they may be. In the end, that's the best any of us will ever do.

Our perks:


We have decided to offer things that we ourselves have found useful for meditation: stainless steel water bottles, cozy fleece blankets, and our favorite local meditation cushions:


The zafus made by Dream Pillows of Milwaukee, Oregon, are covered with durable hemp fabric and stuffed with millet. We love them because they are both firm and supportive while conforming fully to the body's contours. They can be easily adjusted to support you in your favorite sitting position. Should you choose this perk, we will write to you to offer you a choice of colors.


We also offer discounts and complementary workshop attendance, culminating in a private 12-person Body of Wisdom intensive for one lucky contributor.

If we raise more than our goal:


It is important to us to keep our offerings affordable. Any funds raised in excess of our stated expenses will go toward making our workshops and classes available to people with low incomes.

The Impact
I am truly excited about this work and am so blessed to have the support of my family and friends in pursuing my heart's calling. Here's why I think it's important:


Our culture is in crisis. It is clear that rampant materialism and endless opportunities for distraction are taking a toll on our families, our communities, and our home, the Earth.


This work is a vital piece of the solution. When people can tune into the abundance of the present moment, they are more able to be there for others. And they don't need as much stuff. They rediscover their connection with the sacred world, and become caretakers of the planet rather than consumers.


I have taught and organized personal growth and spiritual retreats since 1998. With the support of an extended community of people who have benefited from this work, I am confident that these workshops and classes will be successful, and more importantly, that they will change people's lives in a real way. This work already has....
"It's a process I've never considered or been aware of, so I feel blessed to have been able to participate. Know that you've made a difference in my life at a time when I was feeling a deep sadness, even though I was reaching goals and doing well. Thank you so much and please continue your work."–Evan S.
"This weekend has been both amazing and transforming. Becca helped create a heart-centered community of friends, and with the support staff she nurtured, questioned and gently offered a choice of new paths. I reached into a deep kernel of trauma that I had worked around for years, pushed past the numbness and felt my way through it. I feel renewed, connected and ready to move deeper into my life."–Warren B.

Other Ways You Can Help
We recognize that many of you don't have the financial means to contribute as much as you would like to this campaign. There are so many other ways you can help us:


Please share our campaign with others through Facebook and other social media. You can use the Indiegogo share tools. 'Like' our page on Facebook.


Tell your friends and family about our workshops and classes. Attend a free introduction and bring someone. Come to our weekly free meditation group (starting in late October).

Comment on the "comments" page to increase our visibility on Indiegogo.

If you have any specific skills that might be helpful to Body of Wisdom's launch, please do write to us.


If you have any ideas or feedback for us, we'd love to hear it.


Open your heart and share your gifts with the world, whatever they may be. In the end, that's the best any of us will ever do.

story:
Who We Are

Hi. My name is Mick Brown. Anyone who knows me will tell you that I am the kind of guy who can't keep a secret when it comes to great food. When I taste something amazing, I like to share it with everyone: Friends, Family, Strangers, etc...- whether it is a Food Product, Recipe, Restaurant or new BBQ Technique. That is why I do Food Blogs "The Adventures of TasteeBQ" and the new "BBQ Catering Confidential".

I am currently a BBQ Chef/ Caterer in the Los Angeles area, where I also teach Private Grilling Classes to Individuals and Groups. My crew at Tastee BQ Grilling Co. has catered everything from 2 year old Birthdays in the Park, to Cookouts for the Boys and Girls Club, to a pre-Red Carpet Party with Oscar Nominated Film Director and past Presidents of AAMPAS. With our latest party, we can add Swedish TV Personalty to the list. Out of respect for clients' privacy, I don't drop names or beg people for public endorsements. The few clients who do Social Media rated us 5***** Stars as BBQ Caterers on Yelp.

When we started California Gold BBQ Rubs almost a year ago, I wanted to offer people a delicious, yet healthier alternative to the Salt, Sugar and Chemical laden BBQ Rubs and Grill Seasonings that currently dominate the market. I also wanted to share awesome flavors from nutritious Superfoods I tasted while traveling the world. Even with a solid Start-Up Plan, I had no idea it would be so expensive to get it an All Natural BBQ Rub out to the public. Even our Expenses come with their own Expenses... 

Why HEROIC! ???

The time has come for a Delicious, Easy-to-Use Seasoning that picks up where Lawry's Seasoning Salt and Emeril's Essence left off. HERIOC! is:

* All Natural, No Chemicals or Preservatives

* Uses beneficial Superfoods. Some have historically been employed as Medicines in some cultures.

* Adds flavor to All Foods. Also, the world's first All Natural Superfood Instant BBQ Topping/ Grill Seasoning, Dry Marinade and Homemade BBQ Sauce Mix. (Patent Pending.)

* HEROIC! uses natural sweetness for balanced flavor. No Salt or Sugar has been added. Feel free to add your choice of Sodium or Sweetener to any Recipe.

So I invite you to participate in any way you can. Together we can Make the World a Better Place to Eat. Let's show everyone how BBQ can be Tastier, Healthier and Fun!

What We Need & What You Get

Our company can't continue to grow on my personal savings alone. We need people who care about what they eat, and want to help make Healthier BBQ available to others. The current goal of $1000 will help us attend our first ever Food Expo, with Fees supporting the Celiac Disease Foundation. It will be a chance to meet and sample HEROIC! with some of the top contacts in the Gluten Free Food Industry. If all goes well, we won't be back on Indiegogo asking for Funds.

You can Participate by:

1. Contribute.  Anything you can contribute is greatly appreciated, from $1 to $10,000. We need $1000 to "Indiegogo" to the Gluten Free Expo, but anything above it will go towards other much needed Expenses. [WISH LIST added below]

2. Get HEROIC!  All Contributors above $15 will experience HEROIC! for themselves. The Gluten Free, All-Natural Superfood Blend is a fresh mix of premium Smoked Paprika, Garlic, Red Bell Pepper, Cumin, Onion, Thyme, Cinnamon, Fennel,  Nutmeg, Alllspice and Turmeric. No added Salt, Sugar or Preservatives.

3. Share HEROIC! with Family and Friends. Get extra HEROIC! for those whose Taste Buds you care about. You can choose excellent Gifts of Swag for Contributions above $100, including T-Shirts by American Apparel.

4. Let Us Cook for You.  Contribute $300 or more for Private or Group Grilling Lessons in the Los Angeles area. For $1000 we will Cater a Party for 20-30 people. If you have a Budget of $5000 to $10,000 we will travel the Country or around the World to do a BBQ Seminar or Cater a special BBQ Party fit for a King (or Queen).

Your Impact

You may take credit for being a Pioneer who helped launch the HEROIC! Movement towards Healthier BBQ Grilling with Superfoods. Each Mailing will include a personalized Thank You Letter and Recipe Brochure you can pass along for generations, and be the envy of all your Colleagues and Friends.  

Beyond raising the first $1000, our WISH LIST includes:

  • $1000 Gets us to the Gluten Free Expo in Pasadena
  • $2000 covers staffing and allows us to purchase Banners, Decorations and Premium hand-out materials at the Booth. All Fees go to support the Celiac Disease Foundation.
  • $3000 hire professional staff to help add 100 Recipes to our Free Recipe Website.
  • $5000 Develop Organic versions of POWER! and HEROIC! Blends
  • $10,000 Our products are currently Patent-Pending. Will allow us to complete full U.S. and International Patents.
  • $15,000 Allows us to pay the $5000 Fee to the private Non-GMO organization to confirm on our bottles that All Natural Spices and Herbs are not genetically modified. Need to do this to be considered by Whole Foods.


Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to money, we need your help spreading the word about California Gold BBQ Rubs. They are not just for Grilling, our Gourmet Spice Blends make everything taste better. 

  • Please share this campaign with everyone you know who cares about Healthier and more Delicious Food products for themselves and their families. A great alternative to Junk Food for Kids. You can use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • If you are active online, share your Positive Comments, Recipes or Food Pics on our Website(s), Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Google+, Yelp and wherever Great Food is the topic.
  • Also share Comments on Amazon.com. You can shop there for California Gold BBQ Rubs now, or after this Campaign has ended. Encourage your Friends to Comment there as well.
  • Say something nice to a Stranger. The world can always use more Smiles.
  • Eat and Be Well.

Note- Tastee BQ Grilling Co. is in the process to moving to new upgraded website. Visit our archives at TasteeBQ.com.

California Gold BBQ Rubs Website: www.CalforniaGoldRub.com

GALLERY OF SWAG (Women's and Kid's Sizes also Available)

International Shipping- Please add $25.00 to Contribution for under 1 lb., $50 for over 1 lb.

story:
Short Summary

I am a crafty woman who has recently moved to a rural area with the dream of starting my own homestead. I want to provide high quality handcrafted items with a focus on quality leather work. I was able to get my business license for White Wing Craft & Hobby, and make a few sales with materials I already had. Unfortunately rather then being able to roll the sales money back into the business I have had to put the money into a vehicle in order to have it ready to pass inspection. I would like to be able to get all of the materials necessary to be stable, and grow. Any contribution, even the smallest amount, would mean a tremendous amount to me, and put me on the right direction to independence. I have no problem working, and the value of perks for donations is fair compensation for the help provided. 

Thank you for helping me start a local small business.


What We Need & What You Get

I would like to reach the goal of $700. This would allow me to get 2 full sides of leather, a variety of dyes, colored sinews, and punches, and professional leather cutting tools from quality sources such as Tandy.

In return for donations you will receive your choice of handcrafted items: bookmarks, bracelets, lanyards, collars, pouches, purses, and more. If there is something similar that isn't listed that you would be interested in instead, just ask, I don't mind doing custom work.

Even if we can't reach the full $700, I can still get plenty of materials to get started, and just continue using the "make-shift"/adapted tools I have used previously.


The Impact

I feel that my campaign is valuable because supporting small local businesses helps keep money "in the communities". Quality handcrafted items, each item unique and customizable helps bring beauty and individuality to the world. Please help me bring beauty to the world.

Thank you!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can help by spreading the word. IndieGoGo has tools to make sharing easy.

Thank you!

story:
Have you ever wondered what exactly the facial cremes and lotions you use everyday consist of? Have you ever wondered whether what you put on your skin you could also eat?

After years of training and experimenting, considering and trying we are certain that we found the perfect composition of our formulas with 100 % natural ingredients which gives your skin the perfect glow. It not only hydrates, it refreshes, revives and  firms your skin all in one. Moreover it s so natural you could eat it.

With 100% natural ingredients we created a gorgeous organic, 100% vegan skincare which will make your skin bright and youthful. 

Our goal is to develop a transparent and honest new brand, by creating unique and distinct values of natural cosmetic products!

This is why we need you! 

We need 10000 Euro seed funding to get samples to show investors the product. 

All together we need 60000 Euro to launch, legal fees and product development, marketing and packaging. 

Also, any support, donations, advice and labors of love.  

You can help by donating, spreading the word and reposting this to as many people as possible. 

All of your good thoughts, encouragement and support are appreciated! 

Help us live our dream!

story:
4 years ago when I started Mux Homes, I was so worried for running such an organisation without any non-profit experience. But 'I' became 'WE' as time passes, and also gained a lot of new experiences.

In Mux Homes we care and educate orphaned and abandoned children. There are many reasons on how they became orphans. Some became because they were illegitimately conceived and others because their parents are unable to feed them because of poverty and gave us to be looked after.


As we all know Christmas and New Year are coming within few days. So we Mux Homes decided to give our children a belated New Year's Party with Santa Claus in 2nd week of January. Yes I know It will be a bit late, but we are limited in funds and cannot afford this Party on time. That's why we started this campaign to raise funds for our children.
Okay, lets talk about our Party Plans..... :)
We have decided to give our children New Winter Clothes (including jackets, socks and dresses), A Party with Full Fun (including better lunch than normal days, different playing activities, and full on music), and in last we will give them Gifts for Christmas (including stuffed toys and reading books).
We have calculated all prices (see below for details) and it will cost $20 per child.
  • Jacket = $8.75
  • Socks = $1/pair
  • Jeans & T-Shirts = $10.93 & $5.99 = $16.92
  • Stuffed Toys (for small kids) & Books (for big kids) ranges from $0.51 to $1.99 each.
  • Better Food (like fruits, pizza, ,chocolates, burgers etc.) will cost $4.00 per child
Total will be approximately $31.67 per child. But our children's age ranges from 4 to 14 years, and you know small kids clothes are bit cheaper than big kids. So we calculated it on average and it will be approximately $20.00 to $21.00 per child.




If you are inspired by our campaign then please support in donations, it will able us to make this party happens. Every single dollar will worth to these children. And if you can't participate for any reason, then please share this campaign in your circles, blogs or fan pages, in short in your social networks. It will makes a big difference. And thanks in advance for your time on this orphan's campaign.
If you want to know more, then please send us an email at
support@muxhomes.org
You can check more details about our programs on our website.
You can also make donations on website for our different programs.
https://www.muxhomes.org

THANK YOU! FOR YOUR TIME


:-)

story:
Founded From the Heart

Heart Capital was founded with one clear mission in mind: empower the lives of people living in South Africa's townships through the time tested power of impact investment and the rising potential of social entrepreneurship. 

What We Do

Heart Capital managers a portfolio of social impact-driven ventures in the surrounding Cape Town area. Our projects include:

  • Dam Good Fish
  • Flour Power
  • Foodpods
  • Hubspace
  • Wines With Heart
  • Wonder Plant
These ventures operate on social innovation hubs in Kayamandi, Khayelitsha, Philippi, and Woodstock. We employ aspiring entrepreneurs to grow and manage our inventories (mainly agricultural) while Heart handles the marketing, sales, operations, and distribution of these products. In time, our entrepreneurs earn a steady living and learn how to be entrepreneurial themselves. 

    What We're Funding

    Working in the social space is tough, and we can't do it alone. At the moment, our deliveries and transportation rely on our wonderful interns and willing volunteers. We cram our employees into small cars, pile spekboom trees in the backseats of vans, and are forced to coordinate event ride shares that often limit our capabilities. It's working, but it could be better.

    We're crowd funding to raise enough money to purchase a Heart Capital delivery vehicle. Owning our own delivery vehicle would drastically improve our operations on the ground. By having a Heart Capital-owned vehicle, we could:

    • Hire local delivery men and women, thus increasing our job creation reach in the surrounding townships
    • Bring more of our interns to events and operation sites, giving them the chance to fully experience Heart Capital's operations
    • Fine tune our supply chain management, allowing room for more aggressive sales and the potential for large, bulk orders
    And there you have it. By helping us fund this one little project, you could be funding an even greater-reaching social impact. Feels pretty awesome, right?

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Funding our cause is only one way to get involved with Heart Capital's mission. Want to help us further our mission and change lives? Intern with us, buy our products, sponsor a project, or go ahead and invest. Check out our website for more information. 

      Final Thoughts

      At Heart, we end our daily morning meetings with an inspirational quote to get the day off to a good start. And we believe that there's no better way to kick off a socially conscious Indiegogo campaign than with some good feels and a little motivation. So remember:
      "There is no passion to be found playing small – in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living." 
      Nelson Mandela

      All it takes is a little bit of heart.

story:
We are The Lonely Road Foundation

We are a charity working in rural communities in South Africa, providing support to Orphaned and Vulnerable Children, and we need your help!

As part of what we do, we set up Drop-in Centres throughout empoverished communities. These are safe havens where the children who need some help can go for a cooked meal, play, do homework and receive support from trained caregivers, among other services.

These children are often forced to grow up long before their time. We want to give our kids a chance to be kids and let someone else do the worrying for once!

In February 2013, we began operating in a new community called Lokaleng Village. It is a very improverished area and before we even opened our doors, we had over 500 children registered to receive support.
 
We need your help with ensuring that each of our Orphaned and Vulnerable Children receive a blanket for this Winter.

What We Need

We have just over 100 blankets so far. We need to collect 400 more!
 
We are able to purchase blankets for R100 ($10). Until the end of June, Rotary SA will help us and for every R100 raised, we will receive TWO blankets!
 
We are looking to raise R40,000 ($4,000) to fund a minimum of 400 blankets.
 
If we don't collect our full goal, we will keep trying. We will collect and distribute blankets as we receive them, according to the highest need in the community.
 
If we meet our goal or exceed it, more kids get more support!

Other Ways You Can Help

VERY NB: We are also collecting new and used (but still usable) blankets and warm clothing. If you are in South Africa, we will collect from you! Please contact us at donations@thelonelyroad.org if you would like to discuss this option.

 If you would like to help us to do what we do, make some noise for us! Share with your friends and family, share on your social media platforms, tell your neighbours about us!
 
Keep on giving your love away!

story:
Having isues with the Vimeo video...i apologize.  It is getting looked at.  You can go to Vimeo and search my name Steve Archambault and see the video.  Sorry for the inconvenience....Peace!

 

Short Summary

My name is Steve Archambault and I am from Victoria BC Canada.  I am an inventor on a mission to make the world a better place. I came up with a great innovation to the existing aluminum beverage can.  A new tab that will replace the existing one.  What sets mine apart from others is that my tab will give the pop and beer can meaning.  I plan on donating majority of my royalties to a foundation I am in the process of establishing.  I am also in the process of developing an app which ties in with my foundation and tab making them all interactive.  Allowing the the user to do things in the virtual world and make them reality. 

 I see an opportunity to utilize mass global consuption and turn it into a positive to benefit the world. With the several trillion cans a year produced and the nearly 1 trillion cans that  2 of the largest beverage company produces at a penny a can that translates into 10s of billions of dollars that will go directly to tackle the most pressing isues the planets facing.  We have to stop sugar coating the issues with bandaids....we need to fix these problems before we reach the point of no return. 

  I have sacrificed over 2 and a half years of my life and a lot of sleepless nights researching and networking.  Ive sank my life savings into getting it to where I am at and have a U.S patent pending.

What the funds i raise will go towards is taking it to the next level.  Filing my global patent, copyrighting/trademarking, app and foundation as they all are part of the same thing.   

  The amount of funding required to take this to the next level is $650, 000.00 and the money is for  the global patent, copyrighting/trademarking, the app and foundation.

Im going to be as transparent as i can get.  So far I have invested $120,000.00 of my own money on my tab and $20, 000.00 on the app and foundation. For the global patent, copyrighting and trademarking I require $385, 000.00 of funding, $255,000.00 for the app and foundation. The money left over is for miscelaneous costs that may pop up .  Any extra money will go directly to charity.

Im extremely lucky to have the support from some very amazing musicians and athletes who will be part of the foundation supporting everything we are all about.  David Kennedy from Angels and Airwaves, Shaun Verrault from Wide Mouth Mason, John Mann from Spirit of the West, Pro Mounain Bikers Steve Romaniuk and Holly Feniak, pro surfers Magnum Martinez and Nathan Hedge and these athletes will be part of team UNITING. 

 

The Impact

I am worried for future generations and the reason is we are destroying the planet.  The amount of money that  will go to making the world a better place is off the charts.  To take things to the next level requires a lot of funding but the outcome from the funding will literally change the world.  We will be able to help reforest the amazon....the lungs of the planet.  We will be able to address the humanitarian issues that we see in africa and other 3rd world countries, we will be able to push for more solar, wind and geo thermal projects.  We will be able to address the 5 floating masses of garbage that are floating around our oceans killing tens of thousands of marine life every year.  We will be able to address the sensless slaughter of endangered speicies.  We will be stimulating the economy creating thousands of jobs. 

The thing about us humans is that we all want to see a change but we dont actually WANT to change.  What ive created will allow people to be part of the change without having to change.  Wouldnt it be great to say that we all contributed to a global change and create a better future for generations to come?  We only have one planet and she is dying.  We can either go down in history as the generation that watched the planet deteriorate and do nothing or we can UNITE and work together making the world a better place and go down in history as the generation that stepped up and saved the planet.

Other Ways You Can Help

Its all aabout sharing and getting the word out there.  I have an open FB page Steve Archambault and you can also follow me on Twitter @Arch_Steve and encourage others to do the same.  I am all about creating transparency which is why i encourage others to follow me and get up to date info on everything i am doing.  I want to thank all of you who will contribute and to those that will encourage others to follow and or contribute. Be the change you want to see in the world....Peace!
