Be the change you want to see in the world....Peace!

story:
Ahoy there! 

We are SO excited to be here, to finally launch solidariTEA and share it with all of you! After almost two years of brewing lots and lots of tea, sourcing everything to the best quality, developing our structure, and building up and consulting with a wonderful community of mentors, etc., we’re very grateful and happy to be HERE.

Learn more about us----and our perks below and GET EXCITED!

 

How solidariTEA works:

Step #1:  Our teas support a resilient Bay Area.

Each flavor of our teas illustrates one characteristic of a resilient community; together, these different characteristics highlight who in our community is working to make it more just, sustainable, and joyful.

Step #2:  Local organizations partner with our teas to fundraise for a set goal.

Each flavor is paired with a local justice or art group who best represents that facet of community resiliency through their work. Once we’re profitable, $0.10 of profits from the sale of our teas then goes to these groups, or allies, to help fulfill a specific funding request that may otherwise be difficult to obtain through traditional/corporate grant writing. 

*Learn about our launching allies and their resilience work: People’s Grocery and the Rock Paper Scissors Collective

Step #3: Once their fundraising goals are met, partners choose the next wave of projects to fund!

After this funding request has been fulfilled through the sale of our teas, groups then choose a new ally to take their place and keep this cycle humming along.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Why our teas = awesome:

  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Aside from our innovative model, solidariTEA’s teas stand out because:

  • Our teas are intensely flavored. We don’t skimp on, or water down, our ingredients. Our teas are boldly, marvelously rich and they have the opaque, full-bodied colors to back it up (deep pink, autumn, and purple), rather than the translucence that comes with a higher water ratio. As our motto says, “Strong tea for strong community!”
  • Our teas are 100% premium. We use only high quality, organic ingredients (botanicals, fruits, and spices like rose petals and blueberry juice), in all of our teas, and our tea is brewed from fair-trade tea leaves.
  • At 10-15 g of sugar per 14 oz serving, our teas provide a lower sugar content, per bottle, than most other lightly-sweetened offerings out there.

Our vision is for our teas to become the new standard in the ready-to-drink beverage market and that our business model grows to be seen as a powerful, authentic way to develop financial sustainability within local community resilience efforts.

 

Why solidariTEA:

solidariTEA was born out of the idea: how can we, in our current, limited, financial states, support the change-makers in our communities in a real way? How can we help free them to do the work that they know best how to do, to make our communities more resilient, sustainable, equitable, and just?

What if we could allow the groups we’ve organized with, groups we admire and respect, to shift some of their time and focus away from constant fundraising, from corporate grants, to the real soul of their work? How could we take the model of a business, of our current capitalist system, and make it work for our communities?

We are doing our best to accomplish just that.

  

Why the name:

We named our tea company “solidariTEA” because we wanted to build a business that was rooted in community organizing, in community resilience work, and we wanted to work with a great range of different local groups. We wanted to highlight who in our community is helping build a stronger, more just, sustainable, and joyful Bay Area, and we wanted to show how all of their work is linked together; we wanted to show how so many different struggles are connected, and how so many of the solutions are also connected. For us, that’s what solidarity work is----and therefore, that’s what solidariTEA is about.

 

How YOU can help:

After a year and a half----and much sweat and love----we are finally ready to bring solidariTEA to the market! We’re asking for $19,500 to help us fully launch and pay for a truckload of glass bottles ($16,000+----glass and freight is expensive!) and our beautiful labels ($4,000), so we may bring solidariTEA to a Bay Area natural foods store near you! 

Any additional funds we raise will really help us get off the ground. Extra contributions will be used for: locally warehousing our teas; filling up our gas tanks to make deliveries; and paying for production runs.

If you can’t afford to contribute to our campaign----or even IF you’ve been able to contribute, and are feeling extra generous----here are four additional ways to help us out:

  • Email a link to our campaign to another friend/other folks who love tea, live in the Bay Area, and/or are involved in social justice work.
  • Share the campaign on Facebook!
  • Share the campaign on Twitterrrrrrr.
  • Follow us on your social media site of choice, or sign up for our quarterly newsletter, and come say hi when we sell or sample at a store or community event near you :)

Many thanks for reading this far, and for supporting us!

In solidarity,

Caroline & Trey

Many thanks again for supporting us! We really can’t do this without YOU :)

Please visit our website, solidaritea.com, for other FAQ and details!

 

Our PERK lineup:

TEAshirts even CATS will love...  

NEW perk!! Our tote-ally awesome TEA-tote!

 

BAY AREA artwork on postcards...

and MAGNETS! 

  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

and of course cases of our TEA :)

Additional Perk Info: 

Why are fewer cases of tea offered for those off the west coast, when the donation amount is the same?

Excellent question! We regret that this is the case, but we crunched the numbers, consulted with various postal services, and learned that to ship a case of our teas across the country is roughly $30----not including the value of the packaging and teas themselves.

We tried to strike a careful balance between providing awesome perks for our supporters while still retaining a solid chunk of each person’s donation so that we can really get solidariTEA off the ground. Shipping costs quickly add up (and subtract from one’s donation)----this is why more perks (including personally delivered cases of tea) are offered to those in the immediate Bay Area.

If you’re in another state or just outta the Bay and have another perk request, please let us know! We’ll work to accommodate you with extra magnets, tea-shirts, etc.

What size tea-shirt am I?

Our teashirts are all men/unisex from American Apparel. Please check out their handy sizing chart for the best fit, and let us know what size works best for you: http://www.americanapparel.net/sizing/default.asp?chart=mu.shirts

story:
Hi my name is Jessie and I have a beautiful son named Conor. I work part-time as a Rural Mail Carrier Assistant, hoping to be full-time down the road when a position opens up which can sometimes take years. I love the job and look forward to when I can be financially stable doing it. Part of the job is to drive your own vehicle while delivering mail. My car has been barely making it and with the upcoming Northern Minnesota winter I am concerned that it will not make it through the season. This is also the vehicle I transport my son around in and would be very glad to have something safer and more reliable. The safety of my son as well as being able to get my job done mean the world to me. Thank you for your time and well wishes to all who are struggling out there.

*While writing this it occurred to me that there are probably many more people out there with the same struggle and if this goes well I will start a campaign for them as well and call it "Reliable Cars for Struggling Families" Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

Welcome, we are Grind Tech Industries, LLC. Grind Tech is a start-up company opened in 2013 and Launched its first Product the Grind Cone Grinder, a 5-piece tobacco and dry herb Grinder, in June 2014. Grind Tech Industries was founded by Tyler Nobles from Atlanta, Ga. Tyler Graduated From Georgia Southern University with his Bachelors degree in Business Management with an emphasis in Small business and Entrepreneurship. The Grind Cone was thought up by Tyler and his long time friend. The Grind Cone is one of the most functional and useful tobacco/herb grinder thats in the market today. This is a 5 piece Grinder. The top 2 pieces are just like any other grinder. The 3rd piece is a sealed cap so that no material falls out when storing the material. The 4th piece is designed for storage and to help accurately pour the material to the preferred device. The 5th and final piece, the tip is designed to help layer and pack the material as well as clear out any used material left in one's preferred device. It combines packing tools, storage tools, cleaning tools, and a way to dispense the product all in one grinder. The Grind Cone is currently made out of a Delrin/acetal material to produce the highest quality plastic grinder on the Market and allows it to stay under a $20 price point.

Grind Tech Industries is running this campaign to raise more capital to cover for new designs, run advertising/marketing campaigns and hire sales people. This campaign is important to us because it will help us reach the end users and let them know about our products through advertising and marketing with the funds from this campaign. With these funds we will also be able to come out with our design for a higher quality Grind Cone that will be made out of aircraft grade aluminum to compete it against the best Grinders on the market. The exposure alone from advertising in the popular and well circulated magazines will more than triple our business in the first quarter of next year.  We will also hire 1-2 new sale people to help cold call new stores across the nation.

What We Need & What You Get

We are requesting $65,000 to be funded. The money will be split up between New product design, Marketing/ advertising and Trade shows. We estimate that we will use $20,000 in New Product Design to finish the design changes and any manufacturing tooling costs as well as a small inventory order for our High end aircraft grade aluminum version of the Grind Cone. Also we will have display packaging design to help attract customers in the retail outlets. We estimate that we will use $15,000 to hit the trade shows hard during 2015. We plan on going to all Champs trade shows to get exposure on all coasts. We also plan to attend the Cannabis Cup in Denver On 4/20/2015 as well as Seattle's hempfest. There are also the Glass and Vape show's, The A.G.E show's and many more smaller one's. The last $10,000 will be spent on Advertising and Marketing. We will run 4 month 1/2 page spreads in HQ(Head Quest)magazine one of the largest for the counter culture industry with over 10,000 retail stores reached. We will also advertise in High Times Magazine probably the biggest consumer magazine in the market for 4 months as well as, ERB  and Cannabis Culture Magazines. The last $20,000 will be set aside to hire another 1-2 sales people. 

The Perks that I'm doing range from ownership in the company, a Current high end Plastic Grin Cone, Social media shout-outs, to hand written thank you notes. We are offering 5 chances to buy 2% of Grind Tech Industries for a $10,000 contribution each. We are offering 2000 chances to buy the Current Grind cone 25% cheaper than retail for a $15 contribution. We are offering 5000 Hand written Thank you notes for a $3 contribution. We are offering a social media Shout-out of your choice for a $1 contribution.

If we do not reach our goal of $65,000 we will use the funds between Advertising and New product development with hopes that  this will bring in enough business to pay for trade shows and additional advertising.

The Impact

The Grind Cone is a revolutionary Grinder with more Functions than any other Grinder and will play a big impact on the Market. With an all in one Grinder you save time and a mess. With its design the mess is eliminated by allowing the material to be dispensed straight into ones smoking device saving time in the process. This is a product that everyone in this lifestyle has thought about and asked why there was not one available, well now there is the Grind Cone Grinder is here. A simple thought brought to life and now ready to hit the world with the help of all of the Contributors.      

Risks & Challenges

We face an uphill battle entering into a market that has already been established by several companies. We can easily overcome these hurdles of competition by having a solid advertising and marketing campaign. With the contributions to Grind Tech we will redesign our ads and then advertise in the biggest and most circulated magazine's in our market. We will be able to get out to the many trade shows and physically meet store owners, and distributors to put our products into their hands. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

This is a growing market and more and more people every day are entering this market. If you can't contribute financially please help us spread the word about our product by word of mouth or by sharing on social media. Please check our intsagram page out @Grindtech and our Facebook page Grind Tech Industries. Or check out our website www.Grinderkings.com. Thanks you for your time and looking at our Campaign. Please share this Campaign through Indiegogo's Share button and Share with your friends and family. Again, thank you for looking over our Campaign.

Remember Get your Grind on with the Grind Cone Grinder!!!
story_txt:
Short SummaryWelcome, we are Grind Tech Industries, LLC. Grind Tech is a start-up company opened in 2013 and Launched its first Product the Grind Cone Grinder, a 5-piece tobacco and dry herb Grinder, in June 2014. Grind Tech Industries was founded by Tyler Nobles from Atlanta, Ga. Tyler Graduated From Georgia Southern University with his Bachelors degree in Business Management with an emphasis in Small business and Entrepreneurship. The Grind Cone was thought up by Tyler and his long time friend. The Grind Cone is one of the most functional and useful tobacco/herb grinder thats in the market today. This is a 5 piece Grinder. The top 2 pieces are just like any other grinder. The 3rd piece is a sealed cap so that no material falls out when storing the material. The 4th piece is designed for storage and to help accurately pour the material to the preferred device. The 5th and final piece, the tip is designed to help layer and pack the material as well as clear out any used material left in one's preferred device. It combines packing tools, storage tools, cleaning tools, and a way to dispense the product all in one grinder. The Grind Cone is currently made out of a Delrin/acetal material to produce the highest quality plastic grinder on the Market and allows it to stay under a $20 price point.Grind Tech Industries is running this campaign to raise more capital to cover for new designs, run advertising/marketing campaigns and hire sales people. This campaign is important to us because it will help us reach the end users and let them know about our products through advertising and marketing with the funds from this campaign. With these funds we will also be able to come out with our design for a higher quality Grind Cone that will be made out of aircraft grade aluminum to compete it against the best Grinders on the market. The exposure alone from advertising in the popular and well circulated magazines will more than triple our business in the first quarter of next year.  We will also hire 1-2 new sale people to help cold call new stores across the nation.What We Need & What You GetWe are requesting $65,000 to be funded. The money will be split up between New product design, Marketing/ advertising and Trade shows. We estimate that we will use $20,000 in New Product Design to finish the design changes and any manufacturing tooling costs as well as a small inventory order for our High end aircraft grade aluminum version of the Grind Cone. Also we will have display packaging design to help attract customers in the retail outlets. We estimate that we will use $15,000 to hit the trade shows hard during 2015. We plan on going to all Champs trade shows to get exposure on all coasts. We also plan to attend the Cannabis Cup in Denver On 4/20/2015 as well as Seattle's hempfest. There are also the Glass and Vape show's, The A.G.E show's and many more smaller one's. The last $10,000 will be spent on Advertising and Marketing. We will run 4 month 1/2 page spreads in HQ(Head Quest)magazine one of the largest for the counter culture industry with over 10,000 retail stores reached. We will also advertise in High Times Magazine probably the biggest consumer magazine in the market for 4 months as well as, ERB  and Cannabis Culture Magazines. The last $20,000 will be set aside to hire another 1-2 sales people. The Perks that I'm doing range from ownership in the company, a Current high end Plastic Grin Cone, Social media shout-outs, to hand written thank you notes. We are offering 5 chances to buy 2% of Grind Tech Industries for a $10,000 contribution each. We are offering 2000 chances to buy the Current Grind cone 25% cheaper than retail for a $15 contribution. We are offering 5000 Hand written Thank you notes for a $3 contribution. We are offering a social media Shout-out of your choice for a $1 contribution.If we do not reach our goal of $65,000 we will use the funds between Advertising and New product development with hopes that  this will bring in enough business to pay for trade shows and additional advertising.The ImpactThe Grind Cone is a revolutionary Grinder with more Functions than any other Grinder and will play a big impact on the Market. With an all in one Grinder you save time and a mess. With its design the mess is eliminated by allowing the material to be dispensed straight into ones smoking device saving time in the process. This is a product that everyone in this lifestyle has thought about and asked why there was not one available, well now there is the Grind Cone Grinder is here. A simple thought brought to life and now ready to hit the world with the help of all of the Contributors.      Risks & ChallengesWe face an uphill battle entering into a market that has already been established by several companies. We can easily overcome these hurdles of competition by having a solid advertising and marketing campaign. With the contributions to Grind Tech we will redesign our ads and then advertise in the biggest and most circulated magazine's in our market. We will be able to get out to the many trade shows and physically meet store owners, and distributors to put our products into their hands. 
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:This is a growing market and more and more people every day are entering this market. If you can't contribute financially please help us spread the word about our product by word of mouth or by sharing on social media. Please check our intsagram page out @Grindtech and our Facebook page Grind Tech Industries. Or check out our website www.Grinderkings.com. Thanks you for your time and looking at our Campaign. Please share this Campaign through Indiegogo's Share button and Share with your friends and family. Again, thank you for looking over our Campaign.Remember Get your Grind on with the Grind Cone Grinder!!!

story:
Short Summary

We are Shawn & Alicia Antonio. Most of you know us, some may not. We are professional Fun-Makers.

Shawn has been in the Nightclub and Bar world for 27 years. In the last 15 years in Hollywood, Shawn has helped to launch and host some of the most successful and well known nightlife spots including: Les Deux, Ivar, Cinespace, House of Blues Foundation Room, Garden of Eden, Vanguard, Ritual and Wet Republic (Las Vegas)...... To name a few! 

Alicia moved to Los Angeles in 2009 as an Actress from Australia. Alicia also has qualifications in Marketing and Business Management and has worked for some top Global Corporations, including Brown-Forman (Jack Daniels). Alicia has been helping Shawn to run his events business since 2011, and along the way we fell in love and got married in Vegas!

Now.... we face our biggest challenge together...... Opening our own bar!

For years, many people have asked Shawn "Why Don't You Own Your Own Bar?" and he had many people offer to invest. But - the time wasn't right.

Now, we have a rock solid concept we have been developing since late 2013, and we are ready to GO!

The concept is simple - A sexy, welcoming, affordable and unique bar with a Vintage flair. We are creating your home away from home - a place where you can meet friends, socialize with awesome people, enjoy great cocktails and food and where the staff know your name. This bar is all about EXPERIENCES. Great people and great times. We believe Life is nothing without Moments and Memories.

A friend recently told us "You can not only call yourselves Entrepreneurs, Promoters, Artists......... But, another layer........ Light Spreaders, Joy Givers, Genuine People Partners and, HAPPINESS MAKERS!".

It is our aim to make everyone who walks through our door feel SPECIAL.

Ever been turned away by a Door Bitch? Couldn't find free or reasonable parking or had your stuff stolen by Valet? Ever had your credit card double charged? Automatic gratuities on a 1-person tab? Ever been kicked off a table for a bottle buyer? Couldn't get on a guest list? Ever felt like you weren't cool enough?

Yeah, we think it sucks too. Hollywood has changed. We want to go back to the days where everyone has a place to go and feel welcome. We already have a name, a brand, a logo, an identity, a design idea, a menu, a team........ and we are now ready to start looking for the right location!

We have an amazing team on our side who understand our vision and are passionate, professional and unstoppable and we are looking for the right space to create our dream.

What We Need & What You Get

We need seed money!

After 8 months of looking, we have now found some potential locations for our vision and the need the finances to get the wheels in motion.

We need $250,000 to get the project up and running. These funds will go towards:

  • Set up our LLC.
  • Purchase a business with a 47 license.
  • Transfer the Licenses and CUP's.
  • Paying for professional services ie. Appraiser, Building Inspector, Consultants, Legal Services etc.
  • Marketing/Advertising/PR.
  • Location Set up costs - Purchase Liquor, Food, Equipment etc.
  • Entertainment.
  • Staffing.
In return for your support, you'll get various Perks! Each Contributor will also go on the VIP mailing list and receive 'First Look' updates and progress reports as we make steps towards making our dream a reality. We'll keep you involved every step of the way and let you know how we are spending the funds!

    The Impact

    The Antonio's have an exceptional track record in bringing fun and successful events to venues across Los Angeles. Now, we want to revolutionize the experience of Los Angeles Nightlife and create a new standard in our own venue.

    Our aim is to bring people together from all walks of life, all races, all cultures and create a warm environment where everyone feels at home. We want to offer affordable, quality eats and cocktails that don't blow your budget.

      Risks & Challenges

      The bar and restaurant industry is fraught with danger. Many, if not most, businesses in the industry in Los Angeles fail.

      The pitfalls are ego, poor planning, lack of startup finances or overblown budgets, mis-direction, no identity, poorly trained staff, inferior quality, lack of passion, no marketing/PR, and not knowing what the hell you are doing.

      We are acutely aware that this is not an easy venture. However - we are passionate about our business and about our friends and customers!! We have carefully crafted a vision over time that we believe meets the needs of our customers, and the 'missing' in the current market. We are HOLLYWOOD SIMPLIFIED...... taking it back to the basics.

      Between Shawn and Alicia, we have the skill-set and experience to handle the usual pitfalls. Where we do not have the experience, we already have an expert team of people who have committed themselves to the project with us. We only have the best of the best running with us.

      The challenge for us is finding a venue that suits our needs and is convenient/well suited to you, our friends and customers.

      We are working with financial and business advisors to ensure we accurately budget and are prepared for every eventuality.... problems and hurdles will come up!

       BRING IT!

        Other Ways You Can Help

        We understand that it is a tough economy for everyone right now, but every dollar helps.

        If Shawn has ever bought you a drink or dinner, got you a comp bottle/table, walked you into a LA or Vegas nightclub for free, hugged you when you are down, met your parents, been to your birthday party/wedding, listened to you when you needed an ear, given you advice, made you smile, made a difference for you in your life, let you sleep on his couch, bailed you out, thrown your birthday party, introduced you to your significant other, connected you with new friends, introduced you to your favorite celeb, got you into a club when you were underage (sorry!) or gone out of his way to make sure you have an amazing and memorable time........ will you please contribute to the Antonio DREAM?

        Even if you can only spare $5, everything helps us to continue to create amazing memories with YOU, at a place we can all call home.

        And if you absolutely cannot help us financially, PLEASE share our link with all your friends on Social Media! Pass a tin around your office and collect spare change for us! Have a baked goods sale! Get your kids to set up a Lemonade stand! Wash some cars in a bikini! Sell your stuff on Ebay!

        Ha! 

        Just kidding..... but seriously - please help us to continue to create amazing moments and memories with great people.

        Thank you for being a part of our journey.

story:
My name is Ron De Silva. I am the CEO for CurdZ Inc. I am also the CEO of Real Mortgage Associates Inc. (RMA). I launched RMA in June of 2006 as a start-up mortgage brokerage.  In 2013, the network funded over $1Billion in mortgages, is now the 10th largest brokerage in Canada. Prior to RMA, I was involved with the start-up of two national firms that have subsequently been acquired by major banks. My focus at Curdz will be in growing the investor base, and guiding the growth of CurdZ Poutineries into a recognized chain of stores across Canada.

Canadian's love poutine. Quebec has had poutineries for decades. Now the poutinerie as a fast food concept is moving out to the other provinces. Poutine is a favourite food of the Millennials and the late-night bar crowd. Smokes Poutinerie is a chain that began in 2008 in Toronto. Today, they have 80 stores and growing. The market is ready for another chain....with a difference.

Instead of franchising, we are introducing a new investment structure. A Canadian-Controlled Private Corporation (CCPC) is set up with a maximum of 50 investors that will own 3 poutineries. By establishing a CCPC we have reduced the barriers of entry for many investors like you to own a chunk of a restaurant chain. This particular CCPC curently has two store locations secured.... 2015 Lakeshore Rd (at Brant Street) in Burlington and 180 James St. S (at Augusta) in Hamilton. Both locations are in densely populated areas and in the heart of bar districts in their respective cities.

Each CCPC will raise $130,000 to launch 3 stores. This particular CCPC has already raised $80K of the $130,000. The principals of Curdz have invested $40K and the other $40K has come from investors in $5K chunks. We are looking for the balance $50,000.


Smaller Crowd Funding Opportunity:

If you're a poutine lover you 'll love this....

- for every $25 you send us you will receive a gift certificate for 5 Gourmet Poutines (approximate retail value $45).

- for every $50 you send us you will receive a gift certificate for 12 Gourmet Poutines (approximate retail value $108).It makes a perfect gift for a colleague or even as a stocking stuffer. Don't wait, get started.

story:
The Dream: What your money supports

Two brothers, Joseph H, and Levis, plan to open a stall in order to support their family. The JHL Boutik (JHL is their initials), is their dream.

The money donated to the JHL's Boutik will go towards supplies to build a solid stand to sell their goods and services. Wood, roofing supplies, cement, etc.The stall they plan on building will be similar to the abandoned building pictured. It will be a store servicing locals, provideing necessities that are difficult to come by outside of Cap Haitien.

Levis' son, Ralph, is currently being homeschooled behind their house. The money they make from the stall will go towards Ralph's schooling.

The things that they will be sellling include: T shirts, hand crafted jewelry, cologne, perfume, tooth brushes and tooth paste, anti-bacterial soap, skin creams, shampoo, also hats and posters.

Levis and Joseph have both agreed to pass foward some of their profits in order to help others in their community who dream of openning a business.

History

JHL's is the dream of Levis Seraphin and Joseph Inelus, two brothers from Vaudrueil, Cap Haitien, Haiti. Levis, the older of the two, spent many years in the Dominican Republic living with family members and searching for work, finding it on occasions, but never finding stablity. 

Levis decided to leave the DR three months ago and return to his home in beautiful Haiti to be with his son, Ralph Schneider, and immediate family in Vaudueil, Cap Haitien where it's a day-to-day struggle to find a stable job.

Upon his return to Haiti, Levis fell very ill with Cholera and was nursed back to good health by his family. Levis hopes to own a business, along with his  brother Joseph, to help repay the favor and to be able to support thier family and the people close to them.

Joseph the younger brother is currently working as a medical translator which he greatly enjoyes, and is a founding member of a community gathering center Baz Dje Dje that's literally right off the main road in Vaudueil. Baz Dje Dje is a place where kids in the community can go to hang out, movies are shown on a makeshift projection screen, and friends and family have a place to get together. 

Owning passports, both brothers have dreams of visiting the states. Levis would like to take his son to see the big cities in the US and Joseph has dreams of going to school in the US and becoming a doctor.

Info on Haiti according to the CIA world facbook

Widespread unemployment and underemployment; more than two-thirds of the labor force do not have formal jobs.

80% of haiti's population is below the poverty line.

story:
Short Summary

Artists are what drive the world forward. The creation of new musical genres, or new styles, or a great piece of work define our current generation and future generations to come. But even the artist needs support and someone to help them gain the recognition and success that they wholly deserve, which is where management comes in. 

Briefly, my name is Ilya Shapiro, and I've been involved with music since the early age of 9 with my first professional concert. A year ago, I founded and currently am the sole proprietor of 'Atuned PR & Management" (http://www.atuned.net), establishing the slogan "powering tomorrow's cultural icons today" because of the love I have for helping young artists achieve their success and recognition. Growing up as a musician, I intimately understand all the difficulties and the work necessary to create a successful and longstanding career for any artist I work with. 

A month ago, I went to Los Angeles for business and ended up sky-rocketing my company name with contract signings and growing interest. Now I am at the pivotal moment of growing my passion and dedication to the next level, where it is necessary for me to move myself and my company to Los Angeles! 

I'm hoping my brief story will inspire you to help be a part of my story of success as a small business rising the ladder, and it would be an honor for each and every one of you to be a part of that story! 

What We Need & What You Get

As a boutique business owner, you will immensely helping me out by: 
  • Assisting in initial expenses in transportation costs. 
  • Assisting in first months expense of settling in Los Angeles and hit the ground running
What you will be getting in return is:
  • Immense gratitude on a daily basis for helping a passionate small business owner 
  • Being a part of the story of start-up business on the verge of success
  • Monthly updates via newsletter of what I am doing and pushing 'Atuned PR & Management" forward in Los Angeles, CA. 

ABOUT ATUNED PR & MANAGEMENT

Atuned PR & Management is a boutique company currently based in New York, NY. Focused on the success of combining and creating trends in the entertainment culture. As a full service artist mentoring, management, booking, and marketing company, Atuned utilizes its extensive reach of contacts in both the underground and mainstream markets. Helping build strong brands, emphasizing on brand strategy and relationship marketing; Atuned incorporates connections, seed products, designs unique promotions, and contacts a diverse international network. 

ATUNED PR & MANAGEMENT targets those that create trends rather than those who follow, resulting in lasting impressions. 

The Impact

  • Leveraging an early relationship with talented artists 
  • The ability, passion, and dedication to grow alongside the artists I work with

Risks & Challenges

Traveling across the country and setting up in a new city is always a challenge, especially since I will be driving across the country. 

  • Driving over 3,000 miles, from coast to coast presents its own challenge.
  • Situating myself in LA upon arrival. Many places I've spoken to have told me they would rather be speaking to someone who is currently living in Los Angeles. 

Solutions

There are few options upon arrival to Los Angeles. 
  • Extended night hotels: Many hotels offer options for extended night at a lower rate. This will be used for the first couple of weeks while in Los Angeles. 
  • Couch-surfing: A popular option of the 21st Century. Already as a part of the couch-surfing community, I have been sending out messages to those willing to lend me a couch or a bed for a few nights while I look for a place. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know times are tough, we all have our own worries, and cannot spare any extra money, but there are other ways to help me out:

    • Tell people about this. Every bit earned will make this a reality, and it will help the community sooner than you think!
    • You can share this with the Indiegogo share tools.
    • Also, if you're willing to let a relative stranger sleep on your couch in the Los Angeles area for a few weeks, that's by far the biggest chunk of my costs I have! I can help out around the house, cook, etc!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary Artists are what drive the world forward. The creation of new musical genres, or new styles, or a great piece of work define our current generation and future generations to come. But even the artist needs support and someone to help them gain the recognition and success that they wholly deserve, which is where management comes in. 
Briefly, my name is Ilya Shapiro, and I've been involved with music since the early age of 9 with my first professional concert. A year ago, I founded and currently am the sole proprietor of 'Atuned PR & Management" (http://www.atuned.net), establishing the slogan "powering tomorrow's cultural icons today" because of the love I have for helping young artists achieve their success and recognition. Growing up as a musician, I intimately understand all the difficulties and the work necessary to create a successful and longstanding career for any artist I work with. 
A month ago, I went to Los Angeles for business and ended up sky-rocketing my company name with contract signings and growing interest. Now I am at the pivotal moment of growing my passion and dedication to the next level, where it is necessary for me to move myself and my company to Los Angeles! 
I'm hoping my brief story will inspire you to help be a part of my story of success as a small business rising the ladder, and it would be an honor for each and every one of you to be a part of that story!    What We Need & What You Get
As a boutique business owner, you will immensely helping me out by:  
Assisting in initial expenses in transportation costs. 
Assisting in first months expense of settling in Los Angeles and hit the ground running

What you will be getting in return is:

Immense gratitude on a daily basis for helping a passionate small business owner  Being a part of the story of start-up business on the verge of success
Monthly updates via newsletter of what I am doing and pushing 'Atuned PR & Management" forward in Los Angeles, CA.  
  ABOUT ATUNED PR & MANAGEMENT Atuned PR & Management is a boutique company currently based in New York, NY. Focused on the success of combining and creating trends in the entertainment culture. As a full service artist mentoring, management, booking, and marketing company, Atuned utilizes its extensive reach of contacts in both the underground and mainstream markets. Helping build strong brands, emphasizing on brand strategy and relationship marketing; Atuned incorporates connections, seed products, designs unique promotions, and contacts a diverse international network. 
ATUNED PR & MANAGEMENT targets those that create trends rather than those who follow, resulting in lasting impressions. 

The Impact

Leveraging an early relationship with talented artists 
The ability, passion, and dedication to grow alongside the artists I work with


Risks & Challenges  Traveling across the country and setting up in a new city is always a challenge, especially since I will be driving across the country.  
Driving over 3,000 miles, from coast to coast presents its own challenge. Situating myself in LA upon arrival. Many places I've spoken to have told me they would rather be speaking to someone who is currently living in Los Angeles.  

Solutions
There are few options upon arrival to Los Angeles. 

Extended night hotels: Many hotels offer options for extended night at a lower rate. This will be used for the first couple of weeks while in Los Angeles. 
Couch-surfing: A popular option of the 21st Century. Already as a part of the couch-surfing community, I have been sending out messages to those willing to lend me a couch or a bed for a few nights while I look for a place. 



Other Ways You Can Help I know times are tough, we all have our own worries, and cannot spare any extra money, but there are other ways to help me out:

Tell people about this. Every bit earned will make this a reality, and it will help the community sooner than you think!
You can share this with the Indiegogo share tools.
Also, if you're willing to let a relative stranger sleep on your couch in the Los Angeles area for a few weeks, that's by far the biggest chunk of my costs I have! I can help out around the house, cook, etc!

 And that's all there is to it.

story:
I know this is taking balls, but you know I have them.

I am selling my apartment, I have  buyer, a buyer who's got 250k in the bank, putting 25% down and makes 60k a year.  A young professional, nice, shy guy - who until the interview we all (real estate, lawyers and all) thought this was a no brainer.  After all I've lost my job since last October.... I have been trying to work mentoring kids and playing music.... I want to change my life.... I want to move forward.
MY CO-OP BOARD TURNED HIM DOWN.  No explanation... yet.  Honestly - nothing they could say at this point would make sense.  This buyer is perfect.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $3,000 to fly me and the kitties to CO and get us settled.  I can't wait around here, my life is already started there.
  • Douglas Elliman Real Estate is handling the sale, they (they are also completely floored by this decision) will continue to aggressively put the apartment back on the market and sell.  They have had other buyers interested, there was just no reason because we had a contract of sale signed.  
  • BIG SHOW ON THURSDAY, AUGUST 28TH - 8PM - 11PM AT LUCA BAR IN NYC... FREE ALL FOR YOU!!!

    Risks & Challenges

    • No risk, just helping a friend who's in a horrible situation. 
    • Knowing that upon arrival in CO, I have TWO jobs waiting for me.  I've been asked to be on the Board of the Boulder International Fringe Festival and have booked my first steady paying gig at a local awesome venue.
    • Knowing that I will be working my ass off to have the life that I've been telling you about.  Living better, mentoring kids and making the world a better place.

    And that's all there is to it.  I'm in a humbled and hopeful position.

    I love you for considering to help me.  
    Karen

story:
Short Summary

Profound Sound was started in 1994 to utilize my education and background in sound reinforcement and recording engineering.  The building we settled on was too big for just a fledgling recording studio, so we opened a small musical instrument sales, repair and rental shop out front and ran the studio in the back.  We opened a rehearsal studio within a year of opening and we just continued to grow.  We were then located at 19th & S streets in Sacramento CA

We blossomed into a $500k business in less than 5 years, and served our community of musicians by doing things differently and meeting our customers needs.  When the major big box music store moved to town in 2000, we were impacted financially adversely for the following year; but it was on a personal level that ultimately made us decide to close up the brick and mortar shop, and take our business online.   

We continued to run our rehearsal space for 4 years longer, and sold online at the same time.  At the peak of the real estate boom, our landlord cancelled our lease and sold the building for a mega profit, and we were out of business.

Our business continued with a limited presence on line and still we sought  out specialty items for our clients, did a few installations, and consultations, but it was in 2010, after repeated requests and a change in the local market, we decided to reopen the store in Midtown Sacramento; where we flourished once before.  In 2011, we re-established our business and decided that we would dedicate ourselves to the working musician and the used instrument market; with hard to find instruments and parts, affordable alternatives, expedited repairs, and once again, meeting the needs of musicians.  


We are still here after 3+ years but have completely outgrown the small shop we have occupied since then.  With this expansion, we hope to be here for the long term and continue our "musician's family" approach to business.  That's where you come in.......

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to expand into a bigger space, increase our inventory, and update our repair benches to meet the growing needs of our business. This will require construction and remodeling of any building we find, to customize the space to meet our needs.   We would also need to cover moving expenses, deposits on the new space and a financial buffer while we inform our clientele of our new location. 

We were too large for this space when we took it and we have a lot more inventory sitting in storage that wants to be set free to the public.  In addition, our clients have plenty of consignment items that we just don't have room for.    

We are more than happy to share our branded store merchandise and promotional items with all of those that contribute to our campaign, in the way of shirts, hats, and other cool Profound Sound swag.  We are also featuring "I Support Local Music" items as well.  All fine, quality items that you will be proud to wear and use.  

We are also offering an engineering workshop, and a personal visit from Santa to your holiday party for those that want to contribute at the executive levels.

No matter the amount of your contribution, you will be honored on our Facebook page and our website that you helped us expand our business.  No mention of your contribution and the listing will be in the order of those that contributed first.   If you provide your email address at the time of donation, we will send you a Thank You note as well!

    The Impact

    We have always striven to meet the needs of working musicians, by offering competitive pricing, free advice, and referrals when we don't have what they need.  This will obviously continue since it is what we are best at.  By helping us with this expansion, you are supporting a grassroots business that assists the local community, and fosters aspiring artists. 

    • In the 11 years we operated the first incarnation of our business, we hosted many up and coming bands in our rehearsal studios, recording studio, as well as providing necessary supplies and tools for their endeavors.  Bands from Sacramento used our services on their way up the ladder of success and that was our greatest accomplishment.  We provided tour support, and shipped necessary accessories directly to bands while on tour
    • Don't take our word for it; ask the musicians in Sacramento if you know any how we have helped them.  We have a very loyal clientele.  Proof of that is the fact that we reopened at the request of so many that missed us.

    What We Are About

    We know that it is a big hurdle competing with the big box retailers, and honestly, we know that you can take your business on line and shop from the convenience of your couch.  We are not trying to change that.  

    But if you like to touch the things that you want to play, make that personal connection with an instrument, or just get the real world input of folks that make knowing the answers to your questions their priority, that's what we are here for.

    In fact, our whole concept of business is to provide what the others shops wont; unique items, and hard to find parts and accessories, in addition to the everyday needs and expendables.  We  don't say no if it is something that is readily available

    • What can we do that warrants your support and business?
      Years of accumulated experience, knowledge about gear that is long past current, and an extensive number of resources have made us, and continue to make us a destination for those that are tired of the hard sale, "you've gotta leave with something" approach to business
    • Here is our strategy for meeting these challenges.
      We obviously offer a destination in Sacramento as a brick and mortar store, but we also sell on line and ship all over the country.  In doing so we increase our exposure to the world of players out there that are looking for a different type of experience.


    Here are a few testimonials from our satisfied customers:

    • Jonathan M. R
    The best place to go for gear, gear advice, and good gear recommendations in Sacramento! A vast amount of knowledge and they're local!


    • John M. 
    This is a Music Shop that is reminiscent of Black Market Music in San Francisco. There are so many surprises here. They also carry the best parts supply in Sacramento for stringed musical instruments. They also have a wide selection of guitar and bass strings. This is my go to store.


    • Mike C. 9/21/2014
    This shop is a hidden gem.  Vintage guitars-vintage pedals- cool analog gear- drums- bass- old amps. Music books- I can stay gab with the owner for hours, he's personable- he will fix any vintage combo amp you are serious about buying. Cool interesting gear. Owner is  a walking encyclopedia of  gear.


    • Jeffrey B. 12/3/2012
    As the description indicates , this store has a hands on owner that will assist you in everyway! The store is a treasure of hard to find used gear. The location is easy to reach and the advise, is concerned. When I am looking for gear, I start here!


    • Shun I. 7/15/2013
    I needed some guitar strings ASAP and didn't want to go all the way to Guitar Center, so I decided to stop by here after some searching for nearby stores. Since I only went in for some strings, this will be a short review, but I liked my experience here. Pack of NOS strings are $4 or less, and new sets cost about $6. Joey was a really friendly guy, and I will definitely be coming back here again for my guitar needs. 


    •  Will L.   10/8/12
    Serendipity. Though syllables from that word sound like portions of "Zippity-Doo-Dah", a  song from Disney's Song of the South, the word means an occurrence or beneficial chance development. Zippity-Doo-Dah was covered by a few different bands, including the Kingsmen, Freddie and the Dreamers, Paula Abdul, and even the Jackson Five. And you know what bands need in order to cover songs? Instruments and equipment.  Of which Profound Sound has. It's not a huge store like Guitar Center or American Music. It's not easy to spot from the street, either. You gotta look for Midtown Furniture and More, and instead of heading right into the furniture store, head left into the music shop.  However, what you'll find in here is a couple dudes who play and love music.  You'll find a bunch of amps, some guitars and basses, some drumkits, and a whole bunch of electronics. The salesguy won't drive you crazy like GC, and there probably won't be some wannabe guitarist showing off his chops in the corner for an hour. So, next time you get a hankering to cover an old Disney tune, zip over here and get your gear.
    Some of the comments from our Facebook page:
    Dolores W.
    Pretty much Joey rules
    Gregory H

    The BEST music store in Sacramento!

    • Gregory H.  Sometimes the truth doesn't hurt Joey Cline!
    James R.  You Rock Joey!
    • Janine B.

    9/24/2014

    My family have been Profound Sound customers for years.  We have found rare items that were priced way below what we expected to pay.  We have had help with how to fix equipment, and parts needed were on site & affordable.  Joey knows his stuff, and I trust his opinion.  I have purchased many quality items from Profound Sound and have never had a problem with anything.


    As you can see we have plenty of satisfied customers, but we aren't perfect, and realize that we can't be.  We strive to help musicians of all levels to find the tools and information to help them take it to the next level; even if it means sending them elsewhere.  

    We hope that you can help us help others by contributing to the cause, but if not.....



    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know money is tight; we deal with that problem every single day ourselves and with our clientele.  You can help by spreading the word to others that may be interested in supporting a maverick business like ours.  Keep the mom and pop music store alive!

    • There are options here on Indiegogo to do just that.  Feel free to ask how you can help in other ways than contributing financially; we will be happy to send you some ideas to help!
    • Visit our page on Facebook to see what we are about and how we are different from the big box retailers.  Help to spread the word about us
    Here are a few links to information about us
    • https://www.facebook.com/pages/Profound-Sound-M...
    • http://www.yelp.com/biz/profound-sound-sacramento
    • Last, but not least, check out these videos to see how much stuff we have crammed into our small space, and this was 3 years ago 
    •  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BuWVH3cxwGU&index=6&list=UU_OG4r12k-QrmZYL7F1u6iQ
    • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RiKwYdceu90&index=4&list=UU_OG4r12k-QrmZYL7F1u6iQ

story:
Our Story

Startup Hackathon is an initiative of Student Entrepreneurs inc. a not for profit organisation dedicated to fostering innovation and entrepreneurship amongst tertiary students.

After participating in 'Startup Camp 2008' (as run by Sydney entrepreneur Bart Jellema) and loving it, we thought there needs to be such an event run for students. And so 'Startup Hackathon' was borne! Since then we've run 3 Hackathons, each bigger and better than the last. With the 2011 edition attracting over 40 tech students from around Victoria, resulting in 13 web & mobile start-ups being deployed during the event.

We are Australiaâ€™s largest student-centric innovation and entrepreneurship focused organisation. Founded in 2008 at the University of Melbourne, we have since grown to over 1400 members, and are currently expanding into universities across the country. We have fostered a number of successful startups in the past, and hope that our Startup Hackathon events will continue to grow, introducing more young people skilled with technology, to the startup scene.


What it is.

â€˜Startup Hackathon' brings together teams of IT and design students from universities around Victoria, launching web-based startups â€“ from scratch â€“ in 48 hours. Each team will conceive and develop their idea over the course of a weekend, and on the final day pitch their startups to a group of Melbourneâ€™s leaders in the tech startup scene. 

The challenge: make something people want.

Students are aided with workshops to brainstorm ideas and business models, working in teams to formulate an idea, then the race begins to design, develop and deploy their application within the time constraints.


The Impact

Our 'Startup Hackathon' events have received great success in the past, with contestants continuing to work on their startups post event, and integrating into the wider entrepreneurial community. Our goal for the event is to foster the community and introduce tech students to the startup scene. The connections, friends, skills, and ideas that arise from our events give opportunities and ventures to the budding and eagre students our event attracts. 


Startup Hackathon Melbourne runs entirely on the goodwill and love from all who wish to support young the next generation of Australian entrepreneurs!

Previous Hackathons

http://www.startupsmart.com.au/growth/young-entrepreneurs/2011-07-27/student-entrepreneurs-to-host-startup-hackathon.html

 

http://anthillonline.com/students-locked-up-again-until-they-build-6-web-startups-from-scratch/

 

What We Need


Our target is $4000 (aud) as a base-platform for 2012 Hackthon. However  every cent we make above that goal allows us to create an even more life changing experience for the participants and make our event better than it's ever been.

The major expenses of our event include:

Food and Drink: all meals, drinks and snacks are provided for the 48 hours including the conclusion party (for a 50 person event, we are out of pocket about $2300 for this alone).

Technical Costs (All the internet and associated hosting costs).

Venue Hire and associated costs.

Insurance

Prizes  and Merchandise

In all facets of the event, we are open for sponsorship as well as donations. If you feel you can provide goods or services that help us make this event great, we would love to hear from you! Further, itâ€™s great to have the support of others who share our passions and views â€“ please do not hesitate to contact us if you would like to be involved.
story_txt:
Our Story 
Startup
Hackathon is an initiative of Student
Entrepreneurs inc. a not for profit organisation dedicated to fostering
innovation and entrepreneurship amongst tertiary students. After participating in 'Startup Camp 2008' (as run by Sydney entrepreneur Bart Jellema) and loving it, we thought there needs to be such an event run for students. And so 'Startup Hackathon' was borne! Since then we've run 3 Hackathons, each bigger and better than the last. With the 2011 edition attracting over 40 tech students from around Victoria, resulting in 13 web & mobile start-ups being deployed during the event.
We are Australiaâ€™s largest student-centric innovation and
entrepreneurship focused organisation. Founded in 2008 at the University
of Melbourne, we have since grown to over 1400 members, and are currently
expanding into universities across the country. We have fostered a number of
successful startups in the past, and hope that our Startup Hackathon events
will continue to grow, introducing more young people skilled with technology,
to the startup scene. 

What it is.
â€˜Startup
Hackathon' brings together teams of IT and design
students from universities around Victoria, launching web-based startups â€“ from
scratch â€“ in 48 hours. Each team will conceive and develop their idea over the
course of a weekend, and on the final day pitch their startups
to a group of Melbourneâ€™s leaders in the tech startup scene. 
The challenge: make something people want.
Students are aided with workshops to brainstorm ideas and business
models, working in teams to formulate an idea, then the race begins to design, develop and deploy their application
within the time constraints. 

The Impact
Our 'Startup Hackathon' events have received great success in the past, with contestants continuing to work on their startups post event, and integrating into the wider entrepreneurial community. Our goal for the event is to foster the community and introduce tech students to the startup scene. The connections, friends,
skills, and ideas that arise from our events give opportunities and ventures to
the budding and eagre students our event attracts. 

Startup Hackathon Melbourne
runs entirely on the goodwill and love from all who wish to
support young the next generation of Australian entrepreneurs!
Previous Hackathons
http://www.startupsmart.com.au/growth/young-entrepreneurs/2011-07-27/student-entrepreneurs-to-host-startup-hackathon.html
 
http://anthillonline.com/students-locked-up-again-until-they-build-6-web-startups-from-scratch/
 
What We Need

Our target is $4000 (aud) as a base-platform for 2012 Hackthon. However  every cent we make above that goal allows us to
create an even more life changing experience for the participants and make our event  better
than it's ever been. 
The major expenses of our event include:
Food and Drink: all meals, drinks and snacks are provided for the 48 hours
including the conclusion party (for a 50 person event, we are out of pocket about $2300 for this alone). 
Technical Costs (All the internet and associated hosting costs).
Venue Hire and associated costs.
Insurance 
Prizes  and Merchandise
In all facets of the event, we are open for sponsorship as well as
donations. If you feel you can provide goods or services that help us make this
event great, we would love to hear from you! Further, itâ€™s great to have
the support of others who share our passions and views â€“ please do not hesitate
to contact us if you would like to be involved.

story:
My Story

My name is Jolie Umstead and I am a 20 year old student at William Paterson University in New Jersey. In March of this past year, I went with my school to Lynchburg, Virginia to build a habitat home. Within that one week of building, I fell in love with Habitat. The experience enriched my life in so many ways; I expected to help a family and gained much more for myself. I felt as though I had finally found my purpose, my calling. The regulars called it "feeling the feeling."


I came back from the trip determined to do more for Habitat, and within a month started a Habitat for Humanity club at my university. A few weeks ago I was offered an opportunity to build the 500,000th habitat home in the city of Maai Mahlu, Kenya. This could be the experience of a lifetime, but unfortunately the cost of the trip makes the opportunity out of reach for me.

The Impact

Habitat for Humanity provides people all over the world with low income housing. They make this possible through donations and work of volunteers. 


Habitat for Humanity has shown that building homes does more than put a roof over someone’s head. In clean, decent, stable housing:

  • Families can provide stability for their children.
  • A family’s sense of dignity and pride grow.
  • Health, physical safety, and security improve
  • Educational and job prospects increase.


What (&Why) It Is Needed

The cost of the trip is around 3000, but I am only asking for 2,500 to help me out. Even 5 dollars would be a step towards this goal. I would leave September 1st and come back on September 10th. The cost of the trip provides Kenya Habitat with the funding necessary to build the houses, and while on the trip we could build not just one, but a few houses for different families who have been living in tents for more than three years. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Visit www.habitat.org to find ways to volunteer in your area.

story:
Throw Us a Bone!

We are a small, woman-owned and dog-loving company based in San Francisco, CA.  We have no large funders so we are asking YOU for financial support to help get us off the ground. Seriously, anything helps. GoDogPro.com is now live and we need money for advertising and marketing.

What is GoDogPro?

GoDogPro is for dog owners looking for an established and licensed dog business they can trust. Our comprehensive directory helps dog guardians choose a local dog professional based on their experience, expertise, credentials, and reputation.

GoDogPro is accessible and user-centered with a mobile-friendly interface, which will enable us to scale up nationally and create a corresponding app. 

GoDogPro will take the uncertainty and worry out of finding the right person to take care of your dog. With the exception of veterinarians, the dog service industry (dog walking, training, boarding, daycare, and grooming) is an unregulated industry. Virtually anyone can start a business and claim they are a  “dog expert”.

Our database requires professionals to post their business license, insurance/bonding, credentials, schooling, and the number of years in business. GoDogPro strives to support local small businesses that exemplify professionalism, expertise, and experience.

   

Educating dog owners

We are committed to representing only dog professionals that use positive reinforcement and force-free methods in their training, walking, and handling clients’ dogs. Dog training and dog handling methods have significantly evolved over the past 15-20 years and science-based, force-free training and pet care have been proven to be the most effective and humane way to train and handle dogs.

 

            Hiring an expert - someone who knows dogs and handles dogs for a living  -                                  means peace of mind for you and a better experience for your dog.

story:
Harp & Shamrock Croft has a heart for feeding people. Their commitment to putting healthy, local food on Spartanburg tables is unparalleled and they are a gift to our community.

Caroline Sexton, Executive Director at Hub City Farmers' Market

 

About Us

Harp & Shamrock Croft, LLC, est. 2013, is simply on a journey to realize our dream with hard work and dedication anyone can accomplish what they set out to do. For us that dream was to start a farm.

We are a small family farm in the upstate of South Carolina with a mission of bringing local, fresh, and sustainable food to the community. What started out as a dream has become a successful reality. We are not experts by any means as we still have a lot to learn, but the excitement grows from mid-January on each year as we engage in farming by producing more great food. Our goal is to continue to expand in size and grow larger quantities of produce for the community to enjoy.

The Campaign

If we want to plant early enough to have fresh vegetables by the end of winter for our market and on-site customers, then we need to construct a much larger greenhouse (high tunnel) by early January. That's why we are coming to you.

(an example of the greenhouse frame that was given to us)

The new greenhouse would allow us to grow specifically in this structure while using our much smaller high tunnels as seed starting stations since we start all of our transplants by seed onsite. As a registered nursery we are licensed to sell plants, so you can imagine how quickly the space in these structures fills up. 

   

(a look inside one of our diy smaller high tunnels)

The Campaign to complete the construction would help cover the costs for:

  • 6mil four-year plastic
  • End wall construction
  • Oversize door
  • Channels and springs to lock plastic 
  • Side venting system
  • Remaining hardware
  • Labor

The total cost for equipment and additional expenses to get the structure functional is $3,500.

You may ask yourself "why should I give to this Campaign?" It feels good to give; especially when the cause is to make people healthier and support a small family farm that has worked hard to build a reputation for success in just a short time. Any funds raised over this amount will be invested into the overall farm operation, so you can be assured your dollars will be spent wisely.

(breakdown of expenses that we hope the Campaign can help us reach)

Your generosity will be rewarded as we will give back, too. Please take a look at our Perks for various giving opportunities. We are happy to tailor these Perks to your needs as well. The Perks represent what we as a farm are all about and hope that you can see the value in supporting us.

We understand you want to give to a great cause. We believe concrete examples can help overcome any reservations. We will allow our accomplishments to attest to our success and worthiness of more investment by you and others who share our vision.  

What We Have Accomplished So Far In Our Short History

So far Harp & Shamrock Croft, LLC, has:

  • Approximately 5,000 lbs of harvested food through November 1, 2017 (compared to 2,500 lbs in all of 2016)
  • Finished the on-farm store front to simplify customers' purchase of produce
  • Completed a successful inaugural year Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) through three eight-week seasons that provided fresh, weekly vegetable shares to over 150 people
  • Raised organic-fed, pasture-raised chickens for eggs to sell on-site and at local farmers' markets
  • Partnered with Hub City Farmers' Market to provide produce for their CSA Shares and Mobile Market to a more diverse demographic in areas classified as food deserts
  • Introduced and increased the number of visitors to the farm and provided more educational opportunities for farm work days
  • Engaged the surrounding community by hosting events on the farm to educate, entertain, and feed
  • Finally Launched a YouTube channel focusing on gardening and homesteading tutorials

We are a community-driven farm that thrives in knowing what we produce is making those healthier. In just a few short years, we have gone from just a few thousand square feet in growing space to an acre.

   

The Impact of Having A Larger Greenhouse

Because we are small farm with limited space to expand on, the greenhouse would allow us to grow during the off season, but also extend our growing season as well. Simply, a greenhouse would allow us to grow year-around, save space, and:

  • Increase quantity and availability of chemical-free produce for purchase onsite as well as during winter markets (we take great pride in our main farmers' market and work hard to bring a good variety of produce each week)
  • Use the success that we have achieved in growing in our smaller high tunnels to the next level
  • Most importantly, the Campaign will permit us to avoid taking on any further debt

   

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has the means to give, but we still depend on others passing the word for us. This is what you can do for us:

  • Share our IndieGoGo Campaign with your network of friends and family encouraging everyone to support us
  • Follow us on Social Media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, Etsy) to get updates and special announcements on the Campaign or how life is going for us on our farm
  • Come to the Market as often as possible or stop by our onsite store front  
  • Visit our website for locations and times of markets and store hours

It is really that simple. We live in a time where Social Media makes a huge impact. Please consider supporting us in any way that you can.

Thanks

If you have any questions regarding this Campaign, please ask. We want to be transparent about our needs: Contact Us.

Thank you for considering our Campaign!

Visit our website for locations and times of markets and store hours

Thanks
If you have any questions regarding this Campaign, please ask. We want to be transparent about our needs: Contact Us.

story:
Who We Are

Over a year and a half ago, my partner Kevin and I began working towards a zero waste lifestyle when we realized we were producing too much trash. In Waterloo Region, the average person produces 675 lbs of waste a year. That’s the weight of approximately 1,800 bananas plus 14,000 disposable coffee cups. Much of our waste consists of food packaging, food waste, and single-use disposables. Plastics are also a huge problem as they cannot truly be recycled, only downcycled into inferior quality products, and are left to contaminate the environment once they can no longer be recycled.

 

Now, we have been able to drastically reduce the amount of waste we produce by making small changes to our habits. However, trying to source products free of packaging and plastic had us travelling to numerous outlets just to complete our groceries. Wanting a one-stop shop to help us reduce our waste, we founded Zero Waste Bulk, Waterloo’s first zero waste grocery store.

 

Introducing Zero Waste Bulk

Our mission at Zero Waste Bulk is to make it easier to live more sustainably by offering package-free goods, sourcing locally & organically, and offering plastic free alternatives whenever we can. Our products will be free of palm oil and primarily plant-based to further reduce our ecological footprint.

 

At Zero Waste Bulk, you can expect to find…

  • Bulk foods (e.g. nuts, grains, beans, candy)
  • Bulk liquids on tap (e.g. cooking oils, vinegars, maple syrup)
  • Bulk soaps (e.g. shampoo, cleaners, detergents)
  • Freshly baked bread
  • Local produce
  • Package-free frozen foods
  • Sustainable alternatives to everyday items (e.g. safety razors)
  • A container return program for milk, yogurt, and ready-to-eat foods packaged in glass containers

We’ll even have bulk toothpaste that you can pump into your own reusable containers!

 

Our BYOC Program

BYOC = Bring Your Own Container!

At Zero Waste Bulk, customers will be encouraged to bring their own reusable containers to fill up on bulk goods. Forgot your own containers? We’ll have sanitized reusable containers for you to grab and fill available for a deposit and paper bags that you can purchase at a small cost.

 

Location & Next Steps

As many of you know, we have been looking for a location for Zero Waste Bulk for quite some time now, and you have been waiting patiently with us as we searched for the right place. We’re excited to share that we have recently secured a location for our storefront at 110 King St S in Uptown Waterloo, but we need some help to cover our startup costs as we get ready to open our doors.

 

What We Need

While we have secured the funds to cover most of our startup costs, the money raised by this campaign will help us equip, renovate, and stock our store while minimizing our reliance on interest heavy loans. We are aiming to raise at least $15,000 with this crowdfunding campaign. While our hope is to exceed this goal, your contributions will still be put towards required equipment and initial inventory, even if we don’t meet our campaign goal.

 

Examples of equipment we will need:

  • Fridges x 3 (just one produce fridge will cost over $7,000!)
  • Freezer
  • Bulk product containers
  • Shelving
  • Product tables
  • Electronic scales
  • Kitchen equipment (e.g. Vitamix, food processor, prep table)
 

What You Get

To get you excited and help you with your own zero waste journey, we’ve put together some sweet rewards packages for our backers.

 

We are offering everything from stainless steel straws to tickets to DIY workshops, but there are a few rewards we want to highlight. These include Earth Points and invitations to Zero Waste Bulk’s pre-launch store party. By registering an account with us (which you can do now to set up paperless receipts in advance), you will be able to collect Earth Points with every purchase. As you accumulate Earth Points, you will be able to spend your Earth Points on items featured in our Rewards Catalogue. Secondly, some of our rewards packages will include two invitations to our pre-launch store party where you can enjoy delicious plant-based foods provided by us and be amongst the first to shop at Zero Waste Bulk!

 

For more information on what each rewards package includes, click on the package of interest. 

Some packages will have an in-store pickup option. If you choose this option, the shipping costs will be returned to you when you pick up your items in store.

If you simply want to make a contribution without getting something in return, click the “BACK IT” button. This option will allow us to put more of the funds towards the store.

 

Online Store

In addition to our brick and mortar storefront, we'll be launching an online store where you can purchase sustainable alternatives to everyday items such as safety razors, floss refills, and package-free stainless steel straws. Eventually we want to expand to have have online purchasing of bulk foods in compostable packaging with shipping available across Canada and potentially the states.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about us and our crowdfunding campaign! Share our campaign link on social media, and tell everyone you know that we're coming to Uptown Waterloo (and tell them to start saving their jars)!

 

Our Impact

By supporting us, you will help support the many local businesses we will be partnering up with, reduce environmental pollution, and reduce food waste by being able to buy only what you need (even if that means buying only one tablespoon of an ingredient)! We also go further and work with our manufacturers and suppliers to reduce waste up the supply chain, encouraging our partners to switch to more sustainable packaging practises and setting up container reuse systems when we can.

 

At Zero Waste Bulk, we also want to give back. One initiative we have recently launched is The KW Straw Project. The aim of the project is to reduce the number of single use straws served at local eateries in Kitchener-Waterloo. For every reusable straw purchased at our in-store location when we open, we will put a stainless steel straw towards our reusable straw fund for local eateries to use. We have already kicked off The KW Straw Project by supplying two local cafes (both Settlement Co. locations) with our reusable straws.

 

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge we are expecting to face regarding our store launch is when we will be able to open our doors. Our building is currently being renovated from the inside out, but we will be doing our best to open this fall.

 

THANK YOU

Thank you, thank you, thank you! Whether you are helping to fund us or just cheering us on, we couldn’t do this without your support. We can’t wait to welcome you to our store!

Online Store
In addition to our brick and mortar storefront, we'll be launching an online store where you can purchase sustainable alternatives to everyday items such as safety razors, floss refills, and package-free stainless steel straws. Eventually we want to expand to have have online purchasing of bulk foods in compostable packaging with shipping available across Canada and potentially the states.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word about us and our crowdfunding campaign! Share our campaign link on social media, and tell everyone you know that we're coming to Uptown Waterloo (and tell them to start saving their jars)! Our Impact
By supporting us, you will help support the many local businesses we will be partnering up with, reduce environmental pollution, and reduce food waste by being able to buy only what you need (even if that means buying only one tablespoon of an ingredient)! We also go further and work with our manufacturers and suppliers to reduce waste up the supply chain, encouraging our partners to switch to more sustainable packaging practises and setting up container reuse systems when we can. At Zero Waste Bulk, we also want to give back. One initiative we have recently launched is The KW Straw Project. The aim of the project is to reduce the number of single use straws served at local eateries in Kitchener-Waterloo. For every reusable straw purchased at our in-store location when we open, we will put a stainless steel straw towards our reusable straw fund for local eateries to use. We have already kicked off The KW Straw Project by supplying two local cafes (both Settlement Co. locations) with our reusable straws.

 
Risks & Challenges
The main challenge we are expecting to face regarding our store launch is when we will be able to open our doors. Our building is currently being renovated from the inside out, but we will be doing our best to open this fall. THANK YOU
Thank you, thank you, thank you! Whether you are helping to fund us or just cheering us on, we couldn’t do this without your support. We can’t wait to welcome you to our store!

story: Hello everyone! My name is Christopher Lee. I am 15 years old and I attend Boys Latin of Philadelphia Charter School. The name of my business is Fired Up: Tae Kwon Do. I have been in training since I was 6 years old and currently a 3rd degree red belt. My mentor and trainer is Grandmaster Oizzie wright Jr. at Chan Moo Kwan martial arts school and he will assist me with teaching classes. Discipline, respect, attitude, keeping out trouble, staying in school are some of the many benefits encouraged of being apart of Fired Up: Tae Kwon Do. I have won 12 trophies at various types of martial art tournaments. I am very determine and passionate about what I do. I am starting a martial arts school because I believe individuals should know how to protect themselves and be aware of their surroundings. With your help I would be able to teach youth and adults the fundamentals of Tae Kwon Do. The money will be used to purchase budget items such as mats, uniforms and equipment( head, hand, and feet gear, weapons, etc.) Thank you all for your support!!!!!!
