story:
OUR MISSION

Our mission is to create a portal that gives everybody the chance to book activities and events organized in a particular region where all the entrepreneurs can advertise their activities for free and the users can find what’s perfect for their needs.

Spassyou. Com was born as a “showcase”, a peer to peer between operators and users with the intent to spread its net to a large number of people, in a way that each activity or event is registered in the portal.

Tourism changes  perpetually. Lately, “travelers” are no more looking for package holidays, but they are at the research of particular activities, like for example bird watching, mycology, herbalist and  less known sports also, but always appreciated by a huge amount of people.

And we’re talking about sports and hobbies that would find their space in Spassyou.com, from the side of the operator who offers activities, and from the other side, the user, that could easily contact the operator to define his vacancies better.

The purpose of Spassyou is to register a number of operators and users able to create a network of contacts, in order to valorize the environments of the operators, giving voice to all those activities which do not have particular visibility.

A portal that encases everything we look for, in the right moment, is the perfect mean to organize a custom holiday, for the seasonal tourist, and for who regularly lives in a region, to discover all those activities that would be remaining in the shadow.

The project started two years ago, it has come this far with a working portal, without any funding. That’s the reason why the project is growing slowly.

We decided to ask for your help to speed up the process of growth of Spassyou, and let everybody free to use the portal.

Our target is to raise money to make technological improvements designed already, and spread the network through marketing.

WHAT WE NEED TO GET WHAT

Spassyou is operating already in BETATEST version.

Even though the functions are minimized now, the operator (that can be owner of a Surf School, or owner of a restaurant, or whoever wants to advertise himself) can sign in and advertise his activities completely for free, sharing offers and events.

In the meanwhile, the user can book the activity, leave comments, send private texts, and other functions that enable the user to use the portal as much as he can.

Functions and design of the website need to be reviewed in order to have an easy and reliable use of the same.

We really need to develop an app for Androids and IOS in a way that we can reach the average traveler that usually uses his Smartphone/tablet for his researches.

In order to do so, we need money to pay developers, get in touch with local societies, and sponsor Spassyou as best as we can, whatever the entities financing would be, just to have a friendly use of the website.

THE IMPACT

Since the portal is up, the team of Spassyou has been around a lot of tourist areas, looking for operators that could be interested to our project and the idea got a positive feedback.

The possibility to advertise activities in a showcase for local tourist and tourist from abroad, really caught the attention of the operators.

Spassyou wants to offer to operators and users the chance to organize their vacancies step by step, to be always updated on what’s happening around without losing sight of the social side, in order to share reviews and helpful advices.

We are absolutely sure that the use of the portal will stimulate the local tourism, discovering activities that without Spassyou, would still be in silence.

It would be a very important instrument for event organizers, because it permits to print the list of participants, in PDF document, breaking down the costs of cards, or paper marketing.

The assumption is excellent, and we’re only getting positive feedback from our ideas.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Spassyou was born completely for free and it will always be.

Monetize is important, but for us, the revival of tourism it’s more, and our idea is to do it in areas that have a lot to offer but don’t have the right instruments to advertise what they offer.

Our biggest challenge is to point out how important tourism is for a region and make the people happy to appreciate their activities through our portal. If they are operators or users, it doesn’t really matter.

EVERYBODY can sign in on Spassyou and give a contribution, even just commenting activities that you like the most.

HOW TO HELP US

A small financial contribution would help us finishing our project, which Is already two years old.

The creation of the portal can be helpful for everybody: for operators, in order to increase their visibility and for users to know better the places they live in.

We thank you so much.

For any information contact us at : staff@spassyou.com

story:
Short Summary

Balsam Hill is partnering with NVC Foundation this Christmas season to focus on providing sustainable livelihoods to disadvantaged communities, as well as child development through proper nutrition, holistic education, and a wholesome family life.  All donations up to $2,000 will be matched 100% by Balsam Hill, and and Balsam Hill will also match 10% on donations exceeding $2,000



The Impact

Negrense Volunteers for Change (NVC) Foundation, Inc. was established in August 2010 in Bacolod City, Philippines, to harness the power of private citizens to create positive and lasting change in their communities, towns and cities, and our country. We believe that by pooling the energies, resources, talents, and skills of individuals, we can bring about a better future for Filipinos.  

  • For every $10 donation, the donor will be entered into a raffle for a chance to receive a full Christmas Decorating Set from our catalog (a Balsam Hill Artificial Christmas tree, Ornament sets, tree topper and tree skirt), or a a gift card to Balsam Hill.  The donor can also have Balsam Hill donate $1,000 to the partnering charity of their choice instead of claiming the prize.

Your donation will go directly to the NVC foundation, with the funds raised helping to create a positive and lasting change in their community.  


Other Ways You Can Help

For more ways to support NVC Foundation- click here. 

Find This Campaign On

Facebook Website

story:
Hi!  My name is John Paul Butka, and I've been offered a chance  to work with a company that will allow me to gain valuable experience working  in a niche segment of property management as well as gain valuable life experience traveling across the country and meeting new people. Unfortunately, my recent time out of work has severely depleted my funds leaving bills piling up and little left to cover the costs of basically packing up my life in Birmingham and relocating. While I have been picking up odd jobs and selling items I won't need, things are still coming up a little short. 

What I'm asking for is a little help (which is something I've always been very poor at doing). Just a small contribution, donation, or whatever you'd like to call it--the price of a cup of coffee--would assist me  with paying some bills and covering some relocation expenses to get me started off on the right foot. I'm reaching out to my friends, family, acquaintances, friends of friends I only met that one time, anyone who has the misfortune of being connected to me on social media, and the odd person whose interest this might pique to reach down and make a tiny investment in my future. Even if you can't stand me, consider this your chance to hasten my removal from your sphere of influence :)

This is going to be a big change, but I'm ready to put in the work to do something that I hope will have a positive, lasting impact on my life.  Help  me make this next chapter a success. Thank you for your consideration and happy holidays!

story:
On the 25th April 2015 my husband's native village Bakhang in Sindhupalchok district of Nepal was reduced to rubble, as many other unfortunate villages by the 7,9 Richter scale hit of the earthquake. As if it would be not enough, 2weeks later, on 12th May, another 7,3- powered aftershock arrived once again. And as of today, the total amount of aftershocks has reached already above 200.  The road to Bakhang is still cut off by landslides, but some provision arrives through the helicopter and by walk of some NGOs' great volunteers. Quite luckily, only 1 person was demised due to the earthquake, though around dozen others injured. All the houses (around 40) were either totally destroyed or became completely unsafe to stay at. Our monastery-yet-to-be completed building (www.sungdrelling.org) survived without any damage. Clearly we will have to rebuild the whole village once again and acc.to newly adapted safe methods only. However most of villagers are unable to do it on their own due to their financial situation and general lack of basic education...

Me (Yelena Sherpa) and my husband (Ngawang Dorje Sherpa) have initiated collection of donations towards rebuilding of our village as soon as possible. At the moment we are also exploring the new methods for construction of simple economic village houses.If you do have any personal questions reg.this matter, please send me a message. Any size donation at this moment is appreciated!


Thank you all!

Yelena Sherpa

Village view after the first earthquake on 25th April

Destruction

Self-build temporarily shelters of the villagers

This house was a new property, just completed a month before the earthquake

Our parents surviving in the temporarily shelter as all of the villagers

View of the destructed village

Self-built temporarily shelters amidst the rubble and damages

Destructed village houses

Destructed village houses

story:
About the Jazz Gallery Center for the Arts

Our group, the Riverwest Artists Association (RAA), had the courage and opportunity to purchase this historic venue in 2008. This has given us a home for our work, and in return tremendous resources for the arts and creative energies of our community.

As the Milwaukee Jazz Gallery back in the 70s and 80s, the likes of Dizzy Gillespie, Chet Baker, and the Marsalis brothers were regularly featured. Our place was a renowned jazz club. We uphold that heritage and been awarded “Best Jazz Venue’ by Downbeat magazine for the last two years.

Our mission as a community arts center also finds us with lively hip-hop shows, weekly older adult programming, experimental music, and open jam sessions. Our boundless energies do not, however, cover the infrastructural needs our building presents. Built as a community hall for receptions and meetings in the 1950s, our center is in dire need of a roof, repairs, and a sound system. We’re launching this campaign to ask for your support.

The Future

The Riverwest Artists Association is now celebrating 40 years of supporting local artists.

With a solid roof over our heads and a quality sound system, we can continue to grow and serve our community. Emerging and returning artists will find new audiences and peers. We will make and celebrate our own ambient sounds--no longer with raindrops falling into buckets!

Other Ways to be Involved

Of course, we hope you'll donate at some level to our cause (even $1 helps!). There are additional ways to be involved with our arts center.

  • Follow us on Facebook @JazzGalleryCenterfortheArts
  • Visit our website, riverwestart.org.
  • Share this campaign with your community of family, friends, colleagues and creatives

We’re grateful to all who help and have come up with a variety of perks to say thank you.

If possible, we invite you to come by and enjoy the remarkable talents and creative surprises at the Jazz Gallery Center!

*Riverwest Artists Association is a 501c3, non-profit, all donations are tax-deductible.

story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE: September 12, 2016

As of today, the initial campaign is over (and fully funded!).  Hence, the prices for "God's Garden, God's City" have gone up.  You may still order it for delivery in November!  But please do so from our website, or we will have to go through an elaborate rigmarole to charge you an extra $10, which would be tiresome for everyone concerned. 


A Different Kind of VBS

Are you a Christian educator who can't find the kind of resources you want to use with your kids?  Are you hungry for something deeper?

New Earth, Whole Story LLC is a new resource for progressive, homegrown curriculum and materials for Christian formation.  This crowdfunder will make it possible to offer our first product, "God's Garden, God's City":  a Vacation Bible School curriculum that offers both fun and substance, and invites exploration and growth in faith.

Once "God's Garden, God's City" is launched, we plan to offer many more such resources.  If you have something you'd like to make available through us, please get in touch after you've backed our campaign!

How It Works

The funds we are raising will be used for the following purposes:  copyrights and permissions for existing music and commissions for new songs; web hosting and associated costs; creation and operation of the LLC; payment for our webmaster, graphic designer and illustrator; and marketing.  We have every expectation that the site we are building to sell the curriculum will be a long-term resource and clearinghouse for curriculum and materials for progressive Christian formation.  

A contribution of $50 gets you your own copy of the curriculum in plenty of time for the 2017 VBS season.  Check out our "perks" section for other cool stuff!

Christian Formation for a New Generation

Grace Pritchard Burson, the author of the curriculum, is an Episcopal priest, second-generation Christian educator, and writer/dramatist from New Hampshire.  She is joined by fellow clergy Melissa Kessler (webmaster, DOC) and Eliza Buchakjian-Tweedy (illustrator, UCC) in this ecumenical endeavor, as well as graphic designer Phoebe Titus (Quaker) and musician Bryan Moyer Suderman (Mennonite).  We hope to equip and empower Christian formation professionals, clergy, and volunteers to bring the faith story to children in developmentally appropriate ways that encourage wonder, exploration and joy.

More About "God's Garden, God's City"

We're creating the curriculum with the following goals in mind:

1.  To acquaint children ages 4-12 with the faith story in its entirety - from the Garden of Eden to the New Jerusalem, and with the whole story of God's never-failing love in between.

2.  To present them with the venerable symbols of the the earthly Jerusalem and the heavenly Zion, both represented with female imagery (needless to say, the curriculum focuses on the positive elements of this imagery in Scripture).

3.  To connect them with deep and powerful traditions of spirituality, both old and new, that draw from these two sources, and to encourage them to make these traditions their own and to go beyond them in creativity and questioning.

We are excited to offer this rich resource that invites your kids (and their adult teachers!) to explore and respond to the faith story and connect it to their own stories.

Can't Donate Right Now?

If you can't afford or can't use this resource right now, please help us out by sharing this campaign on your social networks!

If you have an idea (activity, game, song suggestion, advice, or other resource) that might make the curriculum stronger, feel free to share - and if your idea is used, we'll give you a copy of the whole thing for free!

And if you have your own homegrown curriculum or other resource you'd like to make available through New Earth, Whole Story, please get in touch!

More About "God's Garden, God's City"

We're creating the curriculum with the following goals in mind:
1.  To acquaint children ages 4-12 with the faith story in its entirety - from the Garden of Eden to the New Jerusalem, and with the whole story of God's never-failing love in between.
2.  To present them with the venerable symbols of the the earthly Jerusalem and the heavenly Zion, both represented with female imagery (needless to say, the curriculum focuses on the positive elements of this imagery in Scripture).
3.  To connect them with deep and powerful traditions of spirituality, both old and new, that draw from these two sources, and to encourage them to make these traditions their own and to go beyond them in creativity and questioning.
We are excited to offer this rich resource that invites your kids (and their adult teachers!) to explore and respond to the faith story and connect it to their own stories.


Can't Donate Right Now?

 If you can't afford or can't use this resource right now, please help us out by sharing this campaign on your social networks!
If you have an idea (activity, game, song suggestion, advice, or other resource) that might make the curriculum stronger, feel free to share - and if your idea is used, we'll give you a copy of the whole thing for free!And if you have your own homegrown curriculum or other resource you'd like to make available through New Earth, Whole Story, please get in touch!

story:
update: Friday 11/02/12: We wrote an article about E's campaign for the Huffington Post. Thank you again for your support.

update: Tuesday 10/30/12: Send your family or child's photo after you contribute and we'll add it to the gallery.

Our four year old son wants to help victims of Hurricane Sandy. 

On Tuesday, October 30th, we sat with our son and looked at pictures of the destruction caused by Hurricane Sandy. Without prompting, he said he wanted to help and would give the money from his piggy bank to people who lost their homes. We were very lucky, suffering no damage to our home.

We thought you and your children might want to help by giving the money from your piggy banks as well. 

The Goal

We're hoping to raise $1,000 in the next ten days to donate to the following charities. And we hope children across the country will join E in acts of charity to help other kids their age and members of their communities.

We're going to split the money between:

  • The American Red Cross
  • Feeding America
  • Humane Society Disaster Relief Fund

Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Give whatever you can. Lots of small contributions will add up to make a big impact!
  • Share on Facebook and Twitter
  • Send to other parents to get their kids and their communities
  • If you can't donate, consider volunteering here: https://lowereastside.recovers.org/

story:
About us

Every great city relies on a strong foundation; innovators, inventors and the creative class. We believe the arts strongly contribute to this vision and our plan is to expose, highlight and celebrate the few willing to make these great ideas a reality. As fellow contributors, our dream has always been to provide a type of space to allow future ideas to grow and flourish; just as others have inspired us. We are both Douglas Anderson alumni and have been a part of the local music and arts scene for the past 16 years, setting up and performing in countless live events, contributing to local charities and, in general, keeping the urban core vibrant. We intend to make this space riverside's living room. A meeting place to exchange ideas, to network and to learn from eachother. Invest in us and we'll invest in our city's future. 

In exchange for your contribution

We almost made it, but still need your help! Due to unforseen repairs to equipment, hefty city costs and dreams bigger than our budget, we have fallen slightly short of our vision. By investing in us you'll help us with the stage and audio equipment, an espresso machine and the tools to build a community bookshelf. In celebration of our opening we are offering a one time mug club deal, "The Chihuahuah" for six months, or "The Great Dane" for a year. After this fundraiser ends, there will be no more memebers. Take advantage of this offer before it ends and be a part of our future.

Your impact

A blank canvas is just a piece of material, let's do something with it. After art school and/or college, whether we chose to pursue our dreams or found that life just doesn't have the plan for us that we did, expression shouldn't die with time or hopelessness. It should be open to all those who have the passion and the need for it in our lives. By helping out, you can give them that opportunity. A true public gallery.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, please do so by sharing this to anyone who might be interested in helping our cause. Every "share" is appreciated and word of mouth is golden to us. We hope to see you all July 1st!!

story:
Fargo Makerworks - A Makerspace in Fargo, ND

A gym membership for makers, do'ers and innovators. That's what Fargo Makerworks is. I started researching technology like 3D printer, laser cutters, CNC machines, Arduino, etc. All of these things sounded very cool, but they're very expensive. (For example, the CNC router is $20,000.) Also, it wouldn't make sense to buy something that advanced if I would only be using it for an hour or two a day; it makes much more sense to have others able to access it as well.

For instance, look at this laser cutter in action!

I'll bet that you already have some great ideas in mind for what you could make with this! I looked in Fargo to see if anything existed that would allow access to all of these fascinating tools.

Nothing.

While I was searching, I asked quite a few people if they knew of anything in the area. While they said they didn't, nearly all of them mentioned that they wished that there was. I'd ask them what they wanted to make, and the answers were as varied as the people themselves:

  • Scan and print a 3D model of yourself
  • Unique jewelry designs
  • Engraved wedding gifts
  • Robotics projects
  • Model railroad buildings
  • Architectural models
  • 3D printed topographical maps
  • Unique tabletop gaming models
  • Product prototypes
  • and the list could go on and on...

In addition to all of the things people wanted to make, there were also many who wanted to learn new skills. There will be project-based classes that will incorporate the different pieces of equipment so that not only can you understand how it works, but you'll be able to understand why you might want to use it in the first place!

What if you have an idea for something to make, but you just don't have the time to spend in the shop yourself to be running the machines or turning your sketch into a 3D model? Don't worry, Makerworks will be providing a service to fill that need as well.

What will be in the shop?

There will be a variety of equipment, and this is not a comprehensive list, but just a list of the equipment that should be there on Day 1.

Epilog Laser 50w Laser cutter/engraver 24" x 18"

2 Ultimaker 3D printers

Vinyl Cutter 24" Width

Vacuum Former 12" x 17"

CAMaster Stinger III CNC Router 48" x 96"

Two workstation computers for doing design work

Soldering irons

Hot-air rework station

Electronics testing equipment

Various saws/sanders/grinders

Assorted hand tools, such as drills, Dremel tools, etc.

Lounge/classroom area with coffee, comfortable seating, and WiFi provided

So what's in a membership, anyway?

Standard - $99/month

  • Access to the shop and equipment anytime during normal hours
  • 10% discount on classes
  • 10% discount on merchandise
  • 12 machine hours/week combined on CNC machine or Laser Cutter/Engraver

Student - $59/month

  • Same benefits as Standard membership
  • Must show a valid student ID when starting membership

Daily - $29/month

  • One full day/month access to the shop and equipment anytime during normal hours
  • Additional days each month will be $19/day
  • 10% discount on classes

Hourly - $75 for 10 hours

  • Use the hours whenever you want! For example, two hours one month, three the next, and five hours ten months later!
  • Does not include discount on classes or merchandise

What We Need & What You Get

To make this happen, I need to make sure that I'll be able to keep the doors open for the first few months while the membership base becomes solid and consistent. If this project exceeds its goal, I'll be able to add more equipment more quickly and it will allow me the flexibility to purchase multiple of an item if the demand for it is limiting other members from using it.

  • $5,000 is the goal. This will help ensure the doors will be able to stay open until everything is settled in.
  • If the goal is not met, it will just take a longer to fully open up Makerworks to the public.
  • If the campaign blows past the goal, then I'll be turning to the backers and asking what other equipment they want to see in the space. Have something in mind already? Let me know in the comments or on the Facebook page!

The Perks

A great project should have great perks, so here's what you get for contributing!

$5 - Thank You and a Sticker:  Your name will go on the Contributers page of the website, forever immortalized and recognized for your Contribution. You also get this awesome sticker with the Makerworks logo! Slap it on your water bottle, your laptop, wherever!

$20 - Laser Engraved Coffee Mug: This is the Makerworks logo engraved onto a black coffee mug! You'll also get your name on the website and a sticker!

$29 - Daily Membership: This is the membership where you choose how much you want to use the shop! It includes one day of membership each month (any day you choose) and if you want to add more days, it will be $19/day. Also includes the sticker and your name in the contributors page on the website.

$35 - T-Shirt: Well, it's a T-Shirt with the Makerworks logo! The shirt is by American Apparel, so it's very soft and comfortable. You'll also get your name on the website and a sticker!

 

$50 - Mug/T-Shirt Combo: That's right, you get both, and save $5 in the process! PLUS you still get the sticker and your name on the website!

$59 - Student Membership - One Month: This is the real deal, a full month membership and access to the full makerspace! Only select this perk if you'll be able to provide proof of your current status. On top of the membership, you'll also get your name on the website and a sticker!

$75 - 10 Hours of Access: 10 hours to use whenever you want to use them. For example, use two hours one month and use the rest whenever you want! Also includes website thank-you and a sticker.

$99 - Standard Membership - One Month: This is the real deal, a full month membership and access to the full makerspace! On top of that, you'll also get your name on the website and a sticker!

$499 - Student Membership - One Year: Boy, whatta deal! 12 months of the student membership for the price of 10, and you'll still get your name on the website and a sticker too!

$999 - Standard Membership - One Year: Boy, whatta deal! 12 months of the standard membership for the price of 10, and you'll still get your name on the website and a sticker too!

$999 - The Benefactor: You love the idea, but don't see yourself using Makerworks for yourself. How about providing 2 scholarships for a 6-month student membership? If you back at this level, two college students will receive a 6-month membership for free! There will even be an application process for the students that you can be involved in if you want. Plain and simple. You'll also receive the laser engraved mug, the t-shirt,the sticker, and your name on the website!

Your Impact

One of the major benefits of Fargo Makerworks will be its community of members. Have you ever felt that you were the only person you'd met that was passionate about your hobby? There's more out there, I guarantee it. It's very likely that you'll end up meeting people who are into the same mindset of 'Making' that you are. Who know? Maybe you'll meet someone and combine your ideas into a new product! Perhaps a year from now it will be your IndieGoGo campaign that will be getting supported!

Other Ways You Can Help

So you think that this is a cool idea and you want to take part? That's awesome, I hope you can support it by selecting a perk! But if that's just not possible for you right now? Well you can still help in a few different ways:

  • Share this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and Google+
  • Like Makerworks' Facebook Page and share our posts that intererst you.
  • Keep us in mind if you know someone who could benefit from Makerworks on a project they're involved in.
  • Take a class once we're open! You'll learn something new and meet some new friends!

story:
Hello guys & girls!

We are Rebecca (Beccaboo) & Kimberley (Kimblebee) and together we make Beccaboo’s & Kimblebee’s!

We are sisters and together with our Mother (Mama Bear) we are hoping to open our own little store!

Beccaboo’s & Kimblebee’s is a florist, gift & home décor store. Let me tell you a little more…

Rebecca is a florist and Kimberley is a lover of all things creative and nifty. She has travelled around the world, picking up knowledge of business along the away, especially when she volunteered in a home décor and real estate office in Canada for a year. As she was doing this, she picked up a love of renovating furniture and upcycling items that are no longer loved. This brings us neatly to our next point.

We want to create a store that has everything you will need for gift giving under one roof. At present we are running the florist on Facebook and you can see our page here – www.facebook.com/beccaboosandkimblebees

At the moment we are offering flowers and have had recent success with Valentine’s Day and Mother’s Day and have decided to branch out a little further, delving into the world of homemade beauty products and also silver jewellery to our collection of gifts.

Our goal is to have a store that incorporates the following:

We want to offer a professional yet unique and quirky florist service to the local community, with everything to do with gift-giving also available under one roof. There will be homemade beauty products and silver jewellery that will be incorporated with our flowers for occasions such as new baby, weddings, mother’s day, Valentine’s Day, birthdays, anniversaries, etc. We also offer a range of funeral and bereavement flowers, and will be offering free delivery to the local Medway towns.

We would like our store to have a candy theme. For example, we have come up with the following promotions for various flower-giving events throughout the year:

*Mother’s Day Menu!

You have three courses – starter, main course and desert. The starter will be a Mother’s Day card of your choice, locally hand made by Kimberley’s “mother-in-law”. The main course will be a bouquet – either a box style bouquet, a gift bag style bouquet, or a hand-tied aqua-bubble style bouquet. The desert will be a choice of a selection of gifts, including jewellery, homemade beauty products, photo frames and albums, etc.

All of these will be for a set price – to be confirmed.

*The Birthday Banquet!

This will follow the same idea as the above – starter, main course and desert.

The reason that we want a candy-themed store is because we want to offer “retro” bouquets for events such as birthdays and anniversaries. For example, we want to offer very unique gift ideas that include a selection of “retro” candies with a matching bouquet of flowers. Just one of the examples that we have come up with is a cute displayed box of “fried egg” style sweets with a yellow and white bouquet to match the colour scheme. Everyone loves candy, right?

All of our flyers will be set out in a menu-style design and we also want to work with other businesses in the local community, for example restaurants and cafes, to add vouchers with our gifts and flowers. We are currently in discussions with a local restaurant to offer a money-off voucher when a customer spends over a certain amount so that they can eat in that restaurant. This is a great idea for birthdays, mother’s day and Valentine’s Day.

Moving along into the world of homemade beauty products and we are branching out to include New Mother style packages that will include a new baby bouquet of flowers (again you can see our Facebook page for an idea) and also pamper ideas such as homemade and organic bath products for the new mother to pamper herself. When a new baby is born, people tend to buy gifts for the baby and we want the mother to feel special too!! We want to branch out and have a small selection of locally created baby items too – we are working with another local business woman who has started her own business creating diaper/nappy cakes and similar items.

Moving on to the home decor side of things and every display in our store is going to be vintage, shabby chic style recycled/upcycled furniture. All of the furniture that we will use for our displays is going to be for sale. We want to try and be as economically friendly as possible and we are going to show customers how they can use their imagination to recreate beautiful items for their home for a fraction of the price. For example, we will be using spray-painted cans as vintage and shabby chic vases. Just one idea that we have tried and people seem to love!

We are also going to be selling frames and photo albums in our store and eventually, we are thinking of perhaps incorporating a photo-printing machine so that people can print out their photos to give as gifts alongside our flowers, jewellery, bath products, etc.

A lot of the flowers and foliage that we are going to be using in our bouquets, we will be growing ourselves to avoid the use of pesticides, etc. In short, we want to be as self sufficient and eco-friendly as we can be!

We appreciate that you have already read a lot of information, but we just want to tell you what your funding will be used for:

We have found two stores in the local town that we are considering using (one of) as our little store. The town currently doesn’t have a florist in the parade of shops. There is a convenience store, post office, bakery, clothing boutique and a number of other smaller stores, but no florist, gift, home decor or jewellery store. This parade of shops is in a local community and is also on a school run – the kids are bound to love the candies that we want to offer!

Your funding will go towards setting us up in the store – it will help to pay for rent, overheads and stock. We have been fairly successful so far and have been running our business, basically from home, for around 4-6 months. We appreciate that flowers tend to boom on certain days of the year - mother’s day, Valentine’s Day, etc. and that is why we are offering other items such as gifts, home decor, etc. We are also considering adorning our walls with art work from local artists to sell as well.

With your help, we will pay our first 4-5 months rent, bills, buy stock – flowers, jewellery, ingredients for the homemade beauty products, etc. We will be purchasing second hand furniture to renovate as well as tills, signs for our store, vinyls for our vehicles and other costs associated with starting up a business.

In short, you will be making a very big dream come true.

Although we appreciate that you can’t all donate, we would love it if you could spread the word! Any donations will be gratefully received and we keep our fingers crossed that you lovely guys & girls want to help us! Spread the word of our campaign here on IndieGoGo, or just give us a special shout out on our business Facebook page – www.facebook.com/beccaboosandkimblebees

Thank you so much for reading! We love you all!

Beccaboo & Kimblebee xoxo

Our goal is to have a store that incorporates the following:
We want to offer a professional yet unique and quirky florist service to the local community, with everything to do with gift-giving also available under one roof. There will be homemade beauty products and silver jewellery that will be incorporated with our flowers for occasions such as new baby, weddings, mother’s day, Valentine’s Day, birthdays, anniversaries, etc. We also offer a range of funeral and bereavement flowers, and will be offering free delivery to the local Medway towns.
We would like our store to have a candy theme. For example, we have come up with the following promotions for various flower-giving events throughout the year:
*Mother’s Day Menu!
You have three courses – starter, main course and desert. The starter will be a Mother’s Day card of your choice, locally hand made by Kimberley’s “mother-in-law”. The main course will be a bouquet – either a box style bouquet, a gift bag style bouquet, or a hand-tied aqua-bubble style bouquet. The desert will be a choice of a selection of gifts, including jewellery, homemade beauty products, photo frames and albums, etc.
All of these will be for a set price – to be confirmed.
*The Birthday Banquet!
This will follow the same idea as the above – starter, main course and desert.
The reason that we want a candy-themed store is because we want to offer “retro” bouquets for events such as birthdays and anniversaries. For example, we want to offer very unique gift ideas that include a selection of “retro” candies with a matching bouquet of flowers. Just one of the examples that we have come up with is a cute displayed box of “fried egg” style sweets with a yellow and white bouquet to match the colour scheme. Everyone loves candy, right?
All of our flyers will be set out in a menu-style design and we also want to work with other businesses in the local community, for example restaurants and cafes, to add vouchers with our gifts and flowers. We are currently in discussions with a local restaurant to offer a money-off voucher when a customer spends over a certain amount so that they can eat in that restaurant. This is a great idea for birthdays, mother’s day and Valentine’s Day.
Moving along into the world of homemade beauty products and we are branching out to include New Mother style packages that will include a new baby bouquet of flowers (again you can see our Facebook page for an idea) and also pamper ideas such as homemade and organic bath products for the new mother to pamper herself. When a new baby is born, people tend to buy gifts for the baby and we want the mother to feel special too!! We want to branch out and have a small selection of locally created baby items too – we are working with another local business woman who has started her own business creating diaper/nappy cakes and similar items.
Moving on to the home decor side of things and every display in our store is going to be vintage, shabby chic style recycled/upcycled furniture. All of the furniture that we will use for our displays is going to be for sale. We want to try and be as economically friendly as possible and we are going to show customers how they can use their imagination to recreate beautiful items for their home for a fraction of the price. For example, we will be using spray-painted cans as vintage and shabby chic vases. Just one idea that we have tried and people seem to love!
We are also going to be selling frames and photo albums in our store and eventually, we are thinking of perhaps incorporating a photo-printing machine so that people can print out their photos to give as gifts alongside our flowers, jewellery, bath products, etc.
A lot of the flowers and foliage that we are going to be using in our bouquets, we will be growing ourselves to avoid the use of pesticides, etc. In short, we want to be as self sufficient and eco-friendly as we can be!
We appreciate that you have already read a lot of information, but we just want to tell you what your funding will be used for:
We have found two stores in the local town that we are considering using (one of) as our little store. The town currently doesn’t have a florist in the parade of shops. There is a convenience store, post office, bakery, clothing boutique and a number of other smaller stores, but no florist, gift, home decor or jewellery store. This parade of shops is in a local community and is also on a school run – the kids are bound to love the candies that we want to offer!
Your funding will go towards setting us up in the store – it will help to pay for rent, overheads and stock. We have been fairly successful so far and have been running our business, basically from home, for around 4-6 months. We appreciate that flowers tend to boom on certain days of the year - mother’s day, Valentine’s Day, etc. and that is why we are offering other items such as gifts, home decor, etc. We are also considering adorning our walls with art work from local artists to sell as well.
With your help, we will pay our first 4-5 months rent, bills, buy stock – flowers, jewellery, ingredients for the homemade beauty products, etc. We will be purchasing second hand furniture to renovate as well as tills, signs for our store, vinyls for our vehicles and other costs associated with starting up a business.
In short, you will be making a very big dream come true. 
Although we appreciate that you can’t all donate, we would love it if you could spread the word! Any donations will be gratefully received and we keep our fingers crossed that you lovely guys & girls want to help us! Spread the word of our campaign here on IndieGoGo, or just give us a special shout out on our business Facebook page – www.facebook.com/beccaboosandkimblebees
Thank you so much for reading! We love you all!
Beccaboo & Kimblebee xoxo

story:
Short Summary

Our beautiful daughter, Elena Inez Sibley, was diagnosed with hypotonia just before turning one year old.  She was unable at that time to push herself up to sitting, bear weight in her legs, or crawl, even on her tummy.  She has also had difficulty with chewing and swallowing textured foods.  She is now 21 months old and has been in physical and occupational therapy for the past eight months, and will continue to need this support as she grows and develops her movement.  She also may need continued appointments with infant development specialists, neurologists and other specialists, as well as will require orthopedic support in order to learn how to walk.       

What We Need & What You Get

Our insurance has an enormous yearly deductible, plus thousands of dollars of additional out-of-pocket fees for services such as PT and OT, and orthotics are not covered even after all that has been met.  Because of this, we are currently trying to pay off 2012 hospital bills while incurring nearly another $10,000 in medical bills this year.  Although our options for medical insurance may be changing in the future with the arrival of Obamacare, our current expenses will not be retroactively covered, and at this time we are struggling to make even the minimal payments on our existing bills, or to have the resources necessary for the continued support that Elena needs.  

Elena will soon be fitted for AFO's, (ankle and foot braces), to support her ankles as she begins to gain strength and moves towards learning to walk. We would also like to be able to offer her occupational therapy in addition to the currently once a week physical therapy sessions that she receives.  Our campaign is intended to cover these above costs specificially, as well as any additional support that Elena may need throughout the year, such as appointments with an osteopathic or anthroposophical doctor, and any additional neurologic, genetic or metabolic testing that comes up and is not covered by our insurance.  

The Impact

When I have to explain why my toddler can't walk or eat normally for her age, most people say, "Hypotonia?  What is that?"  Hypotonia, or low muscle tone, seems to be more prevalent than it once may have been, as is the case with many dissabilities and challenges that children today are facing.  There is often no known cause for hypotonia, and if there is one to be discovered, there is a lengthy and difficult process of neurologic, metabolic and genetic testing to go through.  Physical and occuaptional therapies are the most effective and important ways in which to address hypotonia, whatever the cause or prognosis, and orthotic support can enable a child with hyptonoia to walk more safely and steadily once they are able.  By contributing to our campaign, you will be supporting Elena's development through funding the most effective support avaialble to her. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't financially support Elena's progress, please pass the word on about our campaign!  We are so grateful that she is making progress, and would like people to become aware of hypotonia and the therapies that can assist it, which can make an enormous difference in a child's life.

story:
The Cash Cannon Project

By Kwasmo Enterprises, LLC

The Cash Cannon was developed by Kwasmo Enterprises, LLC. It is an engineering design firm owned by a mechanical engineering graduate with over 10 years of work experience. He has developed products from concept to production for various companies the likes of  Snapper, Kroger, Dunkin Donuts, and Hyvee. He has experience in bringing high quality products to market.

The Cash Cannon project plans to bring an exciting and unique celebratory project to the mass market.  Use this product to distribute paper based items in a exciting but user controlled manner. Use the Cash Cannon to make it rain cash, promo items, cards or whatever you can fit in it. 

Kwasmo Enterprises and the inventor of The Cash Cannon are using their own personal resources to launch this project.  No loans or grants were used to get this project to this point. Kwasmo Enterprises handles the manufacturing and fine tuning of the device while High Energy Media handles the marketing and product promotion.  We need your contributions in order to cover the various manufacturing, legal, and business expenses that come with bringing a product to market. Most importantly, this project will help change the life of the inventor and give the public a useful product. 





What Your Contribution Does

The amount of funding needed to help make this project successful is $5,000. The majority of funds will go towards the manufacturing cost for the product.  Kwasmo Enterprises is working closely with an experienced manufacturer of similar toys to make sure a quality product is developed. 

For contributing to this campaign you will receive great special perks. By contributing $1 or more you will receive a progress report on our project and your name on The Cash Cannon website. 

By contributing $40 - $50  you will receive The Cash Cannon. Be one of the first to experience this unique and exciting product.  

The Cash Cannon is a simple and easy to use device. It can be loaded with US dollar bills or any item that is similar in structure. The final production models will be made of ABS plastic and engraved with the "Cash Cannon" logo on the right side. On the left side there will be indent to add your own personalized sticker or logo for your company.

The patent pending design and functionality is easily customized for the aesthetically. The first version will be as straightforward as possible in order to allow user feedback on best current and new features. The first colors offered will be the following:

          Pink                   Red                  Green                  Blue



Our Progress

We have been making new prototypes of The Cash Cannon for over a year now. Once the basics of the design and functionality were finalized a patent was filled to cover the innovations.

The first prototypes were made from bent and formed aluminum. The more recent prototypes were made from 3-D printing. The current prototypes were 3-D printed and painted by professional auto body specialist. 


Prototype Development



The final production design is available by rush order using the same process in our rewards section. Custom features in the mold plastic itself are allowed with this option.


Our Plan for Production

We have already completed injection molding tooling due to our confidence in the design of product. We are in the process of approving samples for all parts and the final assembly. Here is how our timeline looks:

August - Finalize pre-production design.This work will be completed by our manufacturer in China. They have clear details on how our product works and looks. We will approve the final version and move forward with pre-production.

September - Monitor pre-production. We will assist with any questions or manufacturing issues will arise. Finalize the amount of units needed to be produced for the first shipment. Approve the final production design.

October - Full production. We will make a site visit to our manufacturer in order to make sure this process goes smoothly. All final units will be fully approved before packaging for functionality and aesthetic quality. Our manufacturer if capable is producing up to 3,000 units per day and has a successful track record with similar items in the US. 

November - Delivery. The first shipment of units hit US soil, repackaged, and shipped to your door.


In Closing

The Cash Cannon is a great new toy with many potential uses for a wide variety of people. Our target audience is already ready to place orders and start using it at their venues. Be a part of the something special and enjoy the perks from being part of this project!

story:
"At the age of 40, I would apply for a volunteer trip to help people in Africa." - it is an aspiration that I wrote in one of my blog entries in 2009.

Now, at the age of 30, I am making that asipration come true earlier thanks to African Markets Internship Programs (AMIP) granted by The Tony Elumelu Foundation (TEF). As a successful candidate for Corhot II of AMIP 2013, I am very proud and thrilled to accept the internship offer to work for Nigeria Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in Abuja within 10 weeks between 5 July and 15 September. In the internship, I will carry out research in the areas of economics, law, and finance related to the capital market and the Nigerian economy, and also assit Nigerian SEC in analysing financial data for leading and lagging purpose.

Africa is always a region in my aspiration to discover facets of the continent and to help for driving its developments either in economy or in other sectors. The internship to Nigeria would open a new chapter in my life after my MBA graduation. However, I am facing TWO CHALLENGES that make me run this campaign to ask for your supports to achieve the goal of $3000 for the internship trip.

 

CHALLENGE 1: A ROUND-TRIP FLIGHT TICKET

Since the visa costs and round trip travel ticket to Nigeria are not covered while I cannot afford to pay for very costly travel expenses, this may turn down the AMIP opportunity. I am hoping to receive TEF's travel scholarship, but the chance is limited. So I want to try my best efforts to secure additional funding to enable me participate in this program.  

 

CHALLENGE 2: "... NOBODY IS GOING TO DEVELOP AFRICA, EXCEPT US."

(Tony Elumelu. The Tony Elumelu Foundation. Retrieved June 21, 2013 from: http://tonyelumelufoundation.org)

I take the above statement from Tony Elumelu, the founder of the AMIP program as a challenge because I want to prove that Africans are not alone on their path to develop a better Africa. Ones who also share the same vision about a positive and promising future for the continent would want to support his idea. I believe that you are the ones. Therefore, I plan to create a small charity event to help local people who are living in poor conditions in Abuja when I am there.

 

$3000 GOAL BREAKDOWN

Travel expenses                                        $1,500 (need to be funded by 05 Jul)

Charity event                                            $1,500 (need to be funded by 15 Aug)

 

ASKING MAKES ME VULNERABLE 


It's not easy to ask. Yes, it is not. I have a problem with asking. Asking makes me vulnerable. But I am doing this.  Through this campaign, I am asking for your helps to get me to Nigeria to fulfill my aspiration, and I truly hope to receive a lot of your sponsorships.

Also, I would like to show my deep appreciations to your contributions through Nigerian souvenir gifts respective to the amount of money you would want to donate. Please take my thank-you gifts in return for supporting me.

 

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Learn more about AMIP through the link: http://tonyelumelufoundation.org/page/amip-0 .

 

(Indiegogo fee: 4% if meet the goal, 9% if don't plus payment processing fees).

story:
Dear potential conrtibutor,

Harrow Cricket Club is a communtiy sports club located in Harrow, Middlesex, UK. The club runs a number of cricket teams, which range from colts to adults. During the summer we run a number of coaching camps for young cricketers to attend and develop their love for the game of cricket in conjunction wth weekly colts training and matches throughout the season. In addition to cricket, Harrow Cricket Club has a sports bar and facilities that can be hired by the local community for private functions, and table tennis and darts teams use the clubhouse throughout the year.

I have been playing for Harrow Cricket Club since the age of 16, benefitting from the support and coaching throughout the years as a player and am now a senior player at the club.

Over the years there have been a slow reduction in adults playing cricket and a number of senior players have departed. This reduction in cricketers appears to be a widespread problem across many of the senior cricket leagues. To prevent this continued loss of cricketers we are looking to our colt cricketers as the future of the club and are striving to improve our colts cricket setup. To try and improve the cricket club and reach out to the local community we will be implementing a partnership with a successful local cricket coaching acadmey, which will dramatically improve the coaching standard for the young colts to benefit from. A main aim of the coaching is to develop colts cricket and have a structured integration from colts cricket to senior cricket. By introducing more colts to senior cricket we can improve their game, which may lead to greater avenues in the world of cricket and further ensure the future of Harrow Cricket Club.

To make sure this partnership is successful and to ensure the future of Harrow Cricket Club, we need to raise funds to secure the services of top quality cricket coaches.

Building up to and during the cricket season I will be participating in a number of sporting events in an attempt to raise the necessary funds.

Those events are as follows:

Roding Valley Half Marathon (Sunday 9th March 2014)

Brighton 10K (Sunday 6th April 2014)

London to Brighton Bike Ride (Sunday 15th June 2014)

I began training for these events at the beginning of the year and will be pushing myself in all events, in particularly the 10K where I aiming to achieve a PB of less than 45mins.

Prior to the cricket season I will be orgainising a sponsored run around the cricket club grounds for all members to join in and raise money for the club or a chosen charity.

Any donation is greatly welcomed and appreciated.

Thanks for reading

Kind regards

Darren Crook

story:
Ulises I is an artistic project developed by the Mexican Space Collective  and consists in the creation and launching of an artificial nanosatellite that will broadcast sound pieces of Mexican artists during 4 months over the polar orbit.

This mission brings together the effort of Mexican citizens working together to reach space.

Ulises I also works to establish a better model of how citizens can use science, from a population re-appropriating technology for their own benefit, to the establishment of a plural work system and team-based success.

Now, Ulises I reaches its final stage, launching into space. And in this critical moment we need funds to support economically this mission .

The satellite will be delivered  to the Japanese Special Agency in August 20th, 2014. The launch is set for January of 2015, and the satellite will be released from the Japanese module of the International Space Station.

Ulises I es un proyecto artístico desarrollado por el Colectivo Espacial Mexicano. Consiste en la creación y lanzamiento de un nanosatélite artificial que transmitirá piezas sonoras de artistas mexicanos durante cuatro meses, alrededor de la órbita polar.

La misión es reunir el esfuerzo de ciudadanos mexicanos que trabajan hombro a hombro para alcanzar el espacio.

Ulises I establece un mejor modelo de trabajo, la manera en que los ciudadanos utilizan la ciencia, se apropian de la tecnología para su beneficio y el establecimiento de un sistema plural de trabajo basado en el trabajo en equipo.

Ahora, Ulises I alcanza su etapa final, lanzamiento al espacio. En este momento crítico requerimos fondos para financiar la misión.

El satélite será entregado a la Agencia Espacial Japonesa el 20 de agosto de 2014. El lanzamiento está programado para enero de 2015, y el satélite será liberado del módulo japonés de la Estación Espacial Internacional.


What do we need to make it possible?

¿Qué necesitamos para hacerlo posible?

Have you ever thought about all the complications of sending something into space? We are going thru it, Ulises I is going to be tested. Physical testing, vibration, etc.

Obviously none of it is for free, so we have to fund the final testing and get ready for the launching. Let's make it happen! Any help will make the difference, we've been on this way since 2010 and nothing will stop us.

We will make the world listen.

¿Alguna vez has pensado en las complicaciones de enviar algo al espacio? Nosotros estamos en ello, Ulises I tendrá que aprobar una serie de pruebas. Físicas, vibración, etc.

Nada de esto es gratis, y ahora tenemos que financiar la etapa final y prepararnos para el lanzamiento. ¡Ayúdanos a que suceda! Toda ayuda puede hacer la diferencia, hemos estado en este camino desde 2010 y nada nos detendrá.

Hagamos que el mundo nos escuche.

And what for...

Todo el esfuerzo para...

So, how Ulises I will change the world?

  • This is the 1st artistic space project made by artists, engineers and scientists, wait, this is the 1st artistic satellite EVER!!!!
  • If we can reach space, we can say, for sure that we can reach anything we want to. It is a great message for everyone.

  • Ulises I also works to establish a better model of how citizens can use science, from a population re-appropriating technology for their own benefit to the establishment of a plural work system and team-based success.

¿Cómo puede Ulises I transformar al mundo?

  • Es el 1er proyecto espacial artístico realizado por artistas, ingenieros y científicos, espera, es el 1er proyecto artístico satelital!!!!
  • Si podemos alcanzar el espacio, podemos estar seguros de que podremos alcanzar todo lo que deseamos. Es un mensaje claro para todos.

  • Establece un modelo de cómo los ciudadanos pueden utilizar la ciencia, apropiarse de la tecnología para su beneficio y establecer un exitoso sistema plural de trabajo basado en el trabajo en equipo.


Ulises I is a professional project, with professional people. Look at this!

Ulises I es un proyecto profesional, creado por profesionales. ¡Mira esto! 

http://www.ulises1.mx/Ulises_1/Historia.html

http://www.ulises1.mx/Ulises_1/Ulises_I.html

https://vimeo.com/93451426

http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulises_I

http://www.excelsior.com.mx/nacional/2014/02/10/943102

http://www.lajornadadeoriente.com.mx/2014/02/12/ulises-1-un-satelite-mexicano-que-resulto-del-dialogo-entre-el-arte-y-la-ciencia/

http://www.invdes.com.mx/tecnologia-mobil/4079-presenta-centro-conacyt-el-nanosatelite-ulises-1

http://www.mediatelecom.com.mx/index.php/tecnologia/hardware/item/59474-ulises-i-un-nanosatelite-mexicano-que-trasmitira-musica-desde-el-espacio

https://www.facebook.com/ulisessatelite?fref=ts


    Credits Méxican Space Collective/Créditos Colectivo Espacial Mexicano

    Mission Director: Juan José Díaz Infante

    Artistas con obra sonora: Arturo Márquez, Ramsés Luna, Omar Gasca, Grupo Cabezas de Cera, Hugo Solís

    Otras piezas de arte: Luisa Lichi, Edgar Cano, Teresa Bordona, Fernando Castro, Emilia Bellón, Samuel Lozada, Alma Vargas. 

    Diseño póster: José Manuel Morelos.

    Dirección técnica: Dr. Celso Gutiérrez, 

    INAOE-CRECTEALC: Adolfo Morales Díaz, Alfredo Torres Fórtiz, Celso Gutiérrez Martínez, Jacobo Meza Pérez.

    Centro Multimedia, CENART: Julio Zaldívar y Juan Galindo

    Alumnos IPN: José López Cervantes, Miguel Ángel Islas Mora, Profesor Luis Manuel Rodriguez Mendez.

    Asesoría en pequeños satélites: Gerard Auvray

    Documentación y contenidos: Érika Carrillo

    Production: Esperanza Jaime

    Web Festival Play!: Sergio Jamaica

    Video Indiegogo: Working Title (http://workingtitle.mx/)

    Sponsors/Patrocinadores 2011-2014: Fonoteca Nacional, PLAY! Festival proyecto residencias, EPSON, Fundación BBVA, INAOE, IQH, Sunflower, Centro Multimedia CENART, Estudio Jamaica, Secretaría de Relaciones Exteriores, Laboratorio Arte Alameda, Centro de Cultura Digital, Conaculta.

    Special thanks/Agradecimientos especiales: Álvaro Hegewisch, Sergio Autrey, Alonso Carral, Gerard Auvray, Dava Newman, Guillermo Trotti, Mauricio Doce, Rafael Tovar y de Teresa, Grace Quintanilla, Valente Souza, Cuauhtémoc Sentíes, Alejandra de la Puente, Edward Finn, Nahum Mantra, Adriana Casas, Tania Aedo, Roger Malina, Rob las Fresnais, Nicola Triscott, Andrés Burbano, Felipe Londoño, Daragh Byrne.
story_txt:
Ulises I is an artistic project developed by the Mexican Space
Collective  and consists in the creation
and launching of an artificial nanosatellite that will broadcast sound
pieces of Mexican artists during 4 months over the polar orbit.This mission brings together the effort of Mexican citizens working
together to reach space.Ulises I also works to establish a better model of how citizens
can use science, from a population re-appropriating technology for their own
benefit, to the establishment of a plural work system and team-based success.Now, Ulises
I reaches its final stage, launching into space. And in
this critical moment we need funds to support economically this mission .The satellite will be delivered 
to the Japanese Special Agency in August 20th, 2014. The launch is set for January of 2015, and the satellite will be
released from the Japanese module of the International Space Station.Ulises I es un proyecto artístico desarrollado por el Colectivo Espacial Mexicano. Consiste en la creación y lanzamiento de un nanosatélite artificial que transmitirá piezas sonoras de artistas mexicanos durante cuatro meses, alrededor de la órbita polar.La misión es reunir el esfuerzo de ciudadanos mexicanos que trabajan hombro a hombro para alcanzar el espacio.Ulises I establece un mejor modelo de trabajo, la manera en que los ciudadanos utilizan la ciencia, se apropian de la tecnología para su beneficio y el establecimiento de un sistema plural de trabajo basado en el trabajo en equipo.Ahora, Ulises I alcanza su etapa final, lanzamiento al espacio. En este momento crítico requerimos fondos para financiar la misión.El satélite será entregado a la Agencia Espacial Japonesa el 20 de agosto de 2014. story: The Fort Kent Train Station, built in 1902 was deeded to the Fort Kent Historical Society by the Bangor and Aroostook Railroad and the FKHS has preserved it as an important historical site in Fort Kent.  The freight building associated with the Train Station has been acquired at well below market value through a small loan and we are raising funds to repay that obligation so that all may enjoy this new addition and the museum that it will allow us to showcase!
story_txt: The Fort Kent Train Station, built in 1902 was deeded to the Fort Kent Historical Society by the Bangor and Aroostook Railroad and the FKHS has preserved it as an important historical site in Fort Kent.  The freight building associated with the Train Station has been acquired at well below market value through a small loan and we are raising funds to repay that obligation so that all may enjoy this new addition and the museum that it will allow us to showcase!

story:
Who we are

The premier team of Las Vegas, Team Kaizen, is composed of experienced hospitality hosts, nightlife promoters, and entrepreneurs. Unified under one goal, Team Kaizen stands out from the rest by creating a personalized experience for each and every one of our guests, satisfied only when our guests have made the most out of their stay in Las Vegas. 

Our finely-cultivated network offers each of our guests the distinguished feeling of being well-connected, in VIP status, at the top venues and properties in Las Vegas. Kaizen creates lifelong memories.

 



The Current Referral System

Updated versus outdated software and technology makes a huge difference in the outcome of the success of a business in our present day. Growth in a business is a mark of success, but without the proper platforms, it could also be a point of failure. 

Recent growth in business expansion is showing us how outdated our referral systems currently are. We are becoming in dire need of updated software and the technology to manage our overwhelming inflow of people who show interest in becoming a Vegas promotor or host. 

How many potential clients and possible business partners are we losing due to our current referral system? 

Once our system is fully-updated, we will be able to expand our job market and client-base incrementally, creating jobs and lifelong memories at the same time. 


The Ideal Software

Our ideal software includes increased access to quotes, reservations, and other services. We would like to build a software that will allow users to request quotes for hotels, nightclubs table services, transportation, cruises, and other activities. Ideally, users will be able to make reservations, payments, and receive confirmations through our online site. 

Tracking will be a very important element of our ideal software, as we aim to eliminate all inefficient correspondences between clients, users, agents, and administrators, as in the current referral system. 

The Goal

Ten thousand dollars is our estimated project need for funding support in order to accomplish this goal. We have detailed information on the breakdown of the funds, including: software development, administrative support, licenses, and fees.


Become a Team Kaizen Agent

Are you one of the few that know people that travel a lot and wished that you can make an extra income from it? Contribute $75 to receive a 2 year or $150  for a Lifetime Subscription to help us create this software. You won't even have to wait until the software is done to start making commissions. You can start referring business as soon as you'd like. Utilize our knowledge and experience to help build your own promotions business. Realistic return on your investment within 5-8 reservations. And once this software is up and running, it will help close leads faster, manage your customers and tracks sales. This is your chance to get in on the ground floor. 


Other Team Kaizen Perks!

As a valued contributor, you will receive some great perks as described in this campaign. Aside from social media shoutout, your name will also on our new website credits. Our company's growth will be because of your support, any services we can give for your future trips will be offered to you at discounted rates.

Social Media Boosts and Thank you!

We have a built a very strong following within our social media channels. Our boosts can help you promote your events, pages, products, services, etc.

TK Swag

Black Team Kaizen T-Shirts

Sizes range from Ladies Small to XL

Mens Medium to XXL

Estimated Delivery June 1, 2014



Can't contribute but still want to help? 

  • Share the campaign url http://team-vegas.org
  • Tweet your support on Twitter, post your support on Facebook, use Instagram
  • Follow @shellaq on Twitter and @shellavegashost on Instagram for updates

story:
We are Bob & Connie Batesole

We moved to Redding from Silicon Valley and the San Francisco Bay Area. Since moving here we have fallen in love the Redding, both the land and its people.

After recently joining the Redding Area Designers and Developers Meetup group, we discovered that there was no CoWorking space dedicated to developing new businesses, i.e. startups. 

The Vision & The Why

Of course, many other cities in California have CoWorking spaces for technical and business people to work in, collaborate, and ultimately birth and nurture new startups.

Redding, population 90,000+, is the largest city north of Sacramento, located in rural Shasta County.   The county is mostly mountainous, therefore somewhat isolated.

We feel strongly this needs to be corrected as soon as possible to stimulate the lackluster economy in Redding, which has an unemployment rate significantly higher than the national average. 

There is a growing pool of technical professionals in Redding, and a solid business development culture.

The funding you provide will directly impact the development of Redding CoWorking, a startup itself.

The WiFi is in place and we still need a printer, projector and screen, and more tables and chairs, and a "sound-proof" booth, where people can openly discuss their ideas and plans without fear of being overheard.

Redding CoWorking has no employees and none are planned for the foreseeable future. The Co-Founders, Bob and Connie, are responsible for its operation.

With your financial contribution, we have some perks for you.  All will receive recognition on our website, some for up to a year.  Depending on the amount given, you will also receive free WiFi at our Redding location and/or a T-shirt with our logo.  See details in the right sidebar.

story:
I'm Rachael Maddox, mischief-maker, life coach, artist and adventurer from Washington, DC.

 

This campaign is all about bringing MAGIC to the masses and PLAY to the people, one Traveling Soul Circus Experience at a time.

 

The Traveling Soul Circus is a mash-up of soul-deep healing work and physically playful circus arts. Through immersive street retreats, soul coaching, and play parties, the Traveling Soul Circus invites you into new and exciting experiences that expand your sense of trust, expression, embodiment and JOY.

 

Street Retreats are tailor-made intimate group-experiences that invite adults of all abilities to step into their bodies and PLAY with endless permission. From stiltwalking to basic partner acrobatics, hula hooping to strumming the ukulele, and of course costumes and photo shoots galore, the Street Retreat is a safe environment for you to challenge and delight your playful spirit. Mysticism and magic are infused throughout the day. Feel free to be in touch about tailoring a Street Retreat to your personal desires and interests! rachmddx@gmail.com Rachael will be in Washington DC for the month of September, and further west after that.

 

Play Parties are excitement and magic fused with mystical depth. I unload costumes, fortune scrolls, and all the toys in the back of my truck: hoops, ukes, silly hats and more. A few group games help set the party's mood, then the energy of the group flows from there. I stay all night, offering postiive-intuitive animal card readings to anyone who wants them. Feel free to be in touch about bringing a Play Party to your community. rachmddx@gmail.com

For people in the DC area, check out the Facebook event for the inaugural Street Retreat happening on Saturday July 27th!

 

Soul Coaching is an intimate one-on-one experience that invites people to move through old blockages and embrace their most honest, authentic, alive selves. Many clients come to me [secretly] knowing that it's time for any of the following to manifest: a new job or career path, a deepened understanding and expression of their sexuality, creativity, or spirituality, a renaissance of joy, a feeling of freedom, or a trust that they can love themselves, just as is. Feel free to contact me at rachmddx@gmail.com to feel out a Soul Coaching session.

 

Our age is aching for more physical play and expression, and our souls are seeking connection to the material world of JOY. Through even the most BEGINNER LEVEL circus arts and play, we're able to transform and shift, cleanse and release, without even knowing it in our minds. 

 

The cash raised through this campaign will go straight toward the Magic Soul Bus: a pick up truck-trailer combo, chock-full of acro mats, stilts, hoops, ukes and costumes... the fairy dust to manifest the magic. The bus is planning to hit the road beginning of October 2013, for an autumn take-off into the wonders of North America!

 

I've lived in DC for my entire life. I know how much we need to reconnect with joy to free our souls. And I know that with just a little toe-dip into the waters of play, we OPEN... and once we open, we cannot re-conceal our most vital alive selves. That's what this is all about: whirling through your world with a bit of magic, reminding you of your own.

 

What qualifies me for this magic mobile adventure job? Here a few biggies...

  • 6 weeks of intensive circus arts training with WiseFool New Mexico... I can safely guide you through beginner circus moves
  • A year-long life coaching training with the Coaches Training Institute, and 3 years professionally coaching... I can lovingly support you to take safe and enlivening risks for the sake of waking your deepest joy
  • 8 months riding a bicycle around the USA... I can live life on the road, leaving little gifts of love and luck wherever I land, while also navigating self-care, self-sufficiency and stewardship with the earth & local communities
  • A year as the creator and director of the Small is Beautiful Arts Collective... I can host gatherings that feel inclusive, soulful, inspiring, and safe... and do ambiance like no one's business
  • Endless mentorship from sage elders who echo over and over again, NOW NOW NOW. Smarty-pants guidance over the years from the likes of Jen Lemen, Sabrina Ward Harrison, Danielle LaPorte, Corinna Robbins, Kate Swaboda, Maya Story, Pamela Knight Mattsson, Julie Daley and more... gives me confidence that I can TRUST my path as wise, wonderful and truly for me
  • A never-ending love for rebels, artists, mischief-makers, risk-takers, playmates, scared-but-longing-souls, and the child that's laying dormant within you

 

I am so honored and excited to be offering this kind of work in the world and deeply appreciate your time reading, and your consideration in contributing in a way that's good for you, me, and our collective joy! Yes! Yes, yes yes!

 

Head over to rachaelmaddox.com for more magical information, including testimonies, photos and stories!
Or have no hestitation contacting me at rachmddx@gmail.com for a personal conversation about how the Traveling Soul Circus can brighten your world!
