Our age is aching for more physical play and expression, and our souls are seeking connection to the material world of JOY. Through even the most BEGINNER LEVEL circus arts and play, we're able to transform and shift, cleanse and release, without even knowing it in our minds. 
 
The cash raised through this campaign will go straight toward the Magic Soul Bus: a pick up truck-trailer combo, chock-full of acro mats, stilts, hoops, ukes and costumes... the fairy dust to manifest the magic. The bus is planning to hit the road beginning of October 2013, for an autumn take-off into the wonders of North America!
 
I've lived in DC for my entire life. I know how much we need to reconnect with joy to free our souls. And I know that with just a little toe-dip into the waters of play, we OPEN... and once we open, we cannot re-conceal our most vital alive selves. That's what this is all about: whirling through your world with a bit of magic, reminding you of your own.
 
What qualifies me for this magic mobile adventure job? Here a few biggies...

6 weeks of intensive circus arts training with WiseFool New Mexico... I can safely guide you through beginner circus moves
A year-long life coaching training with the Coaches Training Institute, and 3 years professionally coaching... I can lovingly support you to take safe and enlivening risks for the sake of waking your deepest joy
8 months riding a bicycle around the USA... I can live life on the road, leaving little gifts of love and luck wherever I land, while also navigating self-care, self-sufficiency and stewardship with the earth & local communities
A year as the creator and director of the Small is Beautiful Arts Collective... I can host gatherings that feel inclusive, soulful, inspiring, and safe... and do ambiance like no one's business
Endless mentorship from sage elders who echo over and over again, NOW NOW NOW. Smarty-pants guidance over the years from the likes of Jen Lemen, Sabrina Ward Harrison, Danielle LaPorte, Corinna Robbins, Kate Swaboda, Maya Story, Pamela Knight Mattsson, Julie Daley and more... gives me confidence that I can TRUST my path as wise, wonderful and truly for me
A never-ending love for rebels, artists, mischief-makers, risk-takers, playmates, scared-but-longing-souls, and the child that's laying dormant within you
 
I am so honored and excited to be offering this kind of work in the world and deeply appreciate your time reading, and your consideration in contributing in a way that's good for you, me, and our collective joy! Yes! Yes, yes yes!
 
Head over to rachaelmaddox.com for more magical information, including testimonies, photos and stories! Or have no hestitation contacting me at rachmddx@gmail.com for a personal conversation about how the Traveling Soul Circus can brighten your world!

story:
The Elevator Pitch

If you've only got a minute to read our post, this is the section for you. SaferGrounds is a hosted mobile and web application that gives members of an educational community the ability to request safety assistance from security officials via their smartphones. This idea is meant to modernize the current security posts found scattered around institution's campuses by providing a theoretically infinite (though the institution limits it to a certain radius) range of coverage instead of only having the smaller area of the post. Crime is a growing issue in the United States and around the world, and by utilizing these devices that 55% of college students have we will be able to help make campuses a little safer. The money that we're requesting will cover the paperwork, legal fees, marketing costs, development hours, space costs, bandwidth and server costs as well as the many other costs associated with launching a product of the quality we want to launch.

 

 

Introduction

Hello Indiegogo. We are a small, independent web development and design team named LuminoCityGroup. Since LuminoCityGroup started, our primary goal has always been to work in the education industry providing software that will enhance the experience of students, faculty and staff at these institutions.

SaferGrounds addresses one of the primary concerns that we see in the education industry today: safety. In the US, college campuses in particular have fallen prey to various crimes and these institutions are continuously struggling with how to resolve this issue. In the past, most institutions have placed "emergency posts" around their campuses in order to allow students to call for security by pressing a button. While these posts are beneficial, the inherent flaw becomes obvious when a crime happens and one is not within reach of the student. In most cases, this means the student will unfortunately be left to fend for themselves.

This issue does not have to exist. With the quickly advancing devices that are in 55% of the average college student's pocket, SaferGrounds believes that we can resolve this issue. 

While there are products out there that do things similar to what we aspire to do, they tend to either cost a large amount of money to the students or the institutions that utilize them. We want to provide a cheap, hosted, powerful and integrated alternative that will work with these various institutions' existing infrastructures to provide the members of their communities with a new sense of safety. 



Where We Are Now & What We Plan To Do

We have already made a significant amount of progress towards creating our application, and we have basic mobile apps for both both iOS and Android devices; But we want to enhance these applications. In their current iterations, the users log in one time using their institution's chosen login method and then any time after they login that they launch the app they are presented with a single, practically full screen button that they would press to trigger the alert process. This would then fire off a notification to the security staff at the campus via (currently) a web interface that shows their realtime position on a map. The security dispatcher can then send an official to their location as soon as possible to resolve any issues that may be occurring. 

 

Where We Want To Go 

But that isn't where our ideas stop. We are also looking into many other additions to our current development plan, including features such as allowing SMS reports from students that will also populate the system, phone calls to notify security officials alongside the web interface and the ability for institutions to send out push notifications (via both SMS and the application) if the need arises. We also recognize that there are often visitors to these campuses who may also want to have the application. SaferGrounds would like to take this into account by offering users of the app who are from another institution “guest” access to the institution's security network. This means that if the user's institution had SaferGrounds and they were visiting another SaferGrounds campus, they would be able to send notifications to that campus instead of the campus they are originally from. One of the features we are most excited to offer is a collection of API endpoints that we will allow institutions to implement into their existing mobile applications so that their users do not need to download and maintain two separate apps. However, Institutions that do not want to implement our service into their existing apps can just instruct their users to download our separate application which will be conveniently available in the various app stores. 

 

But...

Unfortunately, we do not have the funds necessary to release our product.  And that's why we've turned to you. There is a lot of paperwork, legal fees, marketing costs, development hours, space costs, bandwidth and server costs and many other costs associated with getting this product reliably out the door and in the hands of the institutions. The goal we've requested covers these costs and will allow us to operate while we work on attracting more attention to our product.

 

We Need Your Help!

LuminoCityGroup, and the SaferGrounds project, are set on making sure that this product isn't all about making money - we want to better the world of education. Our price for the product once we release clearly reflects this idea. Instead of looking for outside investors who would alter that goal, we're turning to Indiegogo for assistance in securing the funds required to cover the charges we're encountering that are blocking us from continuing with our project. We've already invested some of our own money trying to get it started, but it wasn't enough for all of the costs associated with releasing a product of the caliber we desire.  

We realize that our business model doesn't have many perks that we can directly hand to you since it's a software meant for institutions. We've tried to come up with some interesting perks that we think you'll enjoy anyway. 

 

When We'd Like to Launch

Ideally, we'd like to launch the SaferGrounds beta this fall and the final product in the Spring of next year. This will allow for enough time for us to work out any bugs and also give various institutions time to consider us before their fall semesters start by using the summer as their testing time. If we get more funding than our goal, we'll be able to bring additional talented staff onto our team and complete the project more quickly.

 

 

We hope you'll share in our desire for safer campuses around the world. We hope you'll spread the word and consider helping our product be released. If you have any questions (or perk ideas!), please don't hesitate to ask. We'll respond as quickly as we can. Thank you for taking the time to read about our project.

story:
help hotpot! raise $650 to support API Queer and Trans Activists in need of ADA accessible housing at the Philadelphia Trans Health Conference. 

 

Friends and Allies,  

hotpot! values diversity, sustainability, and listening to all voices in our community. Every year, we are thrilled to actively participate in the Philadelphia Trans Health Conference. 

This year Van will speak on the API trans/GNC Voices panel on Sat. June 15 with 5 other people. The fabulous Kay (www.kaybarrett.net) will moderate and stellar Emi Koyama (of eminism.org)  will speak. They are traveling from New York City and Portland, Oregon. Let's welcome them to Philly with love. 

Show your hospitality by offsetting their cost of ADA accessible housing (which is otherwise cost prohibitive but absolutely necessary). Your donation will go directly to lodging for disabled/crip tpoc apia panelist/moderators and their care support (which include their service animal companions & care partners). We believe that it is our communal responsibility to raise these funds, join us.

Every donation counts from $200 to $5.  

Will you support our efforts and donate?

Peace,
Alison, Laurent and the hotpot! steering committee

story:
Our Story

Nogfest is an annual eggnog drinking contest held to raise money for The Tomorrow Fund, a local charity based in Providence, RI that financially and emotionally supports children with cancer and their families (http://)

 

The Impact

The Tomorrow Fund is the only non-profit organization that provides daily financial and emotional support to children with cancer and their families who are treated at Hasbro Children's Hospital in Providence, Rhode Island.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The cost of running Nogfest takes a bare minimum of $1000. This includes the purchase of egg nog, merchandise, & insurance policies. With any donations to contributing to Nogfest, we will be able to increase all proceeds benefitting the Tomorrow Fund. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Attend Nogfest and paste this link everywhere!

story:
El Lagartillo's Story

El Lagartillo is a small, rural community in Nicaragua that was attacked by the Contra army in the mid-1980s. This resilient community has devoted the past several decades to rebuilding their revered land and transforming it into a stable living and working environment. Their newest dream is to purchase a plot of land a short walk from the community center that can be reforested and remodeled in ways that will generate new sources of income for the community members.  A foreign investor recently expressed interest in buying this same land and converting it into a private home, threatening El Lagartillo’s vision for self-sufficiency.

In total, this land costs $15,000. The community of El Lagartillo has pooled its resources and raised a third of the cost on its own ($5,000). Now, for the remaining $10,000, they seek the help from friends, previous visitors, and others who are inspired by their story to secure this land and create the promise for a prosperous future. 


About Hijos del Maiz 

All donations will go directly to Hijos del Maiz, an independent community-run organization and Spanish school that was formed in El Lagartillo in the early 2000s to offer jobs in the community and encourage cultural exchange. Hijos del Maiz has since ran many successful projects; from hosting and teaching hundreds of language students to securing solar panels for community members to helping arrange scholarships for local students to purchasing a pick-up truck to provide transportation of people and goods to nearby communities. The organization, which is comprised completely of locals and their families, includes Spanish teachers, a full-time staff and many other community members who regularly host foreign students and participate in community projects.



A Sustainable Future

Hijos del Maiz has long-dreamed of buying this pristine land adjacent to their community, which includes many acres of deforested land and a secluded waterfall. After buying the land (with your help!!), Hijos del Maiz plans to include the community in reforesting this land, restoring the ecological diversity it once hosted, using permaculture techniques to provide food for the community, and building ecolodges for visitors to enjoy the incredible scenary and waterfall.

Visitors from all over the world have been awed and inspired by this resilient community, which has overcome diversity and found innovative ways to build a sustainable way of life.

El Lagartillo welcomes all to help them in their quest to build their future! Stay tuned for updates as the campaign progresses. 

___________________________________________________________________________

A Glance at El Lagartillo

story:
Short Summary

Gambling is causing more and more problems in the UK.  The number of people who have a gambling problem or are deemed "at risk" of developing one is 1.3 million people. Only around one percent of these people get face to face help. We plan to change that, utilising the power of volunteers, mainly from local churches.  We have a big vision - to help 20,000 gamblers by 2020, so to deliver on this we need a network of Friends - we need you!

The model 

The essence of the model is that the gambler abstains from gambling for 4 weeks whilst they work through self help materials, usually with the help of a befriender from a local church, or a friend of their choice. 

At Better Futures we would match up someone to befriend the gambler, and help them to work through the self help materials:

The self help materials are being developed with the advice of postgraduate psychologists. They have a credible evidence base both in addiction and in wider health settings, based around: 

  • Cognitive Behavioural Therapy
  • Motivational Enhancement Therapy
  • Node Link Mapping
  • Guided Self Help
  • Befriending

We have arranged a pilot in Salisbury during autumn 2015, using volunteers from Salisbury Vineyard Church; the intention is then to quickly roll this out across the UK in early 2016 (or earlier if we can).

Why we need your help

Fundraising options are limited, for a hidden addiction which many see as self inflicted. Additionally, Better Futures would not accept money from the gambling industry, including Lottery funding.  There is an initial target of £3,300 to start up the project, which will be used to attract clients through advertising and a website, for regulatory compliance, and to establish a database and associated processes, as well as make an initial order of "The Chip That Can't Be Spent". In reality at least £10,000 would enable the project to scale up quickly across the UK.

Better Futures for Gamblers is a social enterprise. The structure is a Community Interest Company (C.I.C.) limited by guarantee. It has an "asset lock" and profits are reinvested back into helping gamblers. 

Find out more

Space is limited here, so do visit the website www.betterfutures.uk for further information on our plans. And if you have any questions then do ask us!

If you just can't contribute money, that doesn't mean you can't help! Please do share on  social media such as Twitter and Facebook, and help us get the word out to establish our network of Friends! 

Also if you have a skill that you think we could use, do let us know!

story:
I am Max Katzen, Godol of Rebels AZA #442. I have been to numerous regional conventions, 3 International Conventions and summer programs such as Chapter Leadership Training Conference and International Leadership Training Conference. I have been a Rebel since I was in 8th grade and loved every minute of it.

442 for AZA is Rebels AZA #442 campaign for next year. Our 74th year as a chapter. We do so much as a chapter and want to do so much more. 

Charging a couple extra dollars to have money for supplies for the next event is just not enough. Not if we want to send teens to summer programs, regional conventions and purchase t-shirts. There is so many more things that we want to do, but we need your support. 

Rebels AZA #442 is asking you to give $442, $44.20 or $4.42 in honor of 442, our chapter number.  

 

 

What's going on with the Rebels!

Here are the events coming up:

  • April 18th, 2012: Rebels AZA #442 is having a chapter meeting at the Maitland JCC. 
  • April 22nd, 2012: Rebels AZA #442 is having our second annual roast. This year we are roasting Evan Ludin and the Rising Seniors. 
  • April 27th-19th, 2012: North Florida Region's Spring Regional Convention 2012 is being held at the Lake Buena Vista Resort. Having already 30% more registrations than last year, Rebels are super excited for the last regional convention of the year. 

Rebels AZA #442 is currently the largest AZA chapter in North Florida Region #52. 

 

The Impact

Rebels AZA #442 is making a direct impact on the Jewish teens in Orlando.

  1. Rebels have included 6th-8th graders in some programs to reach out to Jewish males before their Bar Mitzvah and before high school starts!
  2. Rebels have more teens registered for Chapter Leadership Training Conference than last year!
  3. Rebels had the largest convention attendance of any chapter at NFR's Kallah this past fall!
  4. Rebels have 48% more members now than at this time last year! 
 

Other Ways You Can Help and Be Involved 

  1. Share this link (http://www.indiegogo.com/442foraza) with everyone you know. Send it to all your BBYO friends from when you were growing up and in Rebels. Indiegogo has awesome sharing tools to connect with more people. 
  2. If you know any Jewish teen in Orlando that would be interested in a BBYO experience, email me their name and contact information, along with their parents name and contact information. 
  3. If you were a Rebel and want to know about more great things we do now and other ways to get involved in North Florida Region BBYO, email maxdkatzen@me.com.

Share this link (http://www.indiegogo.com/442foraza) with everyone you know. Send it to all your BBYO friends from when you were growing up and in Rebels. Indiegogo has awesome sharing tools to connect with more people. 
If you know any Jewish teen in Orlando that would be interested in a BBYO experience, email me their name and contact information, along with their parents name and contact information. 
If you were a Rebel and want to know about more great things we do now and other ways to get involved in North Florida Region BBYO, email maxdkatzen@me.com.

story:
Help us bring an all new, scratch-made, locally grown, wood fired pizzeria to North Orange County

Dj partners and long time friends Steve Foley and Mike Walz have a vision to bring their passion for entertaining and great scratch-made, locally grown food & drink to West Garden Grove Ca. a community that would be greatly served by this amazing concept.

Voodoo Pizzeria will be unlike anything the community of West Garden Grove has ever experienced. Infusing the best elements of New Orleans French Quarter nightlife and Voodoo-centric ambiance with California's gourmet wood fired pizza. Using locally grown ingredients, this restaurant, entertainment & full bar concept is sure to turn heads and delight customers of all ages while serving the community with a unique dining experience.

We need your help to accomplish this task.

As you know, starting a business in any environment (let alone the financial situation we currently find ourselves in) is not easy and costs a boatload of money... that’s where you come in. We’re asking that you help with a donation to generate the seed money we need to reach our goal and take this project to the next level.

What is Indiegogo???

Indiegogo is a new way to fund creative projects through "Crowd Funding". If you're not sure how it works, take a look here and here. Essentially, you pledge funds to help us develop and open Voodoo Pizzeria and we give you cool stuff in return. Check them out over there on the right side bar?

When we reach our fundraising goal, you get the cool stuff that corresponds with your pledge and we get the financial support we need to complete our project. If we don't reach the goal we will use whatever money we do raise as a down payment on our business loan!

We believe in the strength of independent business owners, not that we think corporations are necessarily evil or bad, but when the question is... who can better serve a local community, the answer is always... “those people who live in that community.” We also believe in the strength and cooperation of those independent business owners coming together and helping each other for mutual advantage in order for everyone to prosper.  

We fully intend to be a part of the growing cooperative of small business owners, growers, and restaurants that not only serve each other... but seek to enrich and benefit our community by providing the very best food made with the very best ingredients!

story:
HUMANITY & HOPE:  This Campaign is to fund me to bring support and humanity into Thai Prisons for One Year

For months each year I go daily to several Bangkok prisons to bear witness to foreigner inmates (from Canada, US, Europe, Middle East, etc.) who experience the acute loneliness, emotional pain, and spiritual distress of long-term overseas incarceration in a Thai prison, away from the support of their friends and family. I bring conversation, food, emotional support, laughter, human connection, providing a critical life-line to these isolated people and re-connecting them to the web of humanity. 

In November 2013, I will return to Bangkok prisons to reach out to those suffering. I need funding to do this work for this next year.

MY PURPOSE:  No one should have to endure the extremely long sentences and dehumanizing conditions of Thai prisons. We all deserve to be treated with dignity, humanity, no matter who we are.

WHO I AM:   My name is Heather Luna-Rose. I am a social justice activist, single mom, founder of non-profit Luna-Rose Prisoner Support. I'm a passionate advocate of marginalized people and the marginalized voices in all of us. I’ve worked in violence prevention, and I hold a BA in Psychology & Women’s Studies, a M. Ed, and a post-graduate in Humanitarian Action & Conflict. This unpaid mission I have undertaken for eight years is my soul's work -- I cannot let people be abandonned or forgotten.

WHY I DO THIS:  Many of us suffer in prisons of fear, violence, mental illness, addiction, as well as physical prisons. A survivor of many forms of violence, I spent many years struggling in depression, loneliness, despair and now I reach out with loving kindness to others discarded.

THE IMPACT:  Visiting wounded and marginalized people and reflecting back their inherent worth brings a spark of light, joy and hope to very dark places. Engaging inmates in compassion, respect and dignity has transformational effects in institutions built only for degradation and punishment.

As well as seeing unspeakable pain and suffering in those prisons, and the human capacity for depraved degradation and horror, I also witness the beauty and resilience of the human spirit and the transformational effects of reaching out in kindness and humanity.

WHAT INMATES SAY:   Please read these letters inmates have written to me, explaining what my visits mean, used with their permission: http://thailandprisonersupport.org/intheirwords/

HOW I HAVE FUNDED THIS: I've worked many many jobs (driven taxi, been a tuna-fisher, waitressed, managed a hotel, landscaping, farm labour, etc.) in Canada, sleeping on friend's couches, and saving every penny out of my own pocket to return each Fall to bring hope to inmates. This is not sustainable. I need to be funded. AND I need a salary.

I can't do this alone.  I NEED YOUR HELP! 

WE CAN DO THIS TOGETHER! It is up to us to create the world we want: one of Dignity, Justice, Hope, & Connection.

Most of us want make a difference in the world, we just don’t always know how. Or we feel powerless to in the face of so much that is broken or unjust. We all have it within us to shape our world as we want it to be: one of love, hope, kindness, justice. When we lead from the heart, we re-connect ourselves and each other to our common humanity.

 I have the skills and ability to hold compassionate space in very dark places. I have the passion and commitment to do this work -- I can't sustain this, unfunded. I need your help: I need your contribution. Please contribute to fund me for one year.

 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHERE THE MONEY GOES:

These are some of the basic minimum costs:

1. Airfare from Vancouver to Bangkok, visas, health & travel insurance: ($3000 for 3 months)

2. Transportation in Bangkok, to and from prisons and Embassies: ($700 monthly)

3. Food for inmates: ($1000 monthly)

3. Accommodation: ($500 monthly)

4. Communication: wifi and phone ($400 monthly)

5. Office costs:  Office rental, mailbox rental, document translation, photocopying, faxing, mailing, supplies ($1000/month)

7. Professional Support:  De-briefing, self-care and other professional support services to mitigate the traumatic emotional load and prevent burnout ($500 per month)

For now, let's get me there! To sustain this work, I also need to be paid. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* If we reach $15,000, this is a start. to get me back to supporting inmates in November, 2013.

* If we reach $50,000, we fund my work at the level required for six months bringing support, advocacy, and hope to many inmates.

* IF WE REACH $100,000, this funds Luna-Rose Prisoner Support's work for one year: This means many more inmates in three prisons receiving advocacy, hope, a connection to humanity, a voice, and visitors. I can continue full-time to expand this mission making a positive difference in many many people’s lives!

* $150,000- my work can continue for longer and will fund my work on a documentary: I hope to meet with family members in different countries who cannot visit their loved ones locked up in Thailand, as well as meet ex-inmates to give voice to their stories.

CONTRIBUTE now to this campaign to give HUMANITY & HOPE for one year to forgotten people. Share this video on Facebook, by email, on Twitter.

WEBSITE: http://thailandprisonersupport.org

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SOME OF THE IMPACTS:

Every day I see transformations from showing care and kindness. The ripple effects of joy and hope and light are immeasurable for people with very little hope:

One Australian inmate with melanoma had family who raised money to have medical treatment at a Bangkok hospital, but they couldn’t fly out be there with him. I went to the hospital and secured special permission to sit with him. Normally not allowed any physical contact with inmates, I held his hand for an entire day before and after the surgery that cut cancer off his head, shoulder, back. No one should have to go for that alone.

To help raise awareness of my mission to bring hope to these people, I have put on prison art exhibits, depositing money from the sales of their art into prisoners’ accounts to allow them to purchase food, water, the necessities for survival, not provided by the prison.

In 2010, I sold close to $3000 of art for one Russian inmate from that exhibit. He asked me to send the money to his mother in the Ukraine. When I saw him later that year, the change in this tough Russians man’s posture, demeanour and sense of worth, to be able to contribute from prison. He shed tears describing how it felt to be able to give back to his mother, to erase the feelings of shame he lived with knowing she was suffering the anguish of a son locked already over a decade in a foreign prison and she unable visit him.

PRISONER ART EXHIBITS: 

August, 2010: 'Through The Glass,' Salt Spring Island, BC.

October 2011: 'Hope in Dark Places,' Gastown Tattoo Parlour, Vancouver, BC.


October 17, 2013: Prison Art Opening at Barb’s Bistro, Salt Spring Island, BC. See update video on youtube: Prison Art Exhibit: Salt Spring Island 2013

MEDIA COVERAGE:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Luna.Rose.Prisoner.Support

Twitter: @prisonersupport

Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SrSo2hRctt4&feature=youtu.be

Quarrtsiluna: Imprisonment Issue. September, 2011: http://qarrtsiluni.com/2011/09/08/art-from-bangkwang-prison/

Prison Radio: Community Radio. July 27, 2012: http://archive.org/details/PrisonRadioShow-July272012

Bangkok Post. February 12, 2012: X-http://www.bangkokpost.com/lite/topstories/279432/with-attitude-and-tattoos-hope-is-delivered-to-inmates

Daily Xtra Magazine: Monday, September 30, 2013. http://dailyxtra.com/world/news/queer-bc-woman-brings-hope-people-incarcerated-in-thai-prisons?market=208

also featured on: Shaw Community Cable, The Gulf Islands Driftwood Newspaper, The Fishbowl Magazine, and CFSI-FM Salt Spring Island Radio

story:
Help us expand the Boardroom Cafe.

My name is Katie Clack and I am the owner of the Boardroom Café on 84th and Aurora. My husband Jason moved his business, Motion Boardshop, to our block on Aurora in 2010.  Right away we realized there was a lack of coffee and community gathering space in the neighborhood.  We extensively remodeled our building and opened the Boardroom in August of 2011. The café is now two and a half years old with a solid customer base, a full menu of tasty breakfast burritos, paninis, soups and homemade baked goods.  It’s real, homemade food that uses organic and locally sourced ingredients when possible. 


Since day one, our customers have asked us to stay open later to offer dinner, beer and wine.  However with our small dining space and kitchen we didn’t feel we could accommodate this request until now.

Our former neighbors, the Guitar Store, moved to the opposite end of the block and vacated their space next to us.  We have signed the lease and have already begun renovating the space.  We are building our own wood fired pizza oven and will serve local microbrews on tap along with our favorite wines.  We'll even have growlers to fill and take home with you.

Our Vision

Our goal is to create a casual, family-friendly, neighborhood focused restaurant.  Currently, there is nothing like it in the area, particularly on Aurora.  There is a dense population in our neighborhood tucked between Phinney Ridge and Greenlake, with no real sit-down food options.  In addition to pizza, we will also serve a variety of other items from our wood fired oven, along with an amazing weekend brunch and daily happy hour.  Mimosas and dutch babies anyone?   Here is a rough draft of our proposed menu without prices:



With the additional space we'll also have room for live music from some of the wildly talented musicians at the guitar store, an open mic night, and even trivia.  We'll carve out a nice cozy spot for kids to play while their parents relax and watch the Seahawks or Mariners on one of our TVs.  

Don't worry, our current morning coffee service and famous breakfast burritos aren't going anywhere!  We are simply expanding on our business model.

How the Funds Will Be Used

Remodeling the space next to us is a large undertaking, but we've done it once before and we know how to stretch pennies to the max.  You can rest assured that every cent donated will be put to good use.  Just like we did with our current space, we will be doing 95% of the construction ourselves to save on build out costs (thanks to incredibly helpful friends, family members, and customers!) Your donations will go directly towards...

  • Permitting costs
  • Construction materials
  • Commercial kitchen equipment
  • Plumbing costs to add two new bathrooms
  • Dining tables and chairs

I know it sounds like a lot to ask for $50,000 but realistically, building out a restaurant is incredibly expensive.  We also have investors who are helping to make this project a reality, but we felt strongly about wanting to get the community involved as well so that our loyal supporters can say they were a part of bringing this dream to life.   Unlike with Kickstarter, we will still get all of the funds raised even if we do not meet our goal.

If we hit our goal, please don't stop there!  Any excess funds will be used towards a gelato maker and cold display case! 

What's In It For You?

We have come up with some unique rewards to hook you up with in exchange for your contribution.  For all of you regulars who are already coming in multiple times a week, now is your chance to pay a little, and get a lot in return!  You can see all of them in detail on the right side of the screen.  It's important that you understand that every dollar counts! 

  • Store Gift certificates
  • Lattes or coffee for a year
  • Tickets to exclusive live music events
  • Beer & Wine Samplers
  • Pizza of the Month Club
  • A signed longboard skateboard
  • Private Parties
  • Catering at your home or for your office
  • Have a barstool with your name on it!

PLUS you get to feel all warm and fuzzy inside knowing that you helped lend a hand to a local, family-owned and operated business.  And you will be making this a reality in your neighborhood so you can enjoy our food, drinks, and smiles for many years to come.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, that's OK!  There's still many ways that you can help us by spreading the word about our fundraising campaign.  There is a link on the top of this page that you can click to share via these various channels.

  • Share our Indiegogo link on your Facebook page 
  • Share our Indiegogo link on your Twitter feed and use the hashtag #boardroombuild
  • Email your family and friends with a link to our campaign
  • Share our campaign on your blog
  • Tell your hairstylist, your mailman, your personal trainer or anyone else who will listen!

If you share through Facebook or Twitter (make sure you use the #boardroombuild hashtag), we will be able to track your shares.  Anyone who does so will be entered to win a $100 gift card to the Boardroom.  We're giving away multiple gift cards and every time you share you increase your chances of winning one!

Also, if you have a skill that you think could benefit us (like carpentry, plumbing, masonry, electrical savvy) we would love to trade you for one of our rewards or store credit!  If so, please contact us.


Fine Print About Rewards

  • There is no expiration date on the gift certificates
  • You can give a gift certificate to a friend, they are transferrable!
  • You can absolutely buy more than one reward, in fact, please do!
  • If you live outside the area and claim a reward like the longboard skateboard, we will gladly ship it to you
  • The longboard skateboard in the reward is an Omen Pike longboard wheels, trucks, bearings and grip tape.  You can choose whether you'd like the drop through or top mount version.
  • If you live IN the area, you can pick up your reward (gift card, tshirt etc) at the cafe once the campaign has ended on April 3rd.  
  • For the exclusive concerts, your name will be on a list at the door so you won't need to worry about having a physical ticket


Sending you Many Thanks!

Whether you donate or share our story with your friends, we are forever grateful!  We wouldn't be here today if it wasn't for the support of our loyal followers.  We are truly blessed to be surrounded by such awesome customers and we are so excited to take this cafe to the next level with your support.  

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

Katie, Jason & Jett Clack

Sasha, Sarah, Nicole, Natalie, Chris, Cole and Francie

PLUS you get to feel all warm and fuzzy inside knowing that you helped lend a hand to a local, family-owned and operated business.  And you will be making this a reality in your neighborhood so you can enjoy our food, drinks, and smiles for many years to come.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can’t contribute financially, that's OK!  There's still many ways that you can help us by spreading the word about our fundraising campaign.  There is a link on the top of this page that you can click to share via these various channels.

Share our Indiegogo link on your Twitter feed and use the hashtag #boardroombuild

Email your family and friends with a link to our campaign
Share our campaign on your blog
Tell your hairstylist, your mailman, your personal trainer or anyone else who will listen!
If you share through Facebook or Twitter (make sure you use the #boardroombuild hashtag), we will be able to track your shares.  Anyone who does so will be entered to win a $100 gift card to the Boardroom.  We're giving away multiple gift cards and every time you share you increase your chances of winning one!Also, if you have a skill that you think could benefit us (like 
carpentry, plumbing, masonry, electrical savvy) we would love to trade 
you for one of our rewards or store credit!  If so, please contact us.Fine Print About Rewards
There is no expiration date on the gift certificates
You can give a gift certificate to a friend, they are transferrable!
You can absolutely buy more than one reward, in fact, please do!
If you live outside the area and claim a reward like the longboard skateboard, we will gladly ship it to you
The longboard skateboard in the reward is an Omen Pike longboard wheels, trucks, bearings and grip tape.  You can choose whether you'd like the drop through or top mount version.
If you live IN the area, you can pick up your reward (gift card, tshirt etc) at the cafe once the campaign has ended on April 3rd.  
For the exclusive concerts, your name will be on a list at the door so you won't need to worry about having a physical ticket
Sending you Many Thanks!Whether you donate or share our story with your friends, we are forever grateful!  We wouldn't be here today if it wasn't for the support of our loyal followers.  We are truly blessed to be surrounded by such awesome customers and we are so excited to take this cafe to the next level with your support.  Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!Katie, Jason & Jett ClackSasha, Sarah, Nicole, Natalie, Chris, Cole and Francie

story:
Help me raise fund for raw food living

Hi, my name is Sonia and I am a yoga and raw food teacher.  Just barely a month ago, I was working for Health Care Without Harm - Asia, a non-government organization on environmental health.  Prior to that I worked for the animal rights group, People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) - Asia Pacific, several women's magazine, and did some work as communications and press person for government elected officials.

I have always believed that for us to have a better world, the people living in it should be happy and healthy and we do that by bringing change in their lives - our most important mission.  Having explored many different fields of work, I came to the conclusion that this is best approached from the inside.  Healing through food (and through the heart) is the best medicine.

In 2013, I visited my friend Aloha Jhoanna in Ubud to be part of her water birthing team in Bali.  There I witnessed first hand how people who practiced yoga and eat healthy food are indeed happier and healthier and are making the place they are living in a better place.  I attended raw food classes with Jonny Freesh of Raw Food Bali and fell in love with raw food.  As soon as I got home to Manila, I knew I had to share what I saw in Ubud and have people experience what I did.  I was already teaching yoga at that time.  Then a yoga friend Maybelle Tan Ngo sent me a message asking me to teach a raw food preparation class.  She said, just one class, Sonia.  Another friend, Vina Pastor, said she'll bring students.   

In June 2013, I had my 1st raw food preparation class in a quaint restaurant called Likha Diwa (which literally translates to "create-spirit" or "creative spirit") inside the university.  The place is owned by a fellow yogini, Del Castillo, who let me use the place for free on that trial class.  My niece, Alpha Regine Gil, assisted in the class and have pledged to assist all my classes.  After that, people started asking about it and it was followed by four more classes that same year and another one in 2014.  I knew I had to keep doing it.  I have a few recipes, students who are interested to know more about raw food dishes and its health benefits, and a few more workshops lined-up.  The crew got bigger too with my sister Joyce, my friend Mad Abril, and my 4-year old grandniece Alcee Jhayne assisting and documenting the event.  Another friend, Kat David, sometimes would join too.  

1st Raw Food Preparation Class in June 2013.  From L to R: Alpha, Maybelle, Del, me, Jaz, Edith, Vina, and Janet.  Photo by Ringo of LIkha Diwa.

6th Raw Food Preparation Class just a month ago.  The group keeps getting bigger!  Photo by Joyce G. Astudillo. 

But these are not enough.  I know that if I want to continue teaching and sharing raw food lifestyle to people, I need to have a solid background on the field.  A friend asked if I really need it or is it for vanity.  My answer is, I need it and the people I am sharing it with, need it too.    

In this campaign, I am trying to raise $5000 to fund my Raw Food Chef and Health Educator and Certified in Detox courses at Pure Joy Academy for a month and a lifetime of sharing raw food.  I know this is my passion, my curriculum in life.  I knew that the day I left my job to pursue full time yoga and raw food teaching.  I know I am on the right track and I wish you will join me in my journey.

Loving the raw food teaching life!  Photo by Mad Abril.

What I Need & What You Get

A good raw food meal needs green salad with a sumptuous dressing, chilled soup, smoothies, a main dish, and a dessert.  

Your contribution will help fund parts of:  

  • Green salad with a sumptuous dressing = Airfare.  I currently live in Manila and will fly to Ubud to attend the course that will run for 27 days.  Flights are a bit pricey but nowadays, we never ran out of promo fares.  They say, it's not about the destination but the journey, and I say, indeed my best journeys are via promo fares.
  • Chilled soup = Accommodation.  Throughout the duration of the course, I will be staying in Ubud and have requested for the best valued (translation: smallest and cheapest) accommodation.
  • Smoothies = Certified in Detox course.  This will run for 5 days on the 4th week of the program and will focus on different cleansing and healing modalities.
  • Main Dish = Raw Food Chef and Health Educator Certification Course Levels 1 to 3.  In this 15-days, I get to learn more about raw food preparation and the theories behind it.
  • Dessert = Pocket money.  I live on little and any help on this will go a long way.

Tabboulleh.  Photo by Mad Abril.

Chilled Corn Chowder.  Photo by Joyce G. Astudillo.

Superfood Smoothies.  Notice the sweet couple behind the smoothies :)  Photo by Joyce G. Astudillo.

Ratatouille.  Photo by my 4-year old niece, Alcee Jhayne A. Gil.

Apple Crumble.  Photo by Mad Abril.


The perks of sharing  

  • Perks will come in the form of energy work: yoga, pilates, reiki, chi nei tsang, and detox coaching.  Most of which may be availed online.  Will talk more about that in the Perks section, so please keep reading!
  • Paying it forward.  Just like in the past, I pay forward any blessings received and I encourage those I paid it forward to, to pay it forward, and so on...
  • Soon after my course, I will hold a free raw food class for all my funders - those in the Philippines and those abroad (via webcam).

In case of emergency... 

  • In case I don't reach the entire goal, I will keep appealing to kind and like-minded hearts until I do.

The Impact

What difference your help will make.  HUGE.  The $5000 will fund a month of training and a lifetime of sharing healthy living. 

In the workshops I have done, my students range from just-curious-checking-out-what's-new types, to vegetarians and vegans wanting new recipes or transitioning to raw food, and cancer patients.  The lessons I will learn in the course will be passed on forward to my students who I believe will share it to their families and friends.  Other workshops outside Manila are also lined-up and will include yoga and meditation. 

And everyone eats healthy.  Photo by Joyce G. Astudillo.

Another service I offer is Take Me Home by Raw Yogini Sonia where I prepare set raw lunch and dinner for those who don't have time to prepare their food.

There is also a plan for Raw Food Offerings and a twice a month Raw Food Days in a new restaurant.

Halva.  Photo by Mad Abril.

In all this, I share what I learn and I share it at a rate affordable to many.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough and I know not everyone can help raise funds.  But there are other ways to help!

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Share the campaign in Facebook, Twitter, and other Social Media platform.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Visit my page Facebook.com/RawYoginiSonia and join me in this journey.
  • Send loving vibes all day long.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Mike Gerdes and we have created a tool to get more money into community fundraisers than ever before.  I worked for Johnson & Johnson for 17 years and have been an entrepreneur for the past 7 years including a start-up to help new moms see their ultrasounds (www.BebeVu.com).  I am always looking for ways to help the community and how to be the best father to my 4 girls.  

The mission of Playing it Foreward is to help schools, charities, foundations, and other fundraisers achieve their goals by using a web based platform that engages the community.  Most people have seen the effort put into a large charity or fundraising event to only see their tremendous effort fall short because they were unable to reach the community, spread the word and engage donors in a meaningful way.   

Basically, this tool allows for social networking to engage many people to play golf or donate money for the requested charity.  The website allows the donor to play their own course on their own time and upload the score to compete for prizes.  Scores are adjusted automatically to level the playing field based on course difficulty, handicap and score.  This method allows all levels of skill compete in the fundraising tournament- and ultimately opens the tournament to many more donors that would not have played. 

Overall, any course, any time, any player, to raise more money, more efficiently than ever before! The best part is-THERE IS NO ADDITIONAL COST TO THE ORGANIZER! IT IS COMPLETELY FREE FOR THE COMMUNITY ORGANIZER!


What We Need & What You Get

Our website is done.  We are raising money to market this tool to communities (schools, churches, local charity chapters) nationwide.  Since seeing the success of our first tournaments, we know our biggest hurdle is awareness to the people that need this tool to save time, and raise a lot more money for their cause.  This will result in more of the money going to the cause. 

Reaching out to schools, churches and many of the local chapters of respected charities and educating them about a better way to run their golf outings, will help them raise more money.  All funds will be put towards this marketing effort to make this a nationwide tool. 

The PERKS


Our perks are based on helping your own community!  How cool is that?  We are also offering some other cool perks to help get your community effort underway, along with a funny t-shirt and other great golf products.



The Impact

With Playing it Foreward there are many ways to make an impact.  From being an organizer, a donor/player, or someone who tells someone else how they can improve their golf outing with Playing it Forward; all of these little things make a big difference. 

Our mission is to provide this easy to use tool for FREE to any fundraising effort for any event.
Great missions have great results. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please forward our link to anyone you know that is involved in a fundraiser.  We will be there to help them. Thank you.

story:
The Short

I am Andrei. This campaign was began to help my small business grow to be a stand alone entity and impact the healthy community. The popularity of Zapples has grown so much that production needs to be tripled and by the end of the campaign probably quadrupled. The donations will make this happen!

The Short List

Here is what is needed:

  • Ovens, pans, processors
  • Knives, cutting boards, containment, refrigerators
  • More developed web and media platform
  • Business infrastructure development including management software
  • Train employees

The Impact

We need more development of DELICIOUS, healthy snacks. 

You can help make this a part of the world and our community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can't help.

Pass it and push it! Use your resources to make people aware of this and make sure that we use Indiegogo's share tools! Together, we can get the word out there.


EI

story:
“The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.”

Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.

I have always believed in the existence of liberty and justice for all. Unfortunately, in today’s society, liberty and justice are very expensive and sometimes unaffordable to the common man or woman. I am one of those common persons. I desperately need your help in raising $5000 by September 3, 2013 to pay the retainer fee for an attorney to serve as an expert witness in a legal malpractice case I filed pro se in May 2013.  I was unable to afford the $20,000 retainer fee required to engage an attorney to file the legal malpractice case on my behalf prior to the statute of limitation expiring for my case. If I had not filed my case pro se in May 2013, I would have been unable to file my case once the statute of limitation had passed.

Each time I spoke with an attorney regarding legal representation in this case, I felt devastated by the staggering fees presented to me for legal representation. Prior to five years ago, I could have budgeted carefully, and saved $20,000 over a two or three year period of time. However, five years ago, my life changed drastically.  Circumstances beyond my control resulted in a sudden loss of most of my income and left me suddenly without sufficient finances and personally unable to afford an attorney for very pressing legal matters.  My leading witness for my case was dead and as I felt that person’s testimony was critical to my defense and winning my case, I was convinced by the attorney afforded me that it was in my best interest to enter into a plea deal. 

Dissatisfied with the plea agreement my attorney advised me to agree to, I sought other legal advice regarding my case.  Approximately one and a half years later, I discovered that the great majority of the information this attorney gave me, as well as the legal advice given to me by another attorney he referred me to were not only grossly misleading representations of the truth, but were outright falsehoods.  I consulted several attorneys who informed me that the whirlwind of legal wrongdoings both of these attorneys have committed against me constitute legal malpractice. They further informed me my cases were complex and would require $20,000 to $40,000 retainer fees.  At that point, my hope of legal representation and justice appeared remote, if not impossible.

I continued to pray and search for an attorney to represent me. I was referred to an attorney and legal expert to represent me in both of these cases.  Unfortunately, I am totally unable to afford their retainer fees of $5000 each for each case ($20,000 total).  I need $10,000 by September 3, 2013 to retain both attorneys, however, my main attorney says he will assist me legally if I am able to secure an affidavit from my expert witness attorney ($5,000 retainer fee required) and pay him $1000 of his $5000 retainer fee.

I am a divorced mother of three children, two of whom are in college and the third is a senior in high school and will be entering college August 2014.  By August 2014, all three children will be in college at the same time. It is very difficult to save any money under these conditions.

As I mentioned previously, I filed my claim against the first attorney pro se to avoid the statute of limitations from expiring in that case.  The second case’s statute of limitation will expire November 29, 2013.  Without your help, I will be unable to afford the retainer fees for my attorneys and my case will be dismissed if the affidavit from my expert witness is not received by September 3, 2013.  My case’s dismissal would be devastating financially and emotionally as my family and I have suffered many financial and personal losses due to the bad legal advice and poor representation I received from both of these attorneys.

I desperately need an attorney to represent me in these cases.  Please help. Any and all contributions will be appreciated. I still believe that “the arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.” God bless you.
